jobText: TXT/50275674.txt	§Intermediate Graphic Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Graphic Designer§§Advertiser: §Catch Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Intermediate Graphic Designer §      §        §Are you a talented designer capable of world-class creative design that will ensure our product presentation is exceptional? Are you creative and innovative? Do you enjoy learning about technical products? If so this could well be the opportunity you have been waiting for!§        §Our Client "Vynco Industries", are a leading distributor of electrical components and solutions both within New Zealand and abroad.  They are looking for a dynamic, motivated and creative Graphic Designer to be responsible for all advertising, product packaging, and design related activities. Innovation is a key company value and your ability to think outside of the box is crucial! This diverse role will explore areas such as environmental sustainability, the latest interior and architectural trends, and how best to highlight the importance of research and development.§        §Your day to day responsibilities will include:§        §          §Creating or updating product brochures, company profiles, price books and technical product documents§          §Creating templates for junior designers to work from§          §Reviewing and proofing design work§          §Pricebook creation and review§          §Designing artwork for external advertising§          §Liaising with external advertising channels§          §Managing company websites ensuring they are kept up to date including content management of images, brochures and text§          §Design of packaging for factory production and new product packaging design and coordination with overseas and local suppliers§        §        §To be successful in this role you will:§        §          §Hold a relevant design degree/qualification§          §7 - 10 years experience with a mix of job experience §          §Experienced in print media (vs digital)§          §Be someone ‘processes-minded’, who can help organise a department going through growth§          §Management experience not needed, but informal leadership experience welcome§          §Interested in the electrical industry or some kind of technical savvy (e.g. if someone has always worked in design for fashion probably not a good fit for us§          §Have excellent communication skills in all forms including written, oral, email, telephone and presentation§          §Strong comprehension of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign, as well as Microsoft Office skills (Vynco utilise PC System)§          §Web experience desirable although not essential§          §Be agile and flexible when working with shifting briefs always demonstrating excellent service to your clients§          §Target driven with the ability to take on board constructive criticism and work collaboratively to find solutions§          §Excellent organisational and time management skills, including file management§          §High degree of accuracy and attention to detail§          §A strategic thinker who is a confident and competent decision maker§        §        §This is a diverse role with an industry leader. If you think you have the skills, passion and drive to be successful in this role, we would love to hear from you!§        §This is a full-time role; however hours can be flexible working either 7.30am – 4.00pm or 8.30am -5.00pm. §        §Please apply online to Steph with a copy of your CV, a copy of your portfolio (either online or as PDF max.2MB) and a covering letter, or for an informal chat about the role please call Steph on 021 801 034.§      §      §Steph Townsend§021801034§steph.townsend@catchconsulting.co.nz§ §    §    §  §§§Are you a talented designer capable of world-class creative design that will ensure our product presentation is exceptional? Are you creative and innovative? Do you enjoy learning about technical products? If so this could well be the opportunity you have been waiting for!§  §Our Client "Vynco Industries", are a leading distributor of electrical components and solutions both within New Zealand and abroad.  They are looking for a dynamic, motivated and creative Graphic Designer to be responsible for all advertising, product packaging, and design related activities. Innovation is a key company value and your ability to think outside of the box is crucial! This diverse role will explore areas such as environmental sustainability, the latest interior and architectural trends, and how best to highlight the importance of research and development.§  §Your day to day responsibilities will include:§ § §Creating or updating product brochures, company profiles, price books and technical product documents§ §Creating templates for junior designers to work from§ §Reviewing and proofing design work§ §Pricebook creation and review§ §Designing artwork for external advertising§ §Liaising with external advertising channels§ §Managing company websites ensuring they are kept up to date including content management of images, brochures and text§ §Design of packaging for factory production and new product packaging design and coordination with overseas and local suppliers§ §To be successful in this role you will:§ § §Hold a relevant design degree/qualification§ §7 - 10 years experience with a mix of job experience § §Experienced in print media (vs digital)§ §Be someone ‘processes-minded’, who can help organise a department going through growth§ §Management experience not needed, but informal leadership experience welcome§ §Interested in the electrical industry or some kind of technical savvy (e.g. if someone has always worked in design for fashion probably not a good fit for us§ §Have excellent communication skills in all forms including written, oral, email, telephone and presentation§ §Strong comprehension of Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign, as well as Microsoft Office skills (Vynco utilise PC System)§ §Web experience desirable although not essential§ §Be agile and flexible when working with shifting briefs always demonstrating excellent service to your clients§ §Target driven with the ability to take on board constructive criticism and work collaboratively to find solutions§ §Excellent organisational and time management skills, including file management§ §High degree of accuracy and attention to detail§ §A strategic thinker who is a confident and competent decision maker§ §This is a diverse role with an industry leader. If you think you have the skills, passion and drive to be successful in this role, we would love to hear from you!§  §This is a full-time role; however hours can be flexible working either 7.30am – 4.00pm or 8.30am -5.00pm. §  §Please apply online to Steph with a copy of your CV, a copy of your portfolio (either online or as PDF max.2MB) and a covering letter, or for an informal chat about the role please call Steph on 021 801 034.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50526455.txt	§Architectural Technician / Graduate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Architectural Technician / Graduate§§Advertiser: §Sorted Architecure Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§Sorted Architecture is an award-winning practice, based in the heart of Wanaka with an exciting opportunity for an experienced technician to join our team.§  §If you have a thorough understanding of the NZ building code, standards and construction practices and have a detailed, methodical approach to your work, this could be the position for you. §  §At Sorted Architecture, we like to foster a supportive professional environment and can provide ample opportunity for career development to the right applicant. As we are a busy practice, it is also important that you are confident in using your own initiative to complete tasks.§ §The ideal candidate will have:§ § §Relevant NZCAD qualifications and/or a BArch degree§ §A minimum of 3+ years of architectural experience in New Zealand.§ §Advanced knowledge of ArchiCad and BIM modelling experience is a prerequisite.§ §A proven ability to produce accurate detailed drawings within deadlines.§ §An in-depth understanding of New Zealand building code, standards, industry best practices and sound knowledge of general residential construction.§ §Design experience is beneficial.§ §You’ll be confident and motivated with the ability to work unsupervised.§Effective communication skills are essential as you will be required to communicate with our team, councils, engineers, subcontractors and clients. Effective time management and determination to meet deadlines is a must.§  §However, we also understand that life isn’t all about work! We are a flexible employer that values work/life balance so you’ll be able to take full advantage of Lake Wanaka, the ski fields, bike tracks and amazing weather on your doorstep!§ §  §If you think you are a good fit to become Sorted Architecture’s next Technician, please send apply on-line with a cover letter and CV. Following initial screening, a portfolio of your work may be requested so, please have this available. to jan@sortedarchitecture.co.nz. §  §Applicants for this position must have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§  § §  § §  § §  § §  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as an architectural technician?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§Have you completed a qualification in architecture?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

We are now seeking a Project Coordinator to join the Frobisher Project Team with immediate start dates.  Working closely with project team members, managers and colleagues and supporting the Projects Team Manager to help deliver the company's client projects efficiently. The Project Coordinator's manage the administrative tasks, such as document and information distribution, and cohesive communication support. This role requires excellent communication skills, the ability to develop and maintain strong relationships and proven experience in meeting deadlines§  §This role involves creating and monitoring project plans, schedules, quotes, processing orders, participating in a variety of company meetings, and ensuring that project deadlines are met in a timely manner.§  §Please note this position is administration only. Whilst an interest in interiors could be helpful, this job will not require any Interior Design skills. §  §This role would best suit either someone who has an analytical background with a high attention to accuracy, is confident in using spreadsheets with an administrative focus, or someone who is already working in a project admin/coordinator role: § § §The project team coordinates multiple, complex and varied interior projects§ §Project planning alongside Interior Designers and Project Team members§ §Building great working relationships§ §Liaising and coordinating with specialist trades, architects, contractors, suppliers and clients§ §Meeting or exceeding expectations on project delivery timeframes§ §Proactive in identifying potential risks and able to implement solutions in a timely manner§ §Detailed, accurate and systematic record keeping§ §Maintenance of a project-level timelines showing key milestones across all active projects § §Working well with others in the team to contribute to successful outcomes in-line with our values. § §Key Skills:§ § §Able to work collaboratively with multiple stakeholders§ §Can rapidly adapt and respond to a fast-paced and changing environment§ §Able to present information clearly and concisely§ §High level of initiative, articulate, able to work autonomously§ §Highly organised with great time management skills§ §Has great attention to detail§ §You are an analytical thinker and solution focused§ §We prefer you to have had experience managing a large number of tasks in complex environments§ §Calm under pressure§ §Intermediate computer skills§ §Ideally you have 2+ years of experience in a similar co-ordination/administration role and are you are keen to pursue your professional development§ §Experience with Workflow Max is an advantage but not essential§ §This is a full time role, Monday to Friday 8:30am - 5pm§  §All applications will be treated in confidence. Please note: You must have a relevant visa to work in New Zealand.§  §APPLY VIA SEEK ONLY PLEASE§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a project coordinator?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

This will see you taking your projects from initial client briefing, developed/concept design right through to documentation, consent and construction. The complete process from start to finish. As an architect you will also be involved with mentoring and further developing more junior members of staff.§ § §What you’ll need to succeed§ To be successful in this role you need to be a registered architect or close to obtaining your registration. You must be proficient in using ArchiCAD or Revit. Communication and your ability to present and relay information is key to being successful in this role.§ § §What you’ll get in return§ This practice offers the opportunity to work within a supportive and well-structured environment. You will be working within a team of qualified and professional individuals on a variety of amazing projects, enabling you to grow your portfolio. This practice offers career progression and the ability to further develop within the business. You will have the support of other Senior Architects/Directors to assist and help you develop your skillset - some of the best in the industry.§ § §What you need to do now§ Please contact me immediately if you are interested in this position. However, if you are a Architectural professional looking to advance your career but this role is not of interest, please contact me on the number below to discuss several other positions I have available.§ § For further information please contact Simon Bryce - §simon.bryce@hays.net.nz§ or call me on the following phone number: §033776656§§§§

& Interaction Design§§§§§§Senior/Intermediate Product Designer (part-time)§ § §  §About us§  §Capital Preferences is an innovative financial technology and research company that believes consumer actions speak louder than words.  Our ground-breaking software is helping global financial services firms to gamify and personalise the investment experience, while generating a deeper understanding of how consumers make decisions with their money.  We do this all while also meeting emerging regulatory standards and guidelines.§  §Everything we do is data-driven.  Our team of world-leading decision scientists are continuously generating new academic insights.  Our Product Designers have the unique opportunity to collaborate with the academic team to transform their insights into world-leading digital experiences.  §  §We profile customers using proprietary gamified tools that reveal each investor’s unique behaviour.  Our approach is underpinned by the latest behavioural economics, game theory, and econometrics research, leading to more predictive and compliant measures than psychology-based questionnaires.  Our methods were invented by our co-founder Shachar Kariv Ph.D., former Chair of the Economics Department at UC Berkeley, and a team of leading researchers and product innovators.§  §We are globally acclaimed.  Our research has been published in top journals such as Science and the American Economic Review, and our product has won awards at the UBS Future of Finance Competition in Zurich, IMAS Bloomberg Reimaging Tomorrow Conference in Singapore, and many more. §  §We operate out of Berkeley (California), Christchurch, and Auckland.§  § §  §What you can expect...§  §As a Senior Product Designer, you will create industry-leading software that delights investors and surpasses stakeholder expectations.  You’ll have the opportunity to work on a variety of innovative products at various levels of maturity, from early concept to high-fidelity UI.  You’ll be working with an experienced and supportive product team, who are passionate about driving value through design.    §  §The right candidate will be invited to join a long-standing team in a permanent role, with potential growth and leadership opportunities.  You would be working full-time in New Zealand, initially working from home, moving to a flexible combination of home and office.§  § §  §What you’ll be good at…§  §Ideally, we would love to hear from applicants who have experience in the FinTech or e-learning sectors, a deep understanding of the Design Thinking process, and experience working in Agile teams (or similar). §  §You’ll be an expert at taking complex, real-world problems and generating imaginative designs to help resolve these problems.  Here’s what else you’ll bring to the table…§ § § §Proficiency in the development of wireframes, low-to-hi-fidelity prototypes, detailed design outputs, and the provision of design support to development teams;§  § § §A strong command of Sketch, Figma, and InVision tools for prototyping, testing, and knowledge of how to share and transfer design artifacts to development teams§  § § §Experience extracting findings and insights from usability testing sessions and integrating findings into the design of the products;§  § § §An ability to establish, build on, and maintain a design system that ensures quality and consistency across everything we design and build;§  § § §A fluid approach.  We’re lean, agile, and growing, so 20% of your role is unknowable.  You’ll need to be ok with that ambiguity, but at the same time, you’ll have a chance to shape where we put our energy.§  § § §  §While not essential to the role, we are also interested in applicants with these skills...§ § § §Experience recruiting participants for exploratory in-depth interviews, conducting interviews, and accurately capturing the findings and insights.§  § § §Leading small UI/UX teams§  § § §Collaborating on sales presentations, website creation, and marketing collateral§  § § §  § Other requirements to consider...§ § § §You are likely to have 5+ years designing digital experiences, products, services, and/or solutions that demonstrate a high level of empathy for the end-user§  § § §Curious, questioning, and eager to be involved§  § § §Exceptionally organised, efficient and good at self-management§  § § §Experience delivering software that meets WCAG§  § § §Excellent communication, collaboration, facilitation, and an entrepreneurial streak. §  § § §Ability to work in multidisciplinary teams §  § § §Evidence of being a self-starter with an aptitude for identifying problems and creating solutions§  §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a product designer?§§§

You'll be designing and managing these solutions by working closely with our in house creative and marketing teams along with local and international suppliers to deliver timely and quality products.§ § § §The successful candidate will have a great creative brain and design flair combined with a balanced blend of organization and structure, taking our products from idea’s through to manufacturing and the global market.§ §Key responsibilities include:§ §Research§ § § §Actively engage in research at all stages of the design process including user, technical, design, market and competitive landscape.§ § § §Investigate and assess the feasibility and pathway for new product development “Discovery” projects§ § §Design & Development§ § § §Development of a wide range of ideas and concepts for new and existing products.§ § § §Use sketching, prototyping and 3D Modelling to develop design solutions.§ § § §Understand that products are part of a wider product system and ensure that design is not done in isolation.§ § § §Coordinating key contractors and suppliers to support the delivery of  new products in time with the Product road map§ § §Production§ § § §Understand a wide range of production / manufacturing techniquesCreate detailed documentation to support product prototype and mass production for suppliers§ § § §Apply quality control to our suppliers to ensure the best result. Active communication with clients and R&D partners in both China and Taiwan§ § §Intellectual Property§ § § §Development and Identification of novel IP that KRS can protect.§ § § §Support the Communication with IP Attorneys on the definition and protection of IP.§ § § § §General Administration§ § § §Any other design or administrative tasks as reasonably requested. § § § §This may include general office duties, support documentation, records maintenance, scheduling/booking events and travel.§ § §Experience/Skills Required:§ § § §Essential§ § § §Have empathy for the end user and solve problems for real people, don’t design for designers..§ § § §Always design with form, aesthetics, economics and user driven insights at the forefront.§ § § §Have a broad understanding of design processes and be able to implement a range of different design methods to create novel designs and extract insights from users.§ § § §Excellent sketching and presentation skills.§ § § §The ability to rapidly mock-up prototypes and know when perfection is required and hen lo-fi prototypes will do the job.§ § § §Be a creative thinker and willing to challenge existing information and precedents.§ § § §Be able to develop coherent idea’s and know when to stand for your decisions and when to take feedback.§ § § §Highly proficient in detailed documentation for prototype and production designs§ § § §Highly proficient in CAD design and Adobe Creative suite§ § §Beneficial§ § § §High quality 3D rendering skills.§ § § §Proficient in photography and image processing.§ § § §Previous experience with manufacturing communications in China and Taiwan§ § § § §To apply, please email your cover letter and CV to §careers@kidsrideshotgun.com§. §§§§

Production and processing of applications, tender and construction project specific documentation§          §Quality assurance compliance and project delivery§          §Carry out on site construction supervision, site inspections, and reports§          §Actively contribute to the development and implementation of overall company strategies§        §        § §        §We offer a competitive remuneration package, work life balance with flexible working, a performance bonus scheme, on-the-job training and ongoing career development.  We have just renovated the Studio - so you get to work in our newly created work space.§        § §        §About you§        §          §NZRAB Registered preferred and NZIA membership§          §Ideally 6-7 years+ experience, working in a similar role as a Senior, Associate or Principal Architect. Strong experience in commercial projects is an advantage§          §Commitment to design excellence, with extensive design knowledge from conceptual design, preliminary, developed and detailed design, to tendering and contract administration§          §Demonstrated successful project delivery§          §Experience in BIM and BIM Management§          §Knowledge and skills with Revit building suite is an advantage§          §Conversant with all current relevant NZ Building Codes, statutory requirements, Acts and Codes§          §A high level of commercial awareness and financial competency§          §Aptitude to make informed decisions independently§          §Thrive on a challenge and be motivated to provide innovative solutions for our clients§          §Strong attention to detail and accuracy§          §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§          §Extremely project focused§        §        §About us§        §Kirk Roberts Consulting is a multi-discipline professional services company with over 100 employees providing Structural, Geotechnical, Fire, Civil and Environmental Engineering Services, including Architectural, Project Management, and Engineering Software to a range of clients across New Zealand, from our offices in Christchurch, Auckland, Hamilton and Tauranga. §        § §        §At Kirk Roberts the heart of our business is innovation and finding a better way is why we exist.  Our company was founded to challenge the norm and push boundaries, so we can bring our clients advanced design solutions that drive efficiencies.§        § §        §To apply§        §Please send your latest CV and covering letter to: §recruitment@kirkroberts.co.nz§. Please note, that all applicants must be domiciled in New Zealand and be eligible for permanent employment in NZ, with either a NZ Passport, residency, or current work visa.§      §      §      §    §    §kirkroberts.co.nz §    §Engineering §|§ Projects §|§ Capital §|§ Software§    §Auckland §▪§ Hamilton §▪§ Tauranga §▪§ Christchurch§  §§§We have an exciting opportunity for an experienced Architect to join our growing team in Christchurch. Our architectural team has recently welcomed an experienced leader to further develop and grow our Architecture discipline and we are looking for a Project Architect to work nationally on large, complex, and exciting projects, across a range of sectors.  If you have the drive to find better ways, enjoy the challenge of managing and delivering on projects, then we want to hear from you.§ § § §About the role§ §With a strong pipeline of projects ahead, you will support our Principal Architect with the development and growth of the department, working collaboratively with the architectural design team to create innovative ideas and design techniques.§ § § §Working closely with your team, engineers and project managers; from preliminary design through production and management of architectural design and coordination, through to on-site construction to successful delivery of complex projects.§ § § § §Lead the preparation of project deliverables§ §Assist with the development and growth of the department’s design scope into other sectors§ §Liaise and develop relationships with new and existing clients, local authorities, contractors and sub consultants§ §Prepare comprehensive architectural drawings/specifications and associated documents and reports§ §Creation of detailed CAD drawings for concept, application, tender and construction. Production and processing of applications, tender and construction project specific documentation§ §Quality assurance compliance and project delivery§ §Carry out on site construction supervision, site inspections, and reports§ §Actively contribute to the development and implementation of overall company strategies§ § § §We offer a competitive remuneration package, work life balance with flexible working, a performance bonus scheme, on-the-job training and ongoing career development.  We have just renovated the Studio - so you get to work in our newly created work space.§ § § §About you§ § §NZRAB Registered preferred and NZIA membership§ §Ideally 6-7 years+ experience, working in a similar role as a Senior, Associate or Principal Architect. Strong experience in commercial projects is an advantage§ §Commitment to design excellence, with extensive design knowledge from conceptual design, preliminary, developed and detailed design, to tendering and contract administration§ §Demonstrated successful project delivery§ §Experience in BIM and BIM Management§ §Knowledge and skills with Revit building suite is an advantage§ §Conversant with all current relevant NZ Building Codes, statutory requirements, Acts and Codes§ §A high level of commercial awareness and financial competency§ §Aptitude to make informed decisions independently§ §Thrive on a challenge and be motivated to provide innovative solutions for our clients§ §Strong attention to detail and accuracy§ §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§ §Extremely project focused§ §About us§ §Kirk Roberts Consulting is a multi-discipline professional services company with over 100 employees providing Structural, Geotechnical, Fire, Civil and Environmental Engineering Services, including Architectural, Project Management, and Engineering Software to a range of clients across New Zealand, from our offices in Christchurch, Auckland, Hamilton and Tauranga. § § § §At Kirk Roberts the heart of our business is innovation and finding a better way is why we exist.  Our company was founded to challenge the norm and push boundaries, so we can bring our clients advanced design solutions that drive efficiencies.§ § § §To apply§ §Please send your latest CV and covering letter to: §recruitment@kirkroberts.co.nz§. Please note, that all applicants must be domiciled in New Zealand and be eligible for permanent employment in NZ, with either a NZ Passport, residency, or current work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a project architect?§§§

jobTitle: UX Designers - (UX/UI) Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50564000.txt	§UX Designers - (UX/UI)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§UX Designers - (UX/UI)§§Advertiser: §Woolworths NZ Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§14 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §UX Designers - (UX/UI) §        §          §Countdown continues to drive innovation from the front within NZ’s online retail landscape and remains genuinely committed to making Kiwi’s lives a little better every day.  Whether we are doing our bit for the environment or helping people get their groceries in ways that better fit their busy lives, at Countdown we work hard to create great experiences and drive positive change in the communities we serve.  §          § The CountdownX tribe are at the heart of delivering innovation to our teams and customers working across our digital and ecommerce services for an enhanced, more connected shopper experience.  From our website, mobile services, technology for teams in store, through to end-to-end physical service design, we are dedicated to applying Customer 1st thinking in all we do.  We are innovators, instigators and love solving complex problems. We test and we learn but remain humble whilst sharing our success. We work end-to-end within an Agile model that allows us to deliver quickly and be ahead of the game.§          § Working largely in enhancing our online shopping experience we are looking for two contract UX Designers with expertise spanning the broad spectrum of Experience Design from research through to journey and interaction design, including those with a strong interest also in the UI end of the process.§          § We are looking for enthusiastic, curious individuals who want to apply their UX and UI  craft to specific initiatives to support the overall Countdown digital experience strategy.§          §This is your chance to make a genuine impact and help create a world class digital retailing experience! §          § Your key responsibilities will see you§          §            § Problem solving using Design Thinking  approaches to create experiences that meet customer and business needs taking into account technology and real-life constraints.  §            §              §Working collaboratively with our UX strategists, Product Owners and cross-functional squads to take or generate ideas and insights and define the real problems, goals and opportunities to solve for.  §            §            §              §Mapping user flows, sketching and producing prototypes (low- and hi-fidelity), as well as testing with customers. §            §            §              §Utilising your expert understanding of the formal elements of design (layout, typography, colour, motion) to create design patterns and UI designs that are accessible and fit for the problem space you need to solve, while maintaining cohesiveness across our digital touchpoints. §            §          §          § Contributing to our overall goal of achieving a single, seamless service across all of our touchpoints, you will need to be: §          §            §              §Experienced in designing for multiple platforms and touchpoints, particularly mobile first responsive web §            §            §              §Highly proficient with design and prototyping tools§            §            §              §Confident in articulating your design rationale to cross-functional teams and stakeholders§            §            §              §Pragmatic in identifying how a design can be delivered incrementally (or adjusted) to release value and learn quickly.§            §          §          § There has never been a better time to join the tribe at CountdownX and the largest retailer in Australasia.  Our UX team directly influences the web, mobile and in store experiences for our customers and the tools and technology for our teams.  You should definitely find out more! Apply today or call Jo Lloyd Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist to discuss today.  §09 2552231§        §        §        §      §      §    §  §§§Countdown continues to drive innovation from the front within NZ’s online retail landscape and remains genuinely committed to making Kiwi’s lives a little better every day.  Whether we are doing our bit for the environment or helping people get their groceries in ways that better fit their busy lives, at Countdown we work hard to create great experiences and drive positive change in the communities we serve.  § § The CountdownX tribe are at the heart of delivering innovation to our teams and customers working across our digital and ecommerce services for an enhanced, more connected shopper experience.  From our website, mobile services, technology for teams in store, through to end-to-end physical service design, we are dedicated to applying Customer 1st thinking in all we do.  We are innovators, instigators and love solving complex problems. We test and we learn but remain humble whilst sharing our success. We work end-to-end within an Agile model that allows us to deliver quickly and be ahead of the game.§ § Working largely in enhancing our online shopping experience we are looking for two contract UX Designers with expertise spanning the broad spectrum of Experience Design from research through to journey and interaction design, including those with a strong interest also in the UI end of the process.§ § We are looking for enthusiastic, curious individuals who want to apply their UX and UI  craft to specific initiatives to support the overall Countdown digital experience strategy.§ §This is your chance to make a genuine impact and help create a world class digital retailing experience! § § Your key responsibilities will see you§ § § Problem solving using Design Thinking  approaches to create experiences that meet customer and business needs taking into account technology and real-life constraints.  § § §Working collaboratively with our UX strategists, Product Owners and cross-functional squads to take or generate ideas and insights and define the real problems, goals and opportunities to solve for.  § § § §Mapping user flows, sketching and producing prototypes (low- and hi-fidelity), as well as testing with customers. § § § §Utilising your expert understanding of the formal elements of design (layout, typography, colour, motion) to create design patterns and UI designs that are accessible and fit for the problem space you need to solve, while maintaining cohesiveness across our digital touchpoints. § § § Contributing to our overall goal of achieving a single, seamless service across all of our touchpoints, you will need to be: § § § §Experienced in designing for multiple platforms and touchpoints, particularly mobile first responsive web § § § §Highly proficient with design and prototyping tools§ § § §Confident in articulating your design rationale to cross-functional teams and stakeholders§ § § §Pragmatic in identifying how a design can be delivered incrementally (or adjusted) to release value and learn quickly.§ § § There has never been a better time to join the tribe at CountdownX and the largest retailer in Australasia.  Our UX team directly influences the web, mobile and in store experiences for our customers and the tools and technology for our teams.  You should definitely find out more! Apply today or call Jo Lloyd Senior Talent Acquisition Specialist to discuss today.  §09 2552231§§§§

Are you keen to build your ARCHICAD expertise? Are you looking for exposure to BIM in New Zealand’s leading practices?§ §This is a great opportunity to further develop your skills using ARCHICAD, BIM and communications skills and get exposure to New Zealand’s leading architectural practices!§ §For more than 25 years Central Innovation has been Australia and New Zealand's leading supplier of BIM software for the architectural profession. We have earned a reputation for delivering the very best design and BIM technology such as ARCHICAD, Solibri, and the Ci Tools.§ §We currently have an opening for a BIM Specialist with at least 5 years experience in using ARCHICAD, Solibri or Revit in our Takapuna office.§ §Join a team of dedicated specialists who are the best in their field. This role offers you the chance to further develop your already strong ARCHICAD, Solibri, Rhino Grasshopper and BIM skills to become a real expert.§ § § §Roles & responsibilities: § §This role offers variety, including visiting key clients and providing technical expertise to them. From working with sales to develop solutions to customer needs, to providing product training, and demonstration and implementation of solutions to clients, to support for the software you can be assured that no two days will be the same.§ § § § §Your experience and qualifications:§ § § § §Tertiary qualification or similar in Architecture or Computational Design.§ §A minimum of 5 years’ experience within AEC industry using current generation of ARCHICAD or Revit across a variety of projects.§ §General IT knowledge is desirable.§ §Formal training qualifications and experience in presenting technical training in a formal setting would be highly regarded.§ § § § § §The successful candidate must possess:§ § § § §You must have an excellent written and verbal communications and skills – including presentation skills.§ §You must be able to work proactively by yourself and with others.§ §You are analytical, with well-developed problem-solving skills.§ §You are confident in your own technical abilities.§ §Preparedness to travel (some off-site work when necessary).§ § § §We offer:§ § § §We offer a comprehensive salary package for the applicant who possesses the drive, motivation and skills required in this challenging role. Apply now if you think this is you! Please ensure you include a covering letter along with your resume (Word format) to the HR Manager.§ §Only short-listed candidates will be contacted. Note that by applying to our organisation you accept that your application will be held on our systems and databases and may be used in consideration for this or any other role which we may deem you potentially suitable.  No agencies please. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Have you completed a qualification in architecture?§§§

Their work is diverse and includes property owners, investors and developers, the public sector, design, project management, development, building and property fields.§ §They have achieved great recognition for their achievements and are expanding to meet an even greater demand for their service.§ § § §The Role:§ §They are now seeking a Planner with experience within Land Use Planning to deliver expert advice and assessments to support Resource Consent Applications for development projects and potentially public sector clients with preparation and presentation of expert advice in Council Hearings and Environment Court.§ § § §What you will need:§ §A relevant degree and/or relevant post grad qualifications, along with a strategic and solutions focused outlook will fit their culture.  Strong written ability, communication skills and the ability to work within a team and independently will be key, as is the ability to maintain client relationships at all levels.§ §If you are considering your next career move, then step into a self-managing team, enjoy work-life balance and autonomy within a team of supportive, successful professionals, renowned for their success for delivering results on great projects.§ § § §For initial inquiries about this outstanding opportunity and to register your interest please contact Roz Grant on §roz@crescent.co.nz§ or phone 022 687 1790 or apply online with your CV and covering letter.§ § § § §§§§

mediation.§The ability to assist other planning staff, as required.§Great communication skills.§ §Salary: To be negotiated, subject to skills and experience.§ § §§§§The application form will include jobText: TXT/50597525.txt	§Product Design Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Product Design Lead§§Advertiser: §Halter§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§§We are an award-winning, innovative company designing and building advanced technology to automate farming. Our world-leading guidance control techniques shift cows remotely removing the need for fences and eliminating the manual nature of shifting animals. Halter aims to enable a new generation of more efficient, sustainable farming globally.§ § § §What will you be working on?§ §Our GPS enabled, solar powered devices are designed to remotely guide and manage cows. The device utilises a unique piece of software enabling farmers to set virtual boundaries, schedule shifts and monitor the health and wellbeing of each individual cow, giving them full visibility of their farm. We are always pushing to use the latest advancements in technology and we want you to be a part of this process. Being a young, dynamic company, there is potential for a person in this role to have a big influence on Halter’s future direction.§ § § §Core Duties§ § § §Ownership of design systems and process§ § § §Gather and evaluate user research in collaboration with Product Managers and Engineers § § § §Design and deliver visualisation of user research which could be in the form of user stories, user journeys, personas, and storyboards§ § § §Translate user requirements into concepts, user flows, wireframes, and prototypes that lead to intuitive user experiences§ § § §Create high fidelity intuitive user interfaces and experiences§ § § §Facilitate the process of testing, experimenting, and iterating on concepts with users§ § § §Make strategic visual design and user-experience design decisions related to core and new functions that drive Halter towards its product vision§ § § §Conceptualise, create and maintain the design system (typography, colour, icons, navigation patterns, system hierarchy, buttons, animations and transitions etc.) § § § §Maintain visual and brand consistency throughout the product experience§  § § §Who are we looking for?§ §We are looking for big thinkers who know how to execute. We’re looking for people who are comfortable working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment where they will be challenged on a daily basis. To succeed you will need to be able to learn quickly and utilise your own initiative while working under pressure and to tight deadlines.§ § § §Desired Skills§ § § §5+ years of experience within a design role. You must be both a strong visual designer and researcher curious about the relationship between the digital and physical world.§ § § §A portfolio that demonstrates a variety of interface design work.§ § § §Experience working with human-centred design methods and best practices.§ § § §In-depth understanding of customer behaviour and needs in a digital environment.§ § § §Excellent communication skills.§ § § §Strong problem-solving skills and critical thinking skills.§ § § §Ability to thrive in a self driven and fast paced start­up atmosphere§ § § § §What we can offer you§ § § §An open and supportive environment where input from all members is encouraged.§ § § §The opportunity to work in a dynamic, and highly talented team with diverse backgrounds.§ § § §A fast-paced work environment that enables and encourages knowledge sharing and skill development.§ § § §Opportunity for rapid development and career progression.§ § § §Competitive package and perks.§ § § § §Please submit a portfolio with your CV. If your portfolio is password protected please be sure to include your password in your application.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50601793.txt	§Senior Naval Architect §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Naval Architect §§Advertiser: §Babcock NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§Lead a team of skilled Architects§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§§§§  §    §Senior Naval Architect §    §    §      §        §Marine Industrial Design (MID) is a New Zealand based Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering design consultancy with a reputation for providing practical and proven marine engineering solutions to our clients.  As a wholly owned subsidiary of Babcock (NZ) Limited, MID complements and supports the organisation’s commercial marine and naval engineering capabilities within New Zealand. §        §We are currently seeking a Senior Naval Architect (N4) to join our business, reporting to the Principal Naval Architect. This role will provide Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering design solutions and project management across a number of market sectors including superyachts, fishing vessels, ferries, workboats, tugs and barges.  You will also provide in-service design support to the Royal New Zealand Navy and other NZ Defence Force projects, as part of our parent Babcock(NZ) contract commitments in supporting the RNZN.§        §        §About the Role:§        §We are looking for someone who has a strong background in the marine industry, with 5+ year’s experience of practising Naval Architecture. You will have experience working in a multidisciplinary design office where you use your skills to produce and provide oversight to analysis, calculations, reports, modelling and drawings.  You will be familiar with working in a project based environment and you will be experienced in managing the delivery of projects on time, in budget and to specification.  §        §Tasks Include:§        §          §Delivering and managing naval architecture outputs with emphasis on compliance§          §Exercise design approval authority for Naval Architecture outputs, including structural and mechanical designs §          §Ensuring the delivery of design calculations and design studies§          §Management of engineering projects ensuring all risks to the company and clients are mitigated§          §Leading, mentoring and supporting a team of Naval Architects§          §Provide Naval Arch support to engineering personnel within the Babcock NZ Group §        §        §        §About you:§        §          §Have a Degree or equivalent in Naval Architecture (or associated discipline).  §          §Have a minimum 5 years relevant experience in the marine sector§          §Hold a current membership with an associated engineering body/council§          §Be a proficient user of standard software applications, bespoke Naval Architect software (NAPA or Maxsurf experience is desirable) and CAD 3D modelling, analysis and drafting (Rhino, Inventor, Autocad, Ansys)§          §Chartered Engineer Status  §          §Knowledge and experience of NZ Defence Support and operational systems is desirable§          §Be able to demonstrate a track record on delivering naval architecture outputs§        §        §        §What’s in it for you? jobText: TXT/50602232.txt	§Technical Design Leader§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Design Leader§§Advertiser: §University of Canterbury§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Industrial Design§§§§§§School of Product Design - Kura Hanga Otinga§Full-time at 37.5 hours per week (1.0 FTE)§Continuing (i.e. permanent) position§What you will do§We have a unique opportunity in the School of Product Design for a highly skilled technical design practitioner to lead the team that supports design prototyping for students, academics and other stakeholders. As the Technical Design Leader, you will oversee the delivery of high-quality specialised technical services to staff and students for teaching and research. This is largely a 'hands-on'" role but a significant aspect is to also work closely with the academic team to incorporate effective and modern product prototyping activities into the curriculum to meet student learning outcomes.§Who you are§You will hold at least a Bachelor's degree or Graduate Diploma (Level 7, NZQA) in a relevant field. You will have advanced technical skills and knowledge as well as experience managing a team of technical staff in a complex environment, such as a university, in which diverse project requirements and new ideas are the norm. Experience in teaching, training and tutoring as well as expertise in computer aided design (CAD) and digital manufacturing (3D printing, laser cutting, etc.) would be advantageous. You will have the ability to build and lead an effective team and to foster good stakeholder relationships. You will be a self-motivated, positive, problem-solving, solutions-focused individual, and have excellent interpersonal skills.§Who you will work with§The School of Product Design is committed to excellence in teaching, research and creative practice at the forefront of product design, and producing versatile, innovative graduates who can contribute to New Zealand's future economic growth and social wellbeing. In addition to this role, our current technical team includes four workshop technicians and two chemical formulation laboratory technicians, while our fourteen academic staff cover industrial product design, applied game design and chemical formulation design. We have a large number of students, ranging from first-year to master's and doctoral studies, with a range of prototyping skills.§We aim to continually improve our teaching and research programmes by attracting and retaining highly-skilled academic and support staff, expanding our facilities, and growing our national and international links with other leading design schools and employers.§For more information about the School and our team, please visit our §website. § §Why UC§Tangata Tū, Tangata Ora - Engaged, Empowered, Making a Difference.§The University of Canterbury is committed to accessible higher education, service to community and the encouragement of talent without barriers of distance, wealth, class, gender or ethnicity. The University explicitly aims to produce graduates and support staff who are engaged with their communities, empowered to act for good and determined to make a difference in the world.§For information about the range of fantastic benefits that UC offers including flexible work practices, study opportunities and generous superannuation and leave provisions, please visit us: §http://www.canterbury.ac.nz/joinus§The University of Canterbury is an Equal Employment Opportunities (§EEO§) employer and we encourage diversity in our staffing profile. The University of Canterbury actively seeks to meet its obligation under the Treaty of Waitangi | Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§The closing date for this position is Sunday, 11 October 2020 (midnight, NZ time).§How you apply§Applications for this position must be submitted on our §careers website§ and should include a cover letter and resume§. §Please note, we do not accept applications by email, however we are happy to answer your queries in relation to the application process, please forward these to §WorkatUC@canterbury.ac.nz§Due to current border restrictions, you must have New Zealand Citizenship/Residency to be considered for this role. If you hold a valid work visa and are physically present in New Zealand then you may also be considered for this role.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50605086.txt	§Senior Product Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Product Designer§§Advertiser: §Xero§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§Xero is a beautiful, easy-to-use platform that helps small businesses and their accounting and bookkeeping advisors grow and thrive. § §At Xero, our purpose is to make life better for people in small business, their advisors, and communities around the world. This purpose sits at the centre of everything we do. We support our people to do the best work of their lives so that they can help small businesses succeed through better tools, information and connections. Because when they succeed they make a difference, and when millions of small businesses are making a difference, the world is a more beautiful place.§ § § §The Xero design function§ §Xero is incredibly user centric, which means design plays a vital role in all of our product development. Globally there are 90+ Product Design and Design Research practitioners across NZ, AU, UK, US and Canada. We are all one team and work cross functionally with our product and development teammates to create beautiful, enabling and meaningful experiences for our customers.§ § § §What you’ll do:§ § §You will get to work on design problems from beginning to end –  from concepting the next great product innovation to tweaking pixels right before launch.§ §You’ll cultivate a deep understanding of the needs and aspirations of the people our products are designed for§ §You will not only improve what we build, but you will also contribute to how we go about doing it, better.§ §You will present your ideas and rationale in conversations with others, and through prototypes, models and mockups§ §You’ll work closely with UX designers, product strategists, technical leads and developers.§ §You love crafting beautiful interfaces and care about the details at every step of the journey from concept to shipped code§ § § §What we need from you§ § §You’re an experienced designer, accustomed to user-centered design methods and best practices§ §Proven experience in creating effective handover materials which clearly communicate how the design should look and behave throughout interaction flows and journeys (e.g. User flow diagrams, design specifications, experience/interaction specifications etc)§ §You're a natural when it comes to collaborating with cross functional teams to ensure proposed solutions balance user needs, business strategy and technical constraints§ §Strong problem definition and articulation – challenging assumptions and 'pre-set' thinking around solutions, agreeing the purpose, principles and vision§ §Ideally product (Software as a service) design experience but we’ll still consider you if you have really strong design experience elsewhere.§ § § §But why work at Xero?§ §At Xero, we are rewiring the small business economy and want millions of small businesses to thrive through beautiful software, advice, and connections.§ §We see the value in work-life balance, many of us take full advantage of our flexible working arrangements, so whether you like to get a surf in before work, like to head home in time to pick up the kids or you just like working from the comfort of your own home now and then, we want to support you.§ §We trust you to build your career to the best of your ability and we will support your hunger to learn with training and career mentorship, to help you flourish. Our facilities and PX teams work hard to give us great workspaces with all the tech company perks so join us and experience our awesome culture!§ §What are you waiting for, apply now with your CV and portfolio! All applicants must submit a portfolio in order to be considered§§§§

jobText: TXT/50610513.txt	§Senior/Principal Policy & Planning Consultant - Wellington§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior/Principal Policy & Planning Consultant - Wellington§§Advertiser: §4Sight Consulting§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Sept 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§Attractive salary + benefits & flexible working§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§Join § § §One of New Zealand's largest Planning teams§ §A business where people, clients and the environment come first§ §A highly engaged and respected team who love working together§ §A business that prides itself on diversity and flexibility§ §Do you have§ § §A degree in planning and/or resource management§ §Full NZPI membership or working your way towards this§ §7+ years of planning experience in New Zealand§ §Experience in RMA policy development at local or central government level (both would definitely be an advantage)§ §Experience working with a range of stakeholders such as iwi, communities, corporates, government agencies, technical experts, and other planners§ §Sound project management skills and a drive to deliver to client's needs§ §An aptitude for building and maintaining great relationships with clients and colleagues§ §A resilient and adaptable attitude; a can-do person with a confident communication style§ §A drive and passion to achieve outstanding results.§ §We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior to Principal policy and planning consultant based in our Wellington office.§  §We have one of New Zealand's largest teams of RMA planning professionals and we are looking for a policy planner with a desire to achieve better environmental and community outcomes.  We need a person with strong policy development skills and experience who can help support and drive our continued growth in this field for central and local government clients. Demonstrated experience in local and / or central government policy projects is a must.§  §Outside the role's key focus on policy, you will have the opportunity to be involved in in other planning projects throughout New Zealand. This includes due diligence, resource consent processing, or acquiring resource consents for a range of development projects.§  §The ideal candidate will be client focused, have a strong interest in RMA planning, and most importantly, a desire to work collaboratively with our local and national teams to achieve outstanding results.§  §We pride ourselves on having a great company culture, offering flexibility in the workplace, and in encouraging staff to reach their potential. While we take our commitments to the business and the environment seriously, we still like to have fun along the way. §  §4Sight is an environmental, planning and landscape architecture consultancy that strives to achieve balanced outcomes for land, people and water so that together, we can thrive. We're committed to finding the best people in the industry to help guide our company into the future because it's the people that make us who we are and set us apart from the competition.§  §Check out our videos on our website to learn more about 4Sight and why our staff love working at 4Sight.§  §So if you're interested, have what it takes and want to work for an established, but still growing New Zealand owned, award-winning consultancy, please apply with a personalised cover letter and CV.  Don't forget to include in your cover letter what attracted you to 4Sight and to this role.§  §For more information or to have a confidential discussion, please contact Mark Ashby, Wellington Manager, by email (§marka@4sight.co.nz§) or mobile 021 464 654.§  §We can't wait to hear from you and good luck!§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have in a consulting role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Are you willing to relocate for this role?§§§

joining a diverse and supportive working environment with an active social event calendar.§  §If you are excited about the opportunity to combine your passion for architectural  excellence with your jobText: TXT/50616033.txt	§Architect Designer/Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Architect Designer/Technician§§Advertiser: §Kirk Roberts Consulting Engineers§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architectural Drafting§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Architect Designer/Technician §      §        §We are looking for an experienced Architectural Designer/Technician to join our dynamic Architecture team and work in our newly designed studio in Christchurch.§        § §        §We have an exciting range of upcoming projects, so if you relish a challenge and enjoy working in a progressive environment, we would like to hear from you.§        § §        §About the role§        §As an Architectural Designer/Technician with us, you will be responsible from concept to detailed design; across the design and planning stages, architectural drawings and specifications, and building consent applications.§        § §        §          §Production of Concept design, Resource Consent application, BC application, Tender and Construction project specific documentation§          §Production of BIM documentation using the latest versions of Revit§          §Liaise with Clients, and internal and external stakeholders across the business§          §Develop and maintain Architectural design tools, spreadsheets, specifications and polices§          §Lead the preparation of project deliverables and the co-ordination of project documentation. Provide project administration, contract management, site meetings and inspections.§        §        § §        §We offer a competitive remuneration package, work life balance with flexible working, paid overtime, a performance bonus scheme, on-the-job training and ongoing career development. §        § §        §About you§        §          §A relevant architectural qualification (technician or architecture), with a minimum of 5 years+ experience within New Zealand Construction Industry or a similar role§          §Excellent working knowledge and experience of Revit and BIM Management§          §Commitment to design excellence, with extensive design knowledge from conceptual design, preliminary, developed and detailed design, to tendering and contract administration§          §In-depth understanding of NZ Building Codes, Acts and Statutory requirements§          §Thrive on a challenge and be motivated to provide innovative solutions for our clients§          §Strong attention to detail and accuracy§        §        §          §You are adaptable with excellent planning, organising and time management§        §        §          §Excellent communication and interpersonal skills§          §Experience working in AutoCAD, Sketchup, Adobe Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator; would be an advantage but not essential§        §        § §        §About us§        §Kirk Roberts Consulting Engineers is a multi-discipline professional services company with over 100 employees providing Architecture, Structural, Geotechnical, Fire, Civil and Environmental Engineering Services, plus Project Management, and Engineering Software to a range of clients across New Zealand. We have offices in Christchurch, Auckland, Hamilton and Tauranga. §        § §        §At Kirk Roberts the heart of our business is innovation and we thrive on finding better ways to design and deliver projects. jobText: TXT/50616316.txt	§Intermediate Draughtsperson§§Private Advertiser§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Draughtsperson§§Private Advertiser§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architectural Drafting§§§§§§An exciting opportunity has opened up for a highly motivated Intermediate Draughtsperson to join our busy architectural firm. Franklin Architectural Design has been operating for over 30 years and due to constant growth, we are looking for the right person to be part of that growth. The applicant will be proficient in ArchiCAD 22, they must have a good understanding of NZS3604 and the New Zealand Building Code, with a minimum of 3 years experience.§ §The role will include§ § §Conceptual design§ §Interpreting design on computer-aided draughting equipment through to working drawings, for building consent compliance checking and mentoring§ §Ensuring all work is completed to time frames in a compliant manner for residential alterations and residential new builds§ §Writing specifications.§ §Work is normally allocated on a project basis, so you would have the opportunity to work on projects from start to finish while liaising with consultants and clients.§ §The company has a business plan in place which includes further growth so within that growth there are opportunities to develop your career.§ §To be successful in this role you must enjoy learning and have:§ § §Good level of knowledge of construction in New Zealand and the building code/compliance§ §Practical drafting experience, from start to finish and across a wide range of project types.§ §Experience with using ArchiCAD technology.§ §Have analytical skills with an eye for detail and the practical ability to visualise a project constructed§ §Be technology minded with excellent PC skills and the ability to quickly learn new software§ §Have the ability to problem solve without constant supervision§ §Have a can-do attitude, and enjoy helping out when and where needed§ §Have the ability to work well in an open plan environment and team§ § § §You will need to be a good communicator and not afraid of asking questions. As we are a small team an ability to get on and work alongside others is essential.§ §Organization and time management skills are needed, as a lot of projects involve self-management and following processes.§ §Must speak fluent English and applicant must be a permanent NZ resident or hold a valid NZ work permit. This is an amazing opportunity for a driven person to join our friendly supportive team environment.§ §We offer a great salary to match your skills and attributes with leadership opportunity for the right person who is seeking to grow with this progressive practice long-term.§ § § §The application form will include these questions:§ § §Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§ §Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§ §What's your expected annual base salary?§ §How many years' experience do you have as a draughtsperson?§ §Have you completed a qualification in architecture?§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a draftsperson?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§How many years' experience do you have in the construction industry?§Do you have experience working on residential construction projects?§§§

jobText: TXT/50624597.txt	§Senior Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Technician§§Advertiser: §Warren and Mahoney Architects Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architectural Drafting§§§§§§Warren and Mahoney§ is an international firm of designers and architects who create experiences that connect people and enhance belonging.  In our work, we aim to reflect and strengthen the organisations that we work with through authentic and enduring design.  Our team of 300 work as one integrated studio across our seven Australasian locations, weaving individual endeavour into a stronger whole.  Please visit the Careers page at www.warrenandmahoney.com to find out more about us and view our portfolio of work.§  § We are looking for talented §Architectural Technicians§ to join both our §Christchurch and Wellington studios§.  The successful candidates will ideally have:§  § § §7+ years’ experience§ §A relevant tertiary qualification § §Worked on high value projects§ §Experience in managing multiple projects§ §Site observation experience§ §Excellent technical skills that transform design ideas to detailed drawings§ §A high level of presentation and communication skills § §Excellent attention to detail§ §Strong skills in Revit § §  § You will be joining a diverse award-winning team. We have an agile, vibrant, and social work environment, with an open and collaborative approach across all studios to create a ‘one studio’ culture. Our people are valued for their contribution to the success of the practice and individual career development is an important aspect of this success. You will work alongside senior leaders who have a passion for quality design and architecture and who will support you to develop your skills and experience. All applicants must be NZ permanent residents or hold a valid NZ work permit.§  § §If this sounds like you, please email your CV, portfolio and location preference to §HR@warrenandmahoney.com§ §  § §We look forward to hearing from you!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§§§

jobText: TXT/50625353.txt	§Junior / Intermediate Landscape Architect§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior / Intermediate Landscape Architect§§Advertiser: §Mace Landscape Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Papakura & Franklin§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Landscape Architecture§§§§§§ §Opportunity for development within a leading landscape design & build firm§ §Build on your training to develop your personal design flair§ §Develop your skills and knowledge of landscaping within the industry§ § § §We’re looking for a junior landscape architect to join our team and help grow our expanding design service on a fixed term contract with the possibility of a permanent placement on completion.  Working within a team of three under the guidance of the senior landscape architect, this position would suit a landscape architect graduate and offers a unique opportunity to work within a company that services all aspects of the landscaping industry and develop a practical understanding of landscaping from the ground up.  Initially assisting with preparation of design files, site measures, estimating work, drafting etc, there is also the opportunity to oversee your own projects across both commercial and residential sites.§ § § §Key tasks:§ § §Preparation of landscape base plans§ §Drafting landscape designs under guidance from the senior landscape architect§ §Construction detailing for landscape quoting and installation purposes and preparation of landscape specifications for tendering§ §Input into creative development of designs§ §Management of resource and sample materials with industry suppliers§ §Assisting with client liaison and onsite duties§ §Assisting with office-wide duties within the company§ § § §In addition to having a relevant qualification, applicants should have the following attributes:§ § §Competency in Vectorworks Landmark software§ §A keen eye for detail and excellent presentation skills§ §Ability to interpret a project scope and contribute to creative solutions§ §A willingness to learn and take on responsibility§ §Ability to work independently or as part of a team§ §A good level of time management and ability to work to deadlines§ §Full drivers license with own transport§ §A good knowledge of NZ plants§ §A high level of professionalism and an easy-going personality§ § § §About Us:§ §As an Auckland-based company, Mace Landscape Group has been part of the region’s landscape for over 40 years. We understand the link between the importance of people and the environment and have established ourselves as the leader in commercial landscaping, and extended this into dedicated design, residential and maintenance services.  In addition to this, the Mace Landscape Group also encompasses our own nursery and landscape supply yard.§ § § §Core Values:§ § §Success through service§ §One team; everyone plays a part§ §We set the standard§ §Work with respect and integrity § §Opportunity to grow§ § § §If you want to join a progressive and well-established company with the opportunity to learn in a hands-on environment, then please apply now.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50627573.txt	§Senior Interior Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Interior Designer§§Advertiser: §The Design Depot§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Interior Design§§§§§§THE DESIGN DEPOT is a National and International Award winning Furniture and Interior Design store, recognised for impeccable customer service, innovation, attention to detail, and a passion for design.  Our luxury furniture, homeware, interior design and soft furnishing retail stores sell beautiful New Zealand made products, designer pieces, quality international brands and stunning one-off pieces sourced both locally and from around the world.  §  §We are locally owned and operated with ongoing growth.  Due to our increasing market demand we are seeking a motivated and experienced addition to our Interior Design and Curtain team in Mt Maunganui.§  §We are seeking a full time experienced Interior Designer for our Mount store - someone who can share in our passion for beautiful interiors and a commitment to provide the highest level of customer service at all times.§  §The successful candidate will have extensive curtain and interior design experience and most importantly be the right fit for our wonderful team.§  §The successful applicant will require the following skills:§ § §A passion and drive for sales while providing customers with an outstanding customer experience, going above and beyond.§ §Previous interior design and curtain experience, with a proven ability to achieve sales targets.§ §A passion for the interior design industry§ §Knowledge and experience working with Furniture, home decor items and textiles.§ §Committed team player who must work well in a team environment and adhere to company values§ §Ability to assist clients with their design concepts, researching options and creating proposals with products from within The Design Depot range.§ §Great people skills with an approachable and friendly manner§ §Confidence with computers and administrative systems essential.§ §Ability to work independently, with initiative, highly motivated, proactive, with a can do attitude.§ §Great organisational skills, be able to multi task and excel under pressure.§ §The physical fitness to be constantly moving and lifting furniture and accessories§ §High energy§ §Professional attire and a good sense of humour§ §The position available is full time, ideally for an immediate start but we are flexible to wait for the ideal candidate. Hours and salary are both negotiable according to the skillset of the suitable candidate but must involve one weekend day per week.§  §If this opportunity sounds exciting and you would like to be part of this fun, award winning team then please apply with your Cover Letter and CV.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Do you have experience in a sales role?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§
