jobText: TXT/50628707.txt	§Architectural Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Architectural Designer§§Advertiser: §Green Homes Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§24 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§About the opportunity:§Green Homes is experiencing an increasing workload due to our growing brand and business, this great opportunity based in our Auckland office has come up for someone who is highly skilled in the residential sector of the New Zealand building industry.§ §Role description:§You will be involved in all aspects of design from the preliminary concept stage through to working drawings and consent documentation. As well as coordinating with consultants, liaising with local councils and providing support to contractors. Your strong organisational skills, proficiency in ArchiCAD, eye for detail and ability to build and maintain strong internal customer relationships will ensure success in this opportunity.§ §Responsibilities will include:§Use necessary physical and digital tools to create initial drafts, work with team members/stakeholders to ensure accuracy of early design work. Review designs and make adjustments to designs as needed. Research and incorporate artistic elements into designs as needed. Ensure design specifics align to all standards & governmental regulations. Liaise with various professionals and departments to coordinate project details.§This role will suit someone with the following background / experience / qualities:§3 years minimum working experience within New Zealand, a high level of Archicad Knowledge. Skilled in high quality 3D rendering and modelling. An eye for detail, solid detailing skills and document accuracy. Thorough understanding of the New Zealand building Code and NZS 3604 Ability to liaise with clients, engineers, builders and council.§ §About the company:§Backed by Watts & Hughes Construction, one of New Zealand’s leading construction heavyweights, Green Homes is carving out a niche for better homes and improved living.§We deliver competitively priced, energy efficient, sustainable homes which set us apart - not a hard sell! Your expertise will range from small to large residential development projects from concept to completion with particular focus on multi-storey, multi-units, multi-terrace, group housing and low rise apartment builds.§ §Keeping in mind this is a CONTRACT based role and therefore the hours will be steady as will the workflow. No two days will be the same, you will need to be on top of your game in terms of managing your time.§ §To be successful in applying for this role, you are required to have the following:§ § §At least 4 years of industry experience§ §Proficiency in ArchiCAD or similar§ §Confident in managing Resource and Building Consent process in a timely manner§ §Knowledge in organising and drafting complete sets of Construction documents for residential projects§ §Must be proactive, hardworking, punctual, reliable with honest work ethics§ §Sound understanding of the NZ Building Code, NZ Standards and NZ Construction & Building Materials§ §Have excellent communication skills§ §NZ Drivers Licence§ §NZ Resident or valid New Zealand Work Visa§ §Good organisational skills with the ability to multi-task and work well under pressure§ §A keen eye for detail with an ability to visualise and understand 3D modelling and dimensions§ §Work as a team player, take and follow instructions accurately§ §NZ qualified Licenced Building Practitioner (LBP) and/or NZ Registered Architect with ADNZ§ §Applicants must email a cover letter, detailed CV with references and a portfolio of your work.§ §Remuneration package will be agreed based on the individual and their experience.§ §Keep it simple with BROTHERS!§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a designer?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§How many years' experience do you have in the construction industry?§§§

jobTitle: Lead Interior Designer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50642013.txt	§Lead Interior Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Interior Designer§§Advertiser: §The Wonder Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Interior Design§§§§§§In this role, you will be developing unique design concepts for interior spaces & seeing these through till completion. §  §We’ve got an epic team of designers and carry high standards of delivery. We’re looking for character, drive, attention to detail, eyes on the scene & the ability to execute thoughtful projects with potency. §  § §  §About Us§  §The Wonder Group is a small, young & punchy design-led team creating interesting boutique spaces for character brands across New Zealand. We work between hospitality, retail & commercial - creating concept-driven bars, restaurants, flagships, cafe’s, pop-up experiences, brand activation stunts & workplace interiors. §  §We design all interior touchpoints - from the technical pieces (layout, extraction, kitchen, construction details, lighting, etc.) through to the creative & artistic (custom feature furniture, brand & signage, styling, bespoke artistry & all sorts special finishes). We work on the ideas, the brand, the music, and every aspect of the experience that we can get our hands-on.§  §Our clients form a diverse range of both emerging & established NZ brands. We work on conservative budgets with tight timelines & our expectations are always set high. We work bloody hard to stretch a project to its maximum potential, an attitude that we’re now known for. §  § §  §About You§  §— Proven experience as a technically-creative project lead. You’ll have projects & work to back that up - not necessarily in interiors.§  §— Individually driven, with numerous examples of side-hustles or personal creative endeavors. §  §— You’ll be a small team player & thrive off the hustle of making magic happen. §  §— You will be a genuine all-rounder, with a passion for design & detail, and an intention of growing within an exciting team that works across disciplines, project types & deliverables. §  §— You will know your way around the creative process with confidence, delivering design at an exceptionally high level with an ambitious and integrated technical quality.§  §— You’ll have a hunger for innovation, the ability to develop new technologies and respond to the varied range of projects and scales within the studio. §  §— Where opportunities exist, you find these & develop new ways of working. You don’t follow templates, you make them. §  §— You’ll be experienced at leading your own projects & pulling others on the journey with you - artists, consultants, clients & other stakeholders.§  §— You’ll know your way around some form of 3D CAD environment. We’re ArchiCAD users here & are open to training you if that’s not yet your thing. §  §— You’ll be a team player, but have the ability to run with a project on your own accord.§  §Your job will include§  §— Developing unique ideas & concepts that will set our clients spaces out from the rest.  §  §— Involvement in leading the entirety of a project through to construction.§  §— Designing all details through a space with cohesion & thoughtfulness. §  §— Working amongst the design team to independently drive all project facets.§  §— Meeting with consultants & relevant parties as the key coordinator.§  §— Submit permit documentation & consent lodgement.§  §— Preparation of Tender & Construction Documentation.§  §— Assisting in the delivery of projects on time, to budget, and to client needs.§  §— Communicating with the stakeholders with clarity & character. §  §— Management of quality across the fabrication, procurement & build.§  §— Building strong relationships with reps, sales & industry partners.§  § §  §Please Supply:§  §— A portfolio of your best work.§  §— An up-to-date Resume.§  §— Examples of your technical documentation packages (all will be kept confidential).§  §— 2 examples of your favourite influences (eg. design studios, artists, spaces), and tell us why they matter to you.§  § §  §We need someone to hit the ground quickly.  It goes without saying that you must be prepared to work within NZ & be available to work locally within Grey Lynn. §  § §  §Please email your application to §careers@wonder.group§. Apply today. §  §We will interview candidates continuously until we find the right fit for our team. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50642842.txt	§Kitchen Designers & Sales Consultants (Commercial and Retail)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kitchen Designers & Sales Consultants (Commercial and Retail)§§Advertiser: §JAG Kitchens§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§28 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Manukau & East Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Interior Design§§§§§§Leading kitchen solutions business – JAG Kitchens§Trusted brand with an enviable product range§Great money and excellent location at Botany Town Centre§Since our inception more than 16 years ago, we’ve become a house-hold name in kitchen design, manufacture and installation, across the residential and commercial sector in East Auckland.  We have done this through excellence in design, quality workmanship and customer service.§We manufacture our products on-premise in East Tamaki, and that means we own the supply chain from kitchen quote and design, through to installation and handover to our clients.§Due to retirement, and growth, we’re on the hunt for two new Designer/Sales Consultants at JAG Kitchens, based at Botany Town Centre.  One will manage our Group Homes / Commercial Kitchen design and relationships, and the other will manage our retail customers, in the showroom at our head office in the Danske Møbler premises.§Commercial Designer – Group Homes / Key Account Manager§With 3+ years of experience in a similar role, you’re qualified by experience or degree qualified, with an enviable track record in sales, ideally a mix of key account management and new business development (based off trust and relationships, not just door knocking), and have built a reputation for delivering on what you promise.§Ideally, you’ll join us from another Kitchen / Bathroom Design and Sales background, or you’ve been in the market as a Key Account Manager, building relationships, and growing sales, through your skills, knowledge and expertise.§Retail Kitchen Designer / Sales Consultant§This role also requires 3+ years of experience as a Kitchen / Bathroom Designer, with a passion for the entire process. Luckily enough, there’s little to no ‘cold-calling’ to do, however, if you’re not busy, then chasing leads and expanding your network to gain insights into what could be next up, will be key.  We expect that you’ll manage our customer’s requirements from their initial enquiry listening to their wishes and discussing options that best match.  You’ll manage the process from in-home measuring through to the conceptual design of their kitchen, manage all iterations to the design with the end goal of them signing the dotted line as a very happy buyer.§You’ll be responsible for upselling across our range of products, from granite benchtops to our elegant range of cabinetry and kitchen solutions, you will listen to the customers budget and buying signals, and ensure they get exactly what they want.§About you:§Whether it’s our Commercial Designer or Retail Designer, your attention to detail is immaculate.  You leave no room for the ‘grey’, and you’re able to multi-task as you’ll have between 10-20 projects on at all stages of the buying process.  It goes without saying that you have flawless communication skills, are not afraid to problem solve and you pride yourself on keeping your customers up to date, not matter how small the change may be.§ You have strong computer design skills, with software such as Cabinetvision, Cabmaster or similar, a great knowledge of MS Office, including Word and Outlook, and you are a quick learner, able to pick up new systems if you’ve never used them before.§As a person words like inquisitive, self-starter, hungry, ambitious and professional spring to mind.  You take pride in your work and this shows in the end product.§If this sounds like you, and you’re interested to continue your already successful career with a growing family business with a trusted brand and reputation in the Auckland market, then please apply today.§What’s on offer: §We offer a competitive base salary plus commission, the chance to grow and develop as we grow, and a fantastic team of people who will become your 2nd family.§Don’t delay, apply today, we have no closing date for this role, we’ll interview as candidates apply and we’ll close the role once we’ve found who we’re after!§§§§

You could also be involved in open space policy and design guidance work, as well as public engagement and consultation for a new park, a transport project, or an urban development.§        §As a graduate within Boffa Miskell, you will gain hands on practical experience in a thriving and supportive workplace. This creative, multi-disciplinary urban design team is responsible for leading the design conversation as well as shaping, advocating and delivering 'design quality' for Auckland. We do this through design review of development proposals, preparation of design policy, advising on structure plans and masterplans, and through the design of placed-based design projects across Auckland. §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§ §This is a fantastic career development opportunity for a talented urban designer who wants to take their career to the next level. You have an undergraduate and/or postgraduate qualification in urban design and an understanding of landscape architecture or architecture. Strong written communication skills and the ability to graphically present ideas are a key component to this role. Your designs will be sold not only here in NZ but also across the USA. § § § § § § § § §About the role§ § §We are seeking a mechanically minded and innovative engineer to design Fiasco products and provide technical input to our production facilities and contract manufacturers in New Zealand and abroad.§ §The dynamic role includes:§ §Technical design and drafting of Fiasco products following our proven design methodology using AutoCAD and Fusion 360.§Building of prototypes and CNC machine operations to support local NZ production and test ideas.§ §You will take an active interest in manufacturing technology to ensure products are being produced as efficiently as possible.§ §Other Job responsibilities include:§ §Draw designs in a timely manner that ensure continuity of the Fiasco manufacturing process.§Contribute to designing of new products and revise existing designs.§Take responsibility for ensuring design and QC documentation communicates our requirements accurately and clearly.§Making recommendations on production equipment and manufacturing processes ensuring that Fiasco maintains a competitive manufacturing advantage.§ § § § §Benefits and perks§ §Work as part of a small, agile and creative team.§Potential travel to China and USA (when it is possible) §Great team and working location.§ § §Key Competencies § §Drafting skills, AutoCAD or Fusion 360 preferable.§Aptitude in a variety of engineering solutions.§Have a proven history of making things and an interest in innovation.§An understanding of plywood, aluminum and foam manufacturing techniques including CNC workflows.§An attitude open to gaining understanding, i.e the ability to understand and then solve any challenge.§Seeking to develop a professional, proactive problem solving skill set that adds value to the Fiasco team. §Demonstrates productive work habits through efficient use of time and resources.§Delivers work consistently in a timely manner and to the appropriate standard.§Demonstrates great interpersonal skills (communication, listening and reliability)§Proactively seeks improvement opportunities.§Operates with high level of integrity and trustworthiness.§ §Qualifications§ §A degree in engineering or product design.§Or§Diploma in engineering.§Or§A proven track record of being generally clever.§ §Don't be afraid to break from the standard application format, sell yourself to us and we will be in touch.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a design engineer?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§How many years of industrial design experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Drafting Cadet Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50653713.txt	§Drafting Cadet§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Drafting Cadet§§Advertiser: §Holmes§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architectural Drafting§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §      §        §Drafting Cadet §        §Have you considered a career in structural drafting? Are you interested in buildings, bridges and design? Are you in your final year of your NZ Diploma in Architecture (NZ DipArch)?§   § For nearly six decades, Holmes Consulting has led the engineering industry in invention, creativity and quality. During that time we’ve worked right across New Zealand and the world, delivering premium structural and civil solutions to thousands of landmark projects. Our expert drafters have played a huge part in our success.§   § We accept a handful of great Drafting Cadets each year to kick-start their structural drafting career in one of our five Holmes Consulting offices in New Zealand (Auckland, Hamilton, Wellington, Christchurch and Queenstown). It’s a fantastic opportunity for you to work alongside Senior Drafters and Engineers on exciting live projects, bringing our engineering concepts to life. You’ll be working with advanced software like REVIT, creating accurate, compelling drawings that are vital in guiding design and construction.§   § We don’t expect you to know everything right off the bat—instead, you’ll be learning alongside an experienced Senior Drafter, asking questions, visiting sites, contributing to team meetings, and ultimately growing your skills from day one. Along the way, you’ll have plenty of fun working with positive, motivated people who love delivering exceptional projects. Our drafting team is at the forefront of the industry, working on great projects nationwide, including the Wellington Town Hall, Commercial Bay (Auckland), and the Christ Church Cathedral (Christchurch).§   § With strong academic results, great candidates will be sticklers for detail, able to manage their time well and step up to deadlines. It’s vital that you fit in well with our team, so you’ll need to impress us with your communication skills and appetite to learn. An added bonus would be having a particular interest in technology or being skilled in computer programming. The world is changing at a fast rate and we want to keep up with it!§   § We’ll provide you a great place to work as part of a fun and supportive team, with excellent learning and career progression—and a chance to work on some of the country’s most exciting projects. To find out more about a career in drafting at Holmes Consulting, visit www.holmesconsulting.co.nz/join-us/drafting-cadetships/§   § §How to apply§ If you’ve got what it takes to become a Drafting Cadet at Holmes Consulting, apply now with your CV, cover letter and academic transcript. It’s a fantastic opportunity for you to work alongside Senior Drafters and Engineers on exciting live projects, bringing our engineering concepts to life. You’ll be working with advanced software like REVIT, creating accurate, compelling drawings that are vital in guiding design and construction.§   § We don’t expect you to know everything right off the bat—instead, you’ll be learning alongside an experienced Senior Drafter, asking questions, visiting sites, contributing to team meetings, and ultimately growing your skills from day one. Along the way, you’ll have plenty of fun working with positive, motivated people who love delivering exceptional projects. Our drafting team is at the forefront of the industry, working on great projects nationwide, including the Wellington Town Hall, Commercial Bay (Auckland), and the Christ Church Cathedral (Christchurch).§   § With strong academic results, great candidates will be sticklers for detail, able to manage their time well and step up to deadlines. jobText: TXT/50655998.txt	§UX/UI / Product Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§UX/UI / Product Designer§§Advertiser: §Kernel Wealth§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§Kernel is a financial services company on a mission change the financial future of millions. We believe the key to financial freedom is a diversified portfolio of investments that are transparent, low-cost and accessible. Using great tech and innovative ideas, Kernel provides a unique customer experience to deliver the information, tools and products necessary for investors to reach their long-term financial goals. What sets us apart is the real human responsiveness you might have not thought imaginable from an online investing service.§ §  §Our team is working together to build one of the most innovative fintech companies in the world and we’re looking for talented people to join the adventure. If you’re someone who wants to help us move fast, ship often and make a huge impact, read on and get in touch.§  §Role Summary:§  §As a Designer, you are a talented, driven designer who loves to partner with technology to create engaging digital experiences that customers love.§You will become an integral part of a growing team, who has ambitious plans to deliver a world-class financial technology product. This is a tremendous opportunity to take a digital product from discovery into production, with the ability to influence the user experience and strategy along the way.§If you take immense pride and ownership in your work and have a high level of attention to detail – this is for you!§  §What we’d like to see: § § §You love simplifying the complex and creating intuitive product experiences through better UX and UI design.§  § §A strong portfolio, with 3-5 years of UX and UI design experience, in agency or client-side environments.§  § §Experience with all the major design and prototyping tools, Photoshop / Illustrator / Sketch / Figma / XD - You’ve played with it all.§  § §Strong conceptual thinking. We want someone who can interpret data and user insights and turn them into surprising, even game-changing concepts.§  § §A solid understanding of UX - Wireframes, User personas, User flow, User Journeys. You know a product needs more than just a pretty face.§  § §An attitude that speaks to evolution and an appreciation for constant iteration of the product design to satisfy customer needs.§  § §You might also have: § § §Experience working in the financial services industry.§ §An understanding or keen interest of personal finance is a plus.§ §An interest in the finer points of wordsmithery§ §If this job sounds like you, please send through a cover letter explaining why you’re excited about this role and working at Kernel, along with your CV and portfolio.§  §Why Kernel?§At Kernel, we embrace difference. We create a safe space where all voices can be heard so that we can all do our life’s best work. We’re committed to promoting and celebrating diversity and believe getting the best outcomes requires diverse perspectives.§  §We are willing to challenge the status quo, we prioritise long-term thinking and values over short-term incentives. We offer a range of family friendly employment policies, flexible working, wellbeing initiatives, an awesome office spot in Auckland CBD and all the social vibes!§We want you to grow with us. We’re a high growth company and you’ll form a core part of an innovative and collaborative team. As Kernel grows, you’ll have the opportunity to take on new challenges, extend your skill set and take on more responsibilities.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50656248.txt	§Kitchen Joinery CAD Designer / Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kitchen Joinery CAD Designer / Technician§§Advertiser: §Hostess Joinery Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architectural Drafting§§§§§§We have a long established brand with multiple awards, an enviable reputation for quality, service and value and we have branches in Hamilton and Mt Maunganui. With an emphasis on customised design and manufacture, we cater for client needs ranging from the simple to the ornate, from kitchens and vanities to laundries, wardrobes and entertainment units.§  §Our Hamilton branch requires the services of an individual with excellent CAD skills who can work with our designers and produce plans from initial concept through to production drawings based on their brief from the end client. This will be an excellent opportunity for someone with experience in joinery who wishes to focus and advance their CAD skills in this specialist area.§  §Our design package is integrated to our factory so your accuracy and attention to detail are essential as is the ability to work as part of a highly skilled, passionate and dedicated team. Our culture is very much about working as a team to provide our clients with the best service and value whether we are producing cabinetry for a single wardrobe or their entire house.§  §You must have excellent general computer and specific CAD skills (we will provide training if required for our design package - Cabinet Vision). Kitchen joinery experience, either design or construction, is essential.§  §You will need to have:§  §- A friendly and outgoing personality§  §- Strong organisational and communication skills§  §- A desire to learn and contribute as part of a team§  §This is a full time position. Our team of experienced and well trained draughtspeople receive exposure to all of the different markets, building environments and council regulations across New Zealand, and to a wide range of buildings.§ §We are currently seeking a junior draughtsperson / recent graduate to join our talented draughting and technical team, based in Christchurch. Servicing a nationwide client base, you'll join a group of dedicated, like-minded draughtspeople who work alongside customers and our franchise network, providing top notch customer service.§ §This is the perfect place to start your draughting career, surrounded by a group of talented draughtspeople, focusing on continuous improvements and the objective of providing the highest quality drawings to our network and customers. § §What will you be doing in this role?§ § §Firstly, preparing concepts for our sales team across New Zealand.§ §Then, over time, creating full working drawings for our range of homes and garages.§ §What will allow you to succeed in this role?§ § §A working knowledge of ArchiCad and intermediate level MS suite skills.§ §A tertiary qualification in draughting.§ §A strong work ethic and enthusiasm for customers.§ §An understanding of NZ3604 and the NZ Building Code.§ §Attention to detail and the ability to work to deadlines.§ §What's on offer for you?§ § §A great working environment and friendly team.§ §Continued career and professional development.§ §A competitive remuneration package and additional employee benefits§ §The chance to be part of a growing company.§ §If you want to work with a progressive company where your contribution is valued and has a real impact on the overall success of the business, then this is the place for you.§ §To apply for this job, please select the "apply for this job" option in Seek.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Are you willing to undergo a pre-employment medical check?§§§

jobTitle: User Experience Designer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50662094.txt	§User Experience Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§User Experience Designer§§Advertiser: §Serato Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§About the UX Designer position§We are looking for an experienced UX / Interaction designer to help us design, prototype and test our world leading software products and web platform. §You are analytical and creative. You are detail oriented and ask a lot of questions. You are self motivated, proactive and happy to organise and facilitate meetings with your workmates. You can grasp user needs, and if you don’t have answers, you know how to get them. You can solve problems and clearly communicate and document solutions. You have a strong portfolio of successful UX and other technical projects.§You will work closely with our Product Owners and Marketing Team to deliver our customers the best possible experience. §With support from the Head of Experience, you will help our teams understand our users, design the right thing and then design the thing right. §The main activities the UX Designer will be involved in:§Primary    §Translating concepts into user flows, wireframes and prototypes.§Identifying user problems, and work with the team to devise solutions through prototyping§Taking a user-centred design approach and rapidly test and iterate designs with users and the team§Using and to be an active champion of our company personas§Planning and implementing user research, design research (prototype testing) and usability testing with support from the Head of Experience.§Documenting and present research findings through reports, presentations or workshops.§Working with stakeholders, including product owners, development and strategy to define, document and specify final solutions §Assisting the web designers in designing final interfaces.§Asking smart questions.§Helping POs and Marketing teams make strategic design and user-experience decisions.§Secondary §Assisting with post launch analysis of ideas and products§Creating and presenting customer journey maps§Being an advocate for user centered design and design thinking across all Serato business units§Employing a strong understanding of UX and web design best practices, keeping up with industry trends§Helping facilitate workshops, meetings and internal company communication§§Essential skills and experience we are looking for in a UX Designer:§Proven experience with designing for web, mobile or web platforms§Strong interaction design skills such as wireframing, user flows, customer journey mapping §Has worked within a cross discipline design and development team §Proficiency in Sketch, Figma or similar prototyping tools §Can create interactive prototypes for testing and design specification purposes  §Has conducted usability tests§Strong written and presentation skills §Strong interaction documentation skills§Experience with Design Systems  §Proven experience with optimising ecommerce platforms and A/B testing a bonus   §Knowledge and appreciation of a wide range of music§Experience in DJing and/or music production a bonus §Attributes that are important for us to find in a great candidate:§A team player§Great at managing stakeholder relationships, §Personable, yet has the ability to be assertive,§Organised§Clear communicator§§Serato is a homegrown New Zealand company that is successful in the global market. We are growing in size but have managed to maintain our non-corporate, music-loving culture. We aim to find people who want to work within a culture that is passionate about music and creating world class software products and web platform.§If you love technology and music and want to work at a company with a great culture, this could be the role for you.§ §§§§§

jobText: TXT/50662389.txt	§Coordinator, BIM§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Coordinator, BIM§§Advertiser: §CPB Contractors NZ§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Other§§§§§§CPB Contractors is a leading international construction company and a member of the CIMIC Group.§We combine the construction track record and expertise formerly delivered by Leighton Contractors and Thiess, and we also include the people and projects of Leighton Asia.§In conjunction with our clients and partners, CPB Contractors is delivering important and iconic projects across all key sectors of the construction industry, meaning we offer significant and diverse work opportunities.§We are building on the strong foundations of our unique history to create a successful and sustainable future. Safely delivering next-generation infrastructure that better connects people and transforms communities is at the heart of what we do.§What can our construction projects build for you?§§The Project§The Waikeria Prison Development PPP project is $750 million construction project based in the heart of the Waikato. This project will provide leading edge facilities to the Department of Corrections and will deliver accommodation along with a secure mental health unit providing additional care for prisoners.§With early works already underway, the opportunity to join this project commenced in October 2018, with overall completion and facility opening due in 2022.§Your Opportunity§As BIM Coordinator you will be assisting with the BIM delivery process on the largest New Zealand commercial construction development. With 26 various buildings under construction concurrently, working with the design team based in our Brisbane & Site based offices you will be working toward achieving best cost outcomes, value management, efficiencies and ensuring design deliverables are met to our client brief. As an experienced BIM professional, you will call upon you to demonstrate your previous success, learnings and knowledge, gained from a successful career and develop it to the next level.§We are looking to a permanent BIM Coordinator to the company and project term who can:§§Input data and preparing modeling for design and management teams§Interigate and manage complex models§Federation of models§Management of the CDE  §Support the management team with modeling information and visualization§Coach and mentor staff in the use of BIM systems§Management and processes of Clash detection and Clash avoidance processes§Work to establish standards§Identify risk and efficiency opportunity’s to the management team§§Ideal candidates will possess the following:§§Ideal candidate will have 5 years’ experience preferably in the Commercial Construction industry working within a BIM/Digital Engineering environment.§You will have demonstrated experience and advanced understanding of BIM and its uses.§The ability to relocate to various locations throughout New Zealand depending on long term projects (initially in the Waikato)§Experience working in a high health and safety focus organisation.§§As the successful candidate you will need to be a self-starter who is highly motivated, well organized and committed to the highest possible work standards. You will also have the ability to build strong relationships with internal stakeholders, clients and consultants.§All potential CPB Contractor’s employees will be require the right to work in Australia and New Zealand. You will also require to complete a range of pre-employment checks, including Ministry of justice checks, Reference checking and qualification checks.§In return, we offer rewarding careers, genuine opportunities to develop and grow, and a workplace culture that values and recognizes effort and contribution.§If you are interested and meet the above requirements, please apply below.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50662414.txt	§Graphic Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graphic Designer§§Advertiser: §Creative Vision§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§30 Sept 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Rest of Waikato§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§Creative Vision is a family owned business located in the South Waikato, providing graphic design and printing services to a wide range of clients.  As a small team, we work hard and we work collaboratively to meet the needs of our clients.  We appreciate our staff for the time and effort they put into their roles, which in turn ensures the ongoing success of Creative Vision.§The Graphic Designer’s role is one that is critical to our business, requiring a person who is industrious and resourceful to combine flashes of inspiration, creativity and sensitivity so that the needs of our clients are met. §The role is responsible for the design and creation of business cards, calendars, invitations, flyers, newsletters, and all other design and printing needs of clients.  It is based at the Creative Vision premises in Tokoroa, and is currently for 32 hours per week.  Days of work are flexible, as there is a requirement to work alongside funeral directors and families to produce funeral booklets.§Ideally applicants for this role will have§A minimum of two years’ experience in graphic design§Experience with Adobe Suite (InDesign, Illustrator, Adobe Acrobat, Photo Shop, Premier Pro, Media software and da Vinci Resolve).§Experience with the Microsoft Office Suite§Familiarity with social media and the creation of website content using WordPress§The ability to operate a digital press – although training will be given.§Creativity, experience, attention to detail, communication skills, team work, and the ability to engage with clients will be valuable attributes in this role.  Applicants must be able to demonstrate the ability to work from conceptualisation to producing the finished product; and if you are invited to interview, please be prepared to bring your portfolio for viewing.§To apply for this role send your cover letter and CV to §account.cvp@gmail.com§ [link removed] by 18 October 2020.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50666354.txt	§Design / Marketing Assistant§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Design / Marketing Assistant§§Advertiser: §McBrimar Homes§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Rest of Otago§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§McBrimar Homes is a well-established, home building company in the thriving seaside town of Oamaru, we specialise in building high quality new homes. We develop our own subdivisions and therefore have a regular flow of residential construction work.§ §We are on the hunt for a Design / Marketing assistant to join our expanding, Oamaru based team.§ §You’ll have a good eye for design, photography and be a digital marketing guru to create engaging visual and written content that effectively communicates our story to potential new home owners.§ § § §An average day could include:§ § §Updating our design collateral and websites§ §Walking around our building sites and taking progress photographs§ §Creating engaging content and posting on our social channels§ §Digital monitoring, reporting and insights§ §Writing creative content for our emails and sending new campaigns§ §Working on branding for new subdivisions§ §Brainstorming ideas with the Marketing Manager and team§ §If you have a penchant for interiors you could help work on our show homes§ §Working with our photographer and videographer to create new content§ §Liaising with suppliers and business partners.§ § § §To be successful in this role, you need to have the following:§ § §A Degree or Diploma in Design and/or Marketing§ §If you have a design degree you’ll need to be a social/digital guru, ideally you’d have completed some marketing papers (a good understanding of Facebook Ad Manager and Google Ads is a real bonus)§ §If you have a marketing degree you’ll need an eye for design and have some Adobe knowledge§ §Excellent creative written communication§ §High level of attention to detail§ §A social personality§ §Photography skills§ §A keen learner, problem solver and a team player.§ § § §In return we offer:§ § §The opportunity to grow with the company and help shape it’s future§ §Job security with plenty of interesting work in the pipeline and our own subdivisions§ §Flexible hours if required§ §A great company culture§ §Renumeration based on experience.§ § § §How to Apply:§ §If this sounds like you, click 'Apply for this job'. Please attach a CV, a brief cover letter and a portfolio to show off any design skills.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50666419.txt	§Senior Interior Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Interior Designer§§Advertiser: §Tailor Inc Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Interior Design§§§§§§Tailor Inc                                           §Tailor Inc is a highly respected team of commercial design, delivery and project management professionals. We are located in the vibrant heart of Britomart in a contemporary character office. Our team are diverse, dynamic and down to earth with a fun social culture.§Widely viewed as the best in our field, our presence is rapidly expanding and we are looking for a highly experienced Senior Interior Designer responsible for managing multiple projects ranging from small to large-sized, to join our Britomart office.§Skills / Knowledge§NZ specific experience, 10+ years, which is necessary for team/project leadership role§Industry recognized diploma or degree in Interior Design or Interior Architecture§Understanding of financial aspects of running a design project on time and on budget§Exceptional communication skills (written and spoken English) in order to articulate and present concepts and ideas clearly and persuasively§Able to use the following: REVIT or AutoCAD, Sketch Up, PhotoShop, InDesign, Internet Explorer, Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint§Values§Drive and enthusiasm to inspire and lead other team members§Hard working, conscientious and highly organized approach§An approachable and professional manner with clients and suppliers and ability to build and maintain relationships§Ability to encourage a calm, positive environment with a flexible and good-humored approach§A passion and flair for design and capacity for innovation and forward thinking§ §As with our clients, Tailor seeks excellence and exception in its team members. We share a dedication to distinction, a love of the unexpected and a streak of cheekiness. This is reflected in our interactions and creations. Tailor Inc encourages creativity and career progression; you will have the opportunity to work towards a senior position within the business and be part of their journey as they grow as a team.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50667364.txt	§Senior Architect/Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Architect/Designer§§Advertiser: §Hays Architecture§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §        §Senior Architect/Designer §        §        §        §          §Top design studio §          §Close to public transport §          §Multi-unit residential projects §        §        §          §This Auckland based studio is looking for a Senior Designer/Architect with 8+ years experience.§ § §Your new company§ § Our client has been around for many successful years, however have emerged as one of NZ's most innovative design studios. With an industry sought after culture, our client believes in a thriving and social culture, promoting flexible working hours. With a cosy team of Architects and Designers, our client is a medium sized studio, primarily focusing in apartments, hospitality and aged care, this practice is continuing its impressive growth phase and are now looking for a Senior Architect on a permanent basis to join their Residential team with a strong and healthy pipeline.§ § §Your new role§ § Your new role will see you managing small teams and multiple projects through all phases from concept to completion. Delivery of design, project management and documentation will be main responsibilities and being in a senior position you will be leading an internal team, personally responsible for ensuring project deadlines are met and effectively communicating with clients and consultants.§ § §What you'll need to succeed§ § You will have a minimum of 8 years experience in NZ. A proven track record of working on multiple projects simultaneously through all phases. Strong technical skills in ArchiCAD is a must! Strong culture fit is paramount to this practice, therefore strong interpersonal skills and the ability to communicate effectively with both internal staff and external clients/consultants is required.§ § §What you'll get in return§ § You will have the opportunity to work in a practice that will provide you with the foundations to flourish with arguably the best Architects in the business, designing career defining projects. This is an outstanding opportunity for a someone to take their next step in a fast growing, market leading design studio. Career progression is taken very seriously. This is not just a role to fill-in the empty seats. We want great designers, forward thinking architects and innovative ideas because the reward and flexibility you'll get in return is certainly attractive.§ § §What you need to do now§ If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV, or call us now. jobText: TXT/50668089.txt	§Junior Graphic Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Junior Graphic Designer§§Advertiser: §Monster Group New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§About§ §We’re looking for a graphic designer with an eye for great design and advertisement to join our marketing team. You will be working as an assistant designer to ease the workload of our current designer so this would be ideal if you’re in the early stages of your career. If you have a passion for design and have a can-do attitude then we are looking for you.§ § §The Position§ §Your job will be quite varied as we work in an ever-changing environment but generally speaking your duties will include:§ § § §Work alongside our current designer, marketing team, and division managers to deliver new creative and marketing initiatives§ § § §Assist the design of our websites§ § § §Assist the design of both print and digital advertisements§ § § §Internal marketing design§ § §What we’re looking for:§ § § §Tertiary Graphic Design Qualification § § § §Experience and skill with Adobe CC (in particular with inDesign, Illustrator and Photoshop).§ § § §Experience working within brand guidelines§ § § §Great communication skills§ § § §Strong organisational skills and an excellent work ethic§ § § §A keen learner and problem solver with a can-do attitude§ § §What we offer:§ § § §Dynamic and motivating environment§ § § §An opportunity to learn § § § §Central Wellington location§ § §Our Core Values:§ § § §Never Stop Learning§ § § §Never Give Up§ § § §Be Personally Responsible§ § § §Trust the Process§ § § §There is no 'I' in Monster§ § § §Opportunities Are Everywhere§ § § §No Lazy Brain§ § § §Mahia TE Mahi§ § § §Customer First§ § § § §Send your CV & cover letter through Seek.co.nz. Including your portfolio would be a massive advantage in the recruitment process.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Intermediate Planners Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50670317.txt	§Intermediate Planners§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Planners§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Waitakere & West Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Intermediate Planners §      §        §•    Work on some of most high-profile developments in New Zealand§•    Excellent range of development and training options offered§•    Multiple roles based in CBD, South Auckland, North West§        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§        §Based across the Auckland region, we are looking for talented Intermediate Planners to join our Resource Consents unit. From advising on a new apartment blocks, heritage buildings or green fields subdivision, our Department will expose you to a vast array of District and regional planning experiences and opportunities. §        §As an Intermediate Planner, you’ll apply your planning expertise to the assessment of resource consent applications against relevant statutory requirements, such as the Unitary Plan and the Resource Management Act, and make recommendations that foster positive environmental outcomes. You will also attend Council hearings as a reporting officer and represent Council as an expert witness in environment court and other courts. §        §You will provide accurate professional advice, both verbally and in writing to applicants and the public, to ensure applicants and affected parties are aware of their rights and responsibilities while increasing their understanding of planning processes and regulatory controls.§        §Two positions are fixed term based in South Auckland, two positions (1x permanent / 1x fixed term) based in North West and one fixed term position based in Auckland CBD.   §We are also advertising Senior Planners positions in Auckland CBD and Orewa.  Please visit our §careers site§ for further opportunities. § §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        §You’ll bring with you around two to five years’ planning experience under your belt. You have a tertiary qualification in urban planning, resource management or in a similar field acknowledged by NZPI. With strong working knowledge of the Resource Management Act 1991, you’ll have a high level of customer service skills with excellent case management and both written and verbal communication skills. As this role may require you to occasionally travel around the region using Council vehicles, you’ll also ideally hold a full, clean New Zealand driver’s licence. § §        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§        §There are endless opportunities to develop your career in planning across the Council group; this position will expose you to a range of specialisations and potential job trajectories. Our Resource Consents Department processes more than 17,000 consents annually and facilitates a wide range of development projects, from major subdivisions and nationally significant infrastructure projects to houses, apartment buildings and shopping centres. The opportunities are diverse like no other planning job.§        §We offer flexible working arrangements and a competitive salary. As a Council employee, you’ll gain access to a vast range of benefits and discounts, including discounted insurance, gym membership and more. You’ll be joining a team of dedicated and respected experts working collaboratively across the region to contribute to Auckland’s growth and development. We are committed to diversity, and have a culture built on trust and valuing individual as well as collective contributions.§        §If you’re passionate about building a brighter future for Auckland like we are, then apply today!§        §Two positions are fixed term based in South Auckland, two positions (1x permanent / 1x fixed term) based in North West and one fixed term position based in Auckland CBD.   §We are also advertising Senior Planners positions in Auckland CBD and Orewa.  Please visit our §careers site§ for further opportunities. § §For the fixed-term opportunities, it is possible that the term of the contract may be extended dependent on market demand. If you are looking for a permanent position, we would still encourage you to make contact with us to discuss potential opportunities.§        §Applications will close on Thursday, 8 October 2020. §For more information about this opportunity, please contact Enna Cecilio on 021 223 2212 or request the job description by emailing §enna.cecilio@aucklandcouncil.govt.nz§.§        § Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§•    Work on some of most high-profile developments in New Zealand§•    Excellent range of development and training options offered§•    Multiple roles based in CBD, South Auckland, North West§  §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§  §Based across the Auckland region, we are looking for talented Intermediate Planners to join our Resource Consents unit. From advising on a new apartment blocks, heritage buildings or green fields subdivision, our Department will expose you to a vast array of District and regional planning experiences and opportunities. §  §As an Intermediate Planner, you’ll apply your planning expertise to the assessment of resource consent applications against relevant statutory requirements, such as the Unitary Plan and the Resource Management Act, and make recommendations that foster positive environmental outcomes. You have a tertiary qualification in urban planning, resource management or in a similar field acknowledged by NZPI. With strong working knowledge of the Resource Management Act 1991, you’ll have a high level of customer service skills with excellent case management and both written and verbal communication skills. As this role may require you to occasionally travel around the region using Council vehicles, you’ll also ideally hold a full, clean New Zealand driver’s licence. § §  §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§  §There are endless opportunities to develop your career in planning across the Council group; this position will expose you to a range of specialisations and potential job trajectories. Please visit our §careers site§ §for further opportunities.  §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        §You’ll bring with you at least four years of planning and resource management experience, and proven experience processing resource consents. jobTitle: Picture Framer & Assistant Gallery Manager Job in Bay of Plenty - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50670392.txt	§Picture Framer & Assistant Gallery Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Picture Framer & Assistant Gallery Manager§§Advertiser: §Portico§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Interior Design§§§§§§Picture Framer & Assistant Gallery Manager§ §We have a wonderful opportunity for an Assistant Gallery Manager and Trainee Picture Framer §to work in our friendly team at Portico in Pukuatua St, Rotorua§ §The Job§ § §Picture Framer§ You’ll be framing client’s artwork, working with professional framing tools, machinery and your own creativity. Daily framing tasks include cutting and constructing frames, cutting glass, mounting artwork and finishing frames to our high standard. You will be ensuring that work is carried out on schedule, so that frames are completed on time.§ §Assistant Gallery Manager§ You will also be responsible for a variety of admin tasks including the updating of databases, keeping track of accounts, monitoring/ordering framing stock and liaising with suppliers and customers via email and phone. § §Your Skills§ §You will have an aptitude for design, colour, composition and craftwork with a strong eye for detail.§ §This is a skilled and active position that requires a good level of physical fitness and manual dexterity. You will be comfortable working on your feet all day. The work involves the use of complex machinery to construct frames, mats and glass. § §You will have a can-do attitude and approach challenges in a calm and thoughtful manner. The role requires high levels of concentration; thus, it is a quiet working environment and you must be happy to work independently throughout the day. Good time management is essential.§ §Excellent customer service skills are a must, to help create a positive and happy experience for our wonderful customers and good communication is essential within our team.§ §Good computer/keyboard skills are essential. A good grip of basic maths and the willingness to learn is required for mat designs/layouts.§ §You will be familiar with working online, updating social media and our website as well as working with our POS sale and framing management systems.§ §You’ll enjoy consulting with customers on the framing of their artwork, helping them through the process of selecting materials and advising them on their choice of styles and colours.§ §Your Experience§ §Previous experience of the admin tasks listed above is an advantage.  § §Previous framing experience is not essential, as full training will be provided to the successful candidate.§ §Picture framing is a skilled craft requiring patience, calmness and ongoing learning. We’d love to meet with you if you are interested in a long-term commitment to a rewarding and creative career that provides loads of job satisfaction.§ §Apply for this Job§ §Please apply with your CV AND a covering letter specifically detailing what skills or experience you have which make you the right person for the role of Picture Framer at Portico, and what you will contribute to the ongoing success of our company.§ §Please do not apply unless you have NZ Citizenship or a permanent residence visa.  § §An immediate start is possible.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50670548.txt	§Frame & Truss Detailer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Frame & Truss Detailer§§Advertiser: §Precut Construction§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architectural Drafting§§§§§§About the business§ § §Precut Construction is a family owned business, specialising in pre-fabricated frames and trusses. We have been in operation for 30 years and pride ourselves on being small enough to provide our customers with personal service, and big enough to be competitive. Precut strives for excellence by utilising the latest technology and software.§ § §About the role§ § §As a Detailer, you will be working closely with each of our 13 employees, and our loyal customers. If you are a detail-oriented individual whose previous experience demonstrates an ability to prioritise your time and work to deadlines, coupled with the below listed skills, we would love to hear from you.§ § §Benefits and perks§ §A competitive salary§Staff rates§ § §Skills and experience§ §A minimum of 3 years detailing experience in Frames and Trusses§Proficient in MiTek 20/20, or Sapphire (having achieved 101 MiTek exams) desirable but not essential§A good understanding of residential construction techniques, NZS3604, timber grades and basic timber engineering§Sound communication skills are an absolute must as you will be dealing with the whole team and our Customers§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§Do you have experience working on residential construction projects?§How many years' experience do you have in the construction industry?§§§

jobText: TXT/50670656.txt	§Detailer - Hamilton§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Detailer - Hamilton§§Advertiser: §Fletcher Building Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architectural Drafting§§§§§§PlaceMakers is New Zealand's leading and largest supplier of building materials to New Zealand’s commercial and residential construction markets. Part of New Zealand’s largest listed company, Fletcher Building, we employ more than 2,100 people in over 60 locations across the country and stock more than 100,000 product lines from concrete to paint and plasterboard.§§§PlaceMakers continuously strives to be the best building partner in the market and takes pride in providing the highest level of service to our customers. Our motto is that no one is easier to do business with. In line with this, we want to deliver our projects in an efficient manner that exceeds the expectations of our customers. To support the growing demand in the business, PlaceMakers Frame & Truss Waikato is looking to take on another two experienced Detailer's to join the team.§§§About the Role:§§This role has you reporting to the head detailer and will involve the following§• Interpretation of architectural plans and producing detailed frame & truss drawings, using MiTek software.§• Visit the site if required§• Liaise with builders, other employees, other customers and PlaceMakers staff§• Ensuring that all truss detailing and wall frame detailing is accurate, provided in a timely manner, and to the highest possible standard.§§§About You:§§To be a successful applicant, you must have a minimum of three years’ experience in detailing and you must have a strong ability to read and interpret plans, quantify trusses, frames, and other components involved. Sound knowledge of NZS3604_2011 and MiTek software.§§Other skills and experience required:§§• You will need to be well organised to be able to juggle a number of tasks at any one time§• You will be service-driven and solution-oriented to ensure tasks are completed efficiently§• You will have strong work ethic and have the ability to work autonomously§• You will have strong communication skills to effectively communicate plans and progress§• You will have high attention to detail maintaining a good level of accuracy in your work§• You must be systems savvy ideally with the previous experience in MiTek 2020§§What’s in it for you?§§This role will see you working on a wide variety of projects expanding your portfolio. Being part of the Fletcher Building group, we offer a wide range of benefits include discounts on health insurance, banking, fuel, employee education fund and additionally, you will be a part of great team with a supportive and inclusive culture.§§Apply now to fast forward your career as part of a well-regarded business which values its staff as its biggest asset. Please quote job number PMK/§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Great People.§  §www.thecreativestore.co.nz§  § §  §FREELANCE§ – §Intermediate – Senior level. Are you looking to freelance? We have a wide range of freelance and contract roles. Ranging from 1 day to 3 – 6 month contracts – offering you flexibility to pick and choose when you want to work.  You have the option to invoice or to have your paye done for you.  Easy As.§  § §  §UX / UI / Digital Designer.§  §Are you an ambitious, dynamic, high energy UX/UI designer looking to work in a supportive, highly regarded team? Can you walk the talk when it comes to Agile and iterative design processes? This role is a 6-month contract for an intermediate to senior level UX/UI designer, who can start mid October on a 6-month minimum engagement. You will have strengths in user research, product design and design system implementation. §Reference #27178.§  §Graphic / Digital Designer.§  §Would you love to work with a large bustling retail client? We have 3-month contract with NZ’s largest shoe retailer, based on the North Shore, Auckland. This role is a mixture of on-site and remote work, you will need you own Mac and will have a solid knowledge of retail, point of sale and all the key skills and elements required to produce collateral for both print and digital. This is a busy role where you will assist with the upcoming busy Christmas season. §Reference #27180.§  §UI / UX Designer.§  §Joining this growing product team, you will work on their main site – this includes customer microsites, editorial pages, and internal projects that require a broad vision for the company. You will evolve the product and engineering departments to design future iterations and an app. You will have a strong eye for design and detail. Experience in UX is ideal, although not a requirement. You will be a team player and able to communicate and collaborate well with others. Your aesthetic is minimal and refined and you live and breathe good design. §Reference #27155.§  §Graphic / Digital Designer – Junior – Intermediate - Christchurch.§  §Are you looking for a junior to intermediate level design role and would love to work with an amazing, strategic, and award-winning brand and digital agency based in Christchurch? You will be a great strategic brand and digital designer, full of ideas, enthusiasm and have that bit of magic – ready to expand your skillset, working on some high-profile New Zealand, Australian and Global clients.§ Reference #27096§.§  § §  §Email your CV and work to Hana Chadwick, §Hana@thecreativestore.co.nz§. If you would like further details on any of the above roles, visit our website §www.thecreativestore.co.nz§ or call us at The Creative Store on §(09) 365 1077§.§  § §  §We will only review candidates who have a valid work permit / working rights for New Zealand.§  § §  §www.thecreativestore.co.nz§  §Great TXT. jobText: TXT/50671306.txt	§Senior Architectural Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Architectural Technician§§Advertiser: §Active Architecture Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§$75,000 - $89,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architectural Drafting§§§§§§What we Offer§Wide variety of residential work from small renovations to high end new builds and light commercial and fitouts.§Permanent position, flexible hours and work from home considered§Sustainably driven office and design philosophy§Our Company §We are a small established office currently in an exciting period of rapid growth. §The Role§As a Senior Architectural Technician, you will be primarily taking projects from developed design into working drawings for consent submission and site supervision. You will be working alongside the design director but will be the primary force behind each project's completion. You may also be leading a team of less experienced architectural graduates/technicians and will be expected to provide support to those working on other projects in the office. §The wide range of projects we are involved with will enable you to take advantage of your extensive construction knowledge, experience and proficiency across the residential and light commercial/fitout sector and achieve the reward of seeing your efforts come to fruition quickly. §Your Qualities§You have a flare and passion for design and detail, and the ability to effectively communicate and manage expectations surrounding your projects especially as you may be required to manage and mentor less experienced technicians and graduates.§In addition you have:§at least 5 years' experience as an Architectural Technician in New Zealand, and experience in using ArchiCAD is absolutely essential.§a National Diploma or Degree in Architecture, and a thorough knowledge of New Zealand Building Code, and a high level of understanding of NZ construction methods.§a practical knowledge of NZS3604:2011 & NZBC Acceptable Solutions.§The Returns§The vibrant and fun team and office culture will make your day fly and this position is a great opportunity to be involved in some increasingly exciting and complex projects, and enjoy a senior role in a growing design based company. The ability to be autonomous in and manage your own schedule while having the necessary support to succeed is integral to this role. §What now?§Contact me immediately if you are interested in this position on the details below.§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as an architectural technician?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§How many years' experience do you have in the construction industry?§Do you have a current New Zealand driver's licence?§Have you completed a qualification in architecture?§§§

jobText: TXT/50671482.txt	§Lead Designer, APEC Virtual Experience§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Designer, APEC Virtual Experience§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Foreign Affairs & Trade§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §Lead Designer, APEC Virtual Experience §    §    §      §        §          §            §Lead Designer, APEC Virtual Experience§            §              §First fully virtual APEC hosting year§              §Wellington-based, modern offices in central location§            §            §Nāku te rourou, nāu te rourou, ka ora aite iwi§            §(With your contribution and my contribution, everyone will thrive)§            §Are you a driven service design leader with experience in events, user experience, and virtual platforms? Do you thrive working in a fast-paced environment as part of a cross-functional high performing team? Are you a self-starter with the ability to jump straight in to the job at hand? Then, do we have the opportunity for you.§            §The Ministry is ambitious about New Zealand's role in the Asia Pacific, and the role trade and economic policy can play in addressing future challenges. In 2021 New Zealand will chair APEC and for the first time the entire year of meetings will be run virtually. APEC 2021 is a significant opportunity for New Zealand to work with our fellow economies to support the region's economic recovery from COVID-19.§            §With our APEC year now entirely virtual, we need somebody to work collaboratively across the APEC NZ team to design and embed the virtual hosting experience we wish to deliver to delegates. Delivering our event year virtually presents a significant opportunity to showcase New Zealand in a way that has not been done before and position ourselves as an enabler of digital diplomacy, and we need you to help drive this.§            §The Lead Designer, APEC Virtual Experience will be responsible for elevating the virtual delivery experience across all meetings to ensure a positive experience for Delegates and participants. This role will work collaboratively across the programme, incorporating feedback to make continuous improvements and building a standard of best practice for virtual event delivery. How you perform in this role will be pivotal to the success of our APEC host year and the virtual experience we deliver to delegates.§            §The Lead Designer, APEC Virtual Experience will be responsible for:§            §Virtual Experience Design and Delivery:§            §              §Developing a base of knowledge from other virtual events to build a standard of best practice for virtual event delivery.§              §Using human centered design / service design / user experience design / design thinking, oversee and contribute to the development of services and processes involved in virtual event delivery.§              §Working collaboratively across the programme to drive change in behaviour and practice that embeds virtual delivery experience across work-streams.§              §Leading and facilitating design sprints and customer research in person and virtually using online collaboration tools.§              §Acting as an SME for virtual hosting design and delivery.§              §Sharing learnings from other virtual events with the wider programme team.§              §Drawing on previous work completed for physical APEC delivery and adapt where possible for a virtual environment.§              §Continuously refining and improving the virtual experience as events progress.§              §Linking in to the MFAT Digital Diplomacy programme to establish synergies.§              §Balancing the vision for virtual hosting with practicalities and constraints, working within allocated budget and scope.§              §Working across teams to transact virtual hosting arrangements.§            §            §User Training:§            §              §Contributing to the development of training material for Delegates and other internal and external users.§            §            §Performance Evaluation and Continuous Improvement:§            §              §Leading the development of service standards and measures of success in relation to key services.§              §Seeking feedback on virtual event delivery from a variety of sources and incorporate for continuous improvement.§              §Measuring the success of the virtual experience against set standards periodically to continuously refine and improve the experience as events progress.§            §            §Relationship and People Management:§            §              §Collaborating across the APEC NZ Team to embed virtual experience.§              §Facilitating inter-agency engagement as it relates to event experience.§              §Interfacing with the APEC Technology Team to scope virtual experience delivery requirements.§              §Leading the APEC working group for Digital Diplomacy.§            §            §Additional Duties:§            §              §Managing the relevant project budget.§              §Actively participating in the APEC Management team.§              §Supporting the wider APEC NZ team as required.§            § fixed term role with an indicative end date of 31st January 2022.§            §Please apply by following the link provided, attaching your CV and a cover letter outlining the skills, knowledge and experience you can bring to the role explaining why you are the ideal candidate§            §Applications close: Sunday 18 October, 11:59pm§            §For more information please email Gina Robbins
