Globally there are 95+ Product Design and Design Research practitioners across NZ, AU, UK, US and Canada. We are all one team and work cross functionally with our product and development teammates to create beautiful, enabling and meaningful experiences for our customers.§ § § §About the role§ §You will be managing a team of Product Designers, providing mentoring and coaching, so that they can do their best work and continue to develop their skills and expertise.§ §Managers work closely with their Design Directors to share in the strategy work and conversations. You’ll actively support the work of the designers in your team, applying your knowledge and skills and building strong relationships with engineering leads and product managers to help influence prioritisation of work and roadmap items.§ §As part of the wider leadership team you’ll also share a responsibility for aspects of making the design team better, such as: Helping deliver the team’s professional development programme, and creating better processes across the team like continuously improving ways we work with development teams§ § § §Day to day you will§ § §Work closely with our engineering and product teams§ §Offer design critique to all Designers, sharing your thoughts and domain knowledge in a useful and constructive way§ §You will be responsible for developing your teams careers and enabling them to be the best they can be at Xero§ §You’ll align your team to the overall strategy of Design, reviewing your teams performance, and managing resource requests for your portfolio of work§ §You’ll present design and design strategy to a variety of internal and external groups, from product colleagues to C-level executives § §At Xero we’re always growing! This means you’ll also be responsible for the recruitment, onboarding, engagement and management of new team members.§ § § §What you need for this role:§ § §You're a designer first and foremost - you'll have a strong background in Product Design or Experience Design, backed by a portfolio that demonstrates high-quality design outcomes, contributing to user experience and business value§ §You’ve seen and done it all! - You’ll be experienced in the entire design process, from uncovering customer needs and pain points, to executing elegant interfaces§ §You have hands on experience managing a team of designers§ §You're a collaborator! You'll have have heaps of experience working closely with developers and other designers in cross functional teams§ §And of course… you’re passionate about supporting, enabling and empowering other designers§ §*To be considered for this role you must submit a portfolio of work.§ § § §Why work at Xero?§ §Working at Xero will provide you with a diverse and inclusive environment alongside people who will respect, challenge, support and mentor you. Who says you can't have fun while you do the best work of your life?§ §We see the value in work-life balance, many of us take full advantage of our flexible working arrangements, so whether you like to get a surf in before work, like to head home in time to pick up the kids or you just like working from the comfort of your own home now and then, we want to support you.§ §We trust you to build your career to the best of your ability and we will support your hunger to learn with training and career mentorship, to help you flourish. Our facilities and PX teams work hard to give us great workspaces with all the tech company perks so join us and experience our awesome culture!§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50680102.txt	§Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Designer§§Advertiser: §The People Place§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§About Us§  § We are industry leaders and specialists in sourcing and providing creative promotional merchandise to our clients. With a reputation built on expert service, honesty and integrity, we are a thriving business that despite being in business since 1931, is in a period of massive growth resulting in an exciting start-up vibe.§  § Driven by a vision to be the world's most loved branded merchandise agency, Novelli has a genuine commitment to innovation and a philosophy that all people they come into contact with should leave more successful – whether they be employees, clients or suppliers. This is a safe and supportive environment where you can learn and grow amongst a team full of positive and fun people who have an attitude for success.§  § §About the role§  § Based in the heart of Smales Farm at the B: HIVE, your role is one that is critical to the business. We require a creative thought-leader who is resourceful and proactive. We pride ourselves on client delivery and our ability to work with energy and pace, so a can-do attitude and a willingness to go the extra mile is a must.§  § Primary responsibilities will include:§ § §Designing and creating products based on client briefs§ §Handling the day-to-day operation of the design workflow§ §Communicating with internal stakeholders on project updates/timeframes§ §Coaching and mentoring a Junior Mac Operator§ §Keeping up to date with product trends§ §Creating content for client pitches and proposals§ §Designing internal documentation and marketing collateral§ § §About you§  § Our team is client-centric, efficient and hard working. This role will require not only those traits but a robust creative capability, good attention to detail and the ability to adopt a 'no job is too small' ethos.§  § Alongside this, you will also possess:§ § §A University Degree of a relevant discipline§ §Minimum 2 years in design-based position§ §Superb written and verbal communication§ §Strong commercial acumen§ §Ability to analyse information and make recommendations§ §Competence in InDesign, Photoshop, Acrobat and Illustrator§ §Working knowledge of production files with pre-press skills§ §Able to work under pressure and to tight timelines§ §Proactive attitude and adaptable, quick learner§ §The confidence to ask questions, collaborate cross functionally and push back when necessary§ § §How to apply:§  § If you're looking for your next creative role, more accountability and opportunity, we'd love to hear from you! Please submit a copy of your tailored cover letter and CV via Seek.§  § This role is based in Auckland - all applicants must be legally able to reside and work in New Zealand to apply for this role.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§How many years of commercial design experience do you have?§How many years' experience do you have as a designer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50680323.txt	§Project Lead Architect§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Lead Architect§§Advertiser: §Maynard Marks§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§Who are we?§ §Maynard Marks is a New Zealand owned and operated award-winning, specialist Building Consultancy that is recognised as a leader in its fields of work.  As a technical professional services consultancy, we have been assisting our clients for over twelve years and have offices in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch.  Our team of experts includes Architects, Building Surveyors, Quantity Surveyors, Asbestos Assessors, Project Managers and Structural Engineers.  Our industry leading experts provide technical advice on building and property matters to every sector of business across New Zealand.  § §Due to our consultancy’s continued growth we now have an exciting opportunity in our NZIA practice for an experienced Project Lead Architect to join our dynamic design and detail-focused architectural team.§ §Your new opportunity§ §We are seeking an ambitious, talented, and experienced Architect with a strong technical focus to lead projects through all design phases including on-site phases of projects.§ §Your work will involve leading project teams, liaising with clients, contractors and consultants, and resolving complex construction details and specifications. This role also supports our Architectural Practice Leaders where you will play a pivotal role in  developing rising talent and promoting Architectural excellence by example.§ §The successful candidate will possess:§ § §10+ years relevant experience in the New Zealand market.§ §A proven track record to successfully run multiple projects and teams.§ §Comprehensive technical knowledge of NZ construction, relevant legislation, and codes of practice.§ §An in depth understanding of quality assurance processes, risk analysis and mitigation strategies.§ §Ability to motivate project teams to exceed KPI's and fee target goals.§ §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a clear focus on client needs, working with integrity and delivering quality on every project.§ §Ability to develop new business and coordinate proposals and tender submissions.§ §What can we offer you?§ §A competitive remuneration package, a clear career progression path, numerous training and professional development opportunities, plus the chance to work for an award-winning consultancy with an excellent market reputation. The successful candidate would be joining a diverse and supportive working environment with an active social event calendar and multiple opportunities to engage in company wide activities.§ §If you would like to apply for this exciting role, please submit your CV, portfolio and selected technical drawings (no greater than 5MB) to: HR@maynardmarks.co.nz § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a project architect?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§Have you completed a qualification in architecture?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobTitle: Principal Architect Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50684069.txt	§Principal Architect§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Architect§§Advertiser: §AIA New Zealand§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§$160,000 - $189,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§At AIA, our vision is to champion New Zealand to be one of the healthiest and most protected nations in the world. We strive to help Kiwis live healthier, longer, better lives by encouraging them to make positive lifestyle changes one step at a time. Our firm belief is that by following our operating philosophy of doing the right thing, in the right way with the right people, the results will come. AIA Insurance for Life, Health and Wellbeing.§ § § §This role reports into our Head of Architecture & Integration and is a key individual leadership role in bringing our vision to life. You’ll be someone who has strong analytical and conceptional skills while putting people and stakeholder management at the heart of it all. The key goal for this role is to describe and help deliver the organisation’s current and future state, as well as define the high-level change agenda required to enable it. Success will be driven through proactive engagement with business and technology stakeholders and having clear plans and roadmaps developed and maintained. Throughout strategic implementation, the role includes solution design as well as the governance activities required to manage any associated risk.§ § § §Key Responsibilities:§ § §Contribute to the overall high performance of the Technology Engagement Team, ensuring strong awareness of business and technology requirements beyond the role.§ §Through consultation and agreement with key stakeholders, develop, maintain and communicate an enterprise capability strategy and the aligned technology roadmap.§ §Facilitate effective enterprise architecture development including business architecture, information architecture, solution architecture and domain views.§ §Facilitate the appropriate level of understanding of all architectural deliverables across stakeholder groups.§ §Prepare, manage and report key performance metrics on progress to plan.§ §Develop and implement a methodology for assessing strategic and tactical business needs, ensuring these are in line with the agreed business strategy.§ §Ensure strong stakeholder management, gaining ‘buy in’ to the technology roadmap from across the organisation (including Executive).§ §Develop innovative solutions to business problems§ §Establish, run and participate in appropriate governance forums to ensure adherence to the agreed technology direction and guidelines.§ §Establish and own the AIA New Zealand Architecture Practice, to develop capability and raise awareness of the function.§ §Assist in the prioritisation of technology initiatives.§ §About you:§ § §Strong analytical and conceptual skills combined with business knowledge and pragmatism.§ §Experience with process redesign models (such as lean six sigma) and tools (such as ARIS).§ §People and relationship management expertise – ability to build relationships across teams within technology, and with customer groups.§ §Excellent written and verbal communication and presentation skills.§ §Negotiation and problem-solving skills.§ §Ability to articulate a vision and present to all levels of the organisation.§ §Excellent understanding of technology principles, frameworks and architectures.§ §Broad understanding of technology standards, processes and methodologies across a wide range of services (middleware, systems integration, data warehousing, business intelligence, quality assurance and testing).§ §Previous experience in defining, maintaining and advocating architecture models within a large organisation.§ §Keen understanding and insights around IT trends and future opportunities.§ §Sustained high levels of performance and achievement within a technology environment.§ §IT related tertiary qualification.§ §Business post grad qualification preferred§ § § §Healthier, Longer, Better Lives§ §At AIA, wellbeing is at our core. We understand that healthy employees are happy employees. That’s why we have a culture of care that promotes wellbeing and flexibility, recharge days, flexible work arrangements and an AIA Vitality membership (including a FitBit!). § §We focus on career development, people development and leadership capability, so that you’ll be nurtured and have every opportunity to reach your full potential.§ §We recognise your efforts and hard work because we understand that everyone in our AIA family is important. When people feel valued, they become more productive and satisfied, and we want you to feel inspired every day.§ §We’re an equal opportunity employer that embraces and values diversity and inclusion in our workforce. We believe that for people to be their best selves at work, they must feel they can be themselves. We celebrate both our differences and similarities including how we dress, and we trust our employees to dress appropriately and comfortably for their day.§ § § §Apply now!§§§§

jobText: TXT/50692517.txt	§Graphic Design / Digital Design / Mac Op TXT§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graphic Design / Digital Design / Mac Op TXT§§Advertiser: §The Creative Store§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§The Creative Store§ §Great TXT. Great People.§ §www.thecreativestore.co.nz§ § § § § §FREELANCE§ -§ We have a wide range of freelance and contract roles available for immediate start. These are Junior, Intermediate & Senior level. Ranging from 1 day to 3 – 6 month contracts – offering you flexibility to pick and choose when you want to work. You have the option to invoice or to have your paye done for you. Easy As.§ § § §Graphic / Digital Designer.§ §Would you love to work with a large bustling retail client? We have 3-month contract with NZ’s largest shoe retailer, based on the North Shore, Auckland. This role is a mixture of on-site and remote work, you will need you own Mac and will have a solid knowledge of retail, point of sale and all the key skills and elements required to produce collateral for both print and digital. This is a busy role where you will assist with the upcoming busy Christmas season. If you are looking for a contract to start ASAP for 3 months through to Christmas – this is it. §Reference #27180.§ §Graphic Designer.§ §Our client is a very busy and popular Auckland real estate brand based on the North Shore, Auckland. This role will sit within their marketing design team and will work across advertising, direct marketing, events, and marketing collateral, including digital and social media. In this role you will be working autonomously, and have amazing attention to detail, you are fast, accurate and can turn your hand to a range of skills, quickly and creatively. You will have at least 3 years’ experience and a high level of skills – producing collateral across all channels, along with the smarts in digital and multimedia. §Reference #27170.§ §UX / UI / Digital Designer.§ §Are you an ambitious, dynamic, high energy UX/UI designer looking to work in a supportive, highly regarded team? Can you walk the talk when it comes to Agile and iterative design processes? This role is a 6-month contract for an intermediate to senior level UX/UI designer, who can start mid October on a 6-month minimum engagement. You will have strengths in user research, product design and design system implementation. You will be confident and able to articulate and manage communication with internal stakeholders. §Reference #27178.§ §Graphic Designer.§ §Are you a designer with a love of architecture? Here is your chance to work in a role where you will be involved across both producing collateral and video content for this great company. This architectural based company creates and informs the wider architectural community about innovations and builds through their content rich website. You work closely with the directors, interpreting briefs and producing compelling content. Along with your graphic design skills, you will be amazing at creating videos and animation. You are a born creative and this will come through in everything you do. §Reference #27018.§ §Graphic / Digital Designer – Junior – Intermediate - Christchurch.§ §Our client is looking for a multi-skilled designer, who will join a team of skilled practitioners who offer great mentoring and training. With their wealth of industry experience – they will ensure you are schooled in top design. If you are keen to be immersed in brand and digital and looking to grow – this is an amazing opportunity for you. You will be great client facing and be confident and happy to talk through complex design solutions. §Reference #27096.§ § § §Send your CV and work to Hana Chadwick at The Creative Store, email §Hana@thecreativestore.co.nz§, or if you would like further details on any of the above roles, visit our website §www.thecreativestore.co.nz§ or call The Creative Store on §(09) 365 1077§.§ § § §We will only review candidates who have a valid work permit / working rights for New Zealand.§ § § §www.thecreativestore.co.nz§ §Great TXT. Great People.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50694651.txt	§Intermediate Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Planner§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§Employment Type:§  Permanent§  §Applications Close: §25 October 2020§  §Working for our Infrastructure Operations Group provides the opportunity to impact the liveability of Hamilton today and for generations to come. We provide safe and trusted infrastructure that our community wants, and our city needs. We’re looking after what keeps Hamilton running now and building the city of the future. Our work is the backbone of our great river city and we’re proud to deliver world-class solutions for Hamilton. Working with us is a chance to leave your legacy on your community and city.§We have a new opportunity for an Intermediate Planner to join our City Waters Assets team. In this position you will actively monitor and engage on behalf of City Waters in changes to legislation, policy and plans, standards, codes and similar documents which may impact on the work we do. You will be key in the development of strategic policy and processes to ensure City Waters meets its obligations under various District, Regional and National planning and policy direction.§You’ll be joining a team of experienced practitioners who are passionate about the work they do for the city. Our ideal candidate will have a Bachelor’s degree in Planning (or similar), have a minimum of 3 years’ experience in a similar role, and have a robust working knowledge of the RMA, LGA and other relevant legislation.§  §Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together. This is your chance to be part of an organisation that is committed to building a more vibrant, attractive and prosperous city.§  §Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together.§This is your chance to be part of an organisation that is committed to building a more vibrant, attractive and prosperous city.§  §A copy of the position description can be viewed by clicking §HERE§  §If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. Short-listed candidates may be required to complete an interview process, reference checks, pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol assessments, credit check and a Ministry of Justice or Police vetting check.§Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies. Only people who are already eligible to live and work in New Zealand should apply. Evidence will be required.§§§§§

jobText: TXT/50709189.txt	§Senior/Principal Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior/Principal Planner§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§Permanent, Full-time (will consider part-time applications)§ §At Hamilton City Council we are committed to attracting the best and brightest to our team.§ §Through our work we are enabling a city of growth that is home to some of the world’s most innovative businesses. We are one of them!§ §We are seeking to bring a new member into our planning team at a senior level who will add to the depth of experience and expertise of this unit.  Working as either a Principal or Senior Planner we are seeking a pragmatic, enabling and solutions focused practitioner.  As a Unit we are focused on finding people who can think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together, so cultural and team fit is essential.   If working part time is a preference of yours, we are open to consideration of this and encourage you to share those preferences with us.§ §As a Senior/Principal Planner you will be influencing and shaping development and providing a senior level contribution to the team.  You will be responsible for processing complex and challenging applications and providing guidance and mentoring to other members of the planning team.  Working collaboratively across Council and leading technical planning projects will also be a key part of the role.§ §You will have a Bachelor’s Degree in Planning or Resource management, and equivalent tertiary qualification and ideally seven or more years’ experience in planning and resource management application.§ §Beyond the bounds of work, Hamilton has a great cafe culture, flourishing arts scene, and opportunities to make the most of the short distance to ski fields and beaches. If relocating to our great City is on the cards for you, we can help with that too!§ §Our Planning Guidance Unit is committed to building on the lifestyle and economy we already have in Hamilton and maximising all opportunities that will redefine Hamilton as one of New Zealand’s leading cities. If you are ready to join a fun team, committed to being high-performance then we would love to hear from you, apply online today.§ §Remuneration is negotiable dependent upon skills and experience.§ §Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together.§ §This is your chance to be part of an organisation that is committed to building a more vibrant, attractive and prosperous city.§ §A copy of the position description can be requested by emailing §hr.request@hcc.govt.nz§ §If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. We will be screening applications as they come through so don’t hesitate, apply today!§ §All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. Short-listed candidates may be required to complete an interview process, reference checks, pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol assessments, credit check and a Ministry of Justice or Police vetting check.§ §Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies. Only people who are already eligible to live and work in New Zealand should apply. Evidence will be required.§ §Applications Close: 30 October 2020§ §Apply online at www.hamilton.govt.nz/our-council/careers§§§§

Specialising in the residential market from high-end residential projects through to first home buyers.§ § § §We are looking for an experienced Architectural Technician. You will be part of a motivated and driven team which is reflected by our strong local network and future project flow pushing right through into 2021.§Your new role§Our practice excels in high quality design and exceptional workmanship. jobText: TXT/50712514.txt	§Intermediate, Senior Technician Wanted§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate, Senior Technician Wanted§§Advertiser: §CreativeArch Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§9 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$90,000 - $100,000§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architectural Drafting§§§§§§If you are ambitious; have exceptional drawing/documentation skills; genuinely enjoy contributing to a team; & thrive on driving the commercial success of the business; then this could be your opportunity to make a difference!§The Firm:§This is not your standard architectural practise…§Creative Arch is a highly successful practise located in a ‘purpose built’ offices at the edge of Grey Lynn. Established in 1998 they have gone from strength to strength and are now a market leader and ‘employer of choice’. Their business model is creative and nimble, with a diverse workload that stretches across 3x multi-disciplined companies: Creative Arch, Infusion Arch and Resolution Arch. Their projects encompass residential, medium/high density developments, hotels, commercial buildings, and remedial development. §Creative Arch’s highly capable Owners and General Manager are skilled in strategy, execution, systems, and culture building. They are hugely proud of creating a positive, flexible environment that genuinely gives people accountability. Training and development programmes are a key focus enabling staff to perform at their best and develop their careers. Reward and recognition are highly important, with the icing on the cake being a company trip to Fiji in 2018 to recognise their 20 years of success. It is no surprise that the 16x employees with a significant number being long-standing creates a ‘tight knit’ team.  It is just the way they roll!§The Role:§The position will have you work closely with all aspects of architecture in a varied role ranging from residential, commercial, and remedial projects across our 3 business units. Your key objective – exceptional service, excellence in quality, a focus on innovative solutions and detailed designs! As such, you will need to have suitable experience, ability to work in a team environment. §Delivery beyond expectations will be your ‘norm’.§Background:§The successful candidate will have a minimum of 5 years Architectural experience. You are qualified in New Zealand with a Bachelor of Architecture, Diploma of Architecture Technology, New Zealand CAD or similar. Experience with NZS3604 and NZBC are essential. You currently provide exceptional high-quality design, technical and Project Architectural services and can display evidence of this. §You pride yourself on delivering your clients incomparable results, solutions & pathways. Your key stakeholders will comment on your high “emotional intelligence”, adaptability and critical thinking. You are pragmatic and ambitious, with resilience and a “just get on with it” attitude§.§ Collaborative by nature, you are keen to contribute to an innovative business that embraces these attributes, values work-life balance, and rewards performance. Outstanding results will provide awesome prospects for you and your career.§Does this sound like you? – If so please send your CV or to request an information pack email §info@creativearch.co.nz§  §att: Mark McLeay §All enquiries will be treated with the utmost of confidence. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50719777.txt	§Graphic Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graphic Designer§§Advertiser: §Populous People§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Hastings§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§ §Join a seriously innovative bunch - and work amongst a f§ast paced and great young team§ § §Ready to join a company that offers you the chance to work across a huge range of graphic design elements and projects every day? What a great time to be joining this innovative customer-centric e-commerce business that continues to expand rapidly. The business owners have a commercial mantra that if you don’t know, you find out. As a result, they continue to innovate and grow rapidly across their current markets while exploring others. They are recognized as an NZ e-commerce success story-based right in the heart of Hawke’s Bay, and are well led by an energetic and intuitive modern leadership team.   The marketing team is expanding, and we are on the hunt for a talented, energetic, proactive Graphic Designer to join them in their Hastings HQ§ § §This role is all about to creating and executing daily graphic design requirements that are at times acutely time bound. Reporting to the Digital Marketing Manager, you will be taking personal responsibility for ensuring integrity and presentation of their brand assets and identity in line with their daily and weekly promotional cycles. This will all lead to further brand awareness and revenue generation. Platforms include Facebook, Instagram, Google, YouTube, and Klaviyo. You must know what it takes in graphic design to increase web site traffic and call to action from consumers.§ § §To win this role, you will be able to demonstrate passion for creating quality output with balancing the pragmatic need to hit design deadlines.  You will have a proven graphic design track record in the digital media space, and using packages such as Adobe Creative Suite, Photoshop, InDesign, and Illustrator. It goes without saying, you will have an eye for detail, are able to communicate across a range of stakeholders and are have currency with the latest web tech practices and trends.§ § §This is a great role for a talented designer to make a real impact in a successful, fast growing company with a passionate and talented team. If you have the creative flair, and the ability to turn around great content quickly, §please apply with your resume and examples of your work through this www.seek.co.nz portal.  If you want to learn more, then telephone the team at Populous People, §06 875 8446§.§ § § §Please note, only candidates who are have full NZ working rights will be eligible for this role.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50736827.txt	§Planning Team Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Planning Team Lead§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§Location:§ Hamilton Central§ §Employment Type:§  Permanent§ §Applications Close: §8 November 2020§ §The Planning Guidance Unit is focused on shaping and enabling the development of our great city through the efficient delivery of our regulatory functions under the Resource Management Act and Local Government Act.§In this newly created leadership role, we are seeking a dynamic individual with the ability to navigate and negotiate solutions to complex problems whilst leading a team of experienced and developing planners.§Working alongside two fellow Planning Lead’s and reporting to the Planning Guidance Unit Manager, you will be joining a highly collaborative and supportive leadership team. For your team you will be responsible for providing the people and technical leadership to enable delivery of the Council’s resource consenting and other statutory functions.  Implicit in this role is the ability to develop and maintain internal and external relationships including elected members, Iwi and customer/stakeholders.§Our ideal candidate will have a relevant tertiary qualification, and experience leading successful and engaged teams. You’ll be a strong communicator with adept relationship building and influencing skills, and a passion for seeing Hamilton grow and flourish.§ §Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together.§This is your chance to be part of an organisation that is committed to building a more vibrant, attractive and prosperous city.§ §If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. Make it happen and apply online today!§ §All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. Evidence will be required.§§§§

jobTitle: Senior/Principal Planner Job in Waikato - SEEK
experience: You will have a Bachelor’s Degree in Planning or Resource management, and equivalent tertiary qualification and ideally seven or more years
jobText: TXT/50732698.txt	§Senior/Principal Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior/Principal Planner§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§Permanent, Full-time (will consider part-time applications)§ §At Hamilton City Council we are committed to attracting the best and brightest to our team.§ §Through our work we are enabling a city of growth that is home to some of the world’s most innovative businesses. We are one of them!§ §We are seeking to bring a new member into our planning team at a senior level who will add to the depth of experience and expertise of this unit.  Working as either a Principal or Senior Planner we are seeking a pragmatic, enabling and solutions focused practitioner.  As a Unit we are focused on finding people who can think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together, so cultural and team fit is essential.   If working part time is a preference of yours, we are open to consideration of this and encourage you to share those preferences with us.§ §As a Senior/Principal Planner you will be influencing and shaping development and providing a senior level contribution to the team.  You will be responsible for processing complex and challenging applications and providing guidance and mentoring to other members of the planning team.  Working collaboratively across Council and leading technical planning projects will also be a key part of the role.§ §You will have a Bachelor’s Degree in Planning or Resource management, and equivalent tertiary qualification and ideally seven or more years’ experience in planning and resource management application.§ §Beyond the bounds of work, Hamilton has a great cafe culture, flourishing arts scene, and opportunities to make the most of the short distance to ski fields and beaches. If relocating to our great City is on the cards for you, we can help with that too!§ §Our Planning Guidance Unit is committed to building on the lifestyle and economy we already have in Hamilton and maximising all opportunities that will redefine Hamilton as one of New Zealand’s leading cities. If you are ready to join a fun team, committed to being high-performance then we would love to hear from you, apply online today.§ §Remuneration is negotiable dependent upon skills and experience.§ §Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together.§ §This is your chance to be part of an organisation that is committed to building a more vibrant, attractive and prosperous city.§ §A copy of the position description can be requested by emailing §hr.request@hcc.govt.nz§ §If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. We will be screening applications as they come through so don’t hesitate, apply today!§ §All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. Short-listed candidates may be required to complete an interview process, reference checks, pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol assessments, credit check and a Ministry of Justice or Police vetting check.§ §Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies. Only people who are already eligible to live and work in New Zealand should apply. Evidence will be required.§ §Applications Close: 30 October 2020§ §Apply online at www.hamilton.govt.nz/our-council/careers§§§§

jobText: TXT/50722590.txt	§Senior Product Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Product Designer§§Advertiser: §ezyVet Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§Competitive Salary + Tech & Benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§We help vets be vets with our disruptive technology that innovates, automates, and changes the Veterinary market globally. §We've established a small yet formidable design team and we're now looking for a §Senior Product Designer§ to help propel ezyVet forward at pace whilst we scale. §Starting with identifying and validating 'problems', you'll craft user research plans, guiding the product’s information architecture, engage/speak to our customers many times through the day and work in prototype testing, interaction design, visual design, UI/UX design, and usability testing. No doubt you'll also turn to analytics to gather existing user data or to evaluate how our product performs and make design adjustments along the way. Basically your role is to turbo charge the SDLC by getting well thought out designs delivered for our engineers to build it, rapidly! §Bottom line is you balance our business goals and technical constraints with creating absolutely tip top user experiences.§§What your day will look like:§§Arrive at our soon to be brand new office, test your barista skills on the coffee machine and no doubt you'll catch some banter along the way.§Attend a stand up and discuss your current challenges, wins and goals for the day.§Learn, conduct, research and execute user experience initiatives for the ezyVet suite of applications. §Design and document user interface modules and layouts.§Create interactive user centric prototypes.§Give your tech and tools a break and grab some lunch, gym if you fancy too.  §After lunch repeat steps 3,4 & 5 - depending the priorities of the day.§Once you're done for the day take a moment to revel in the delight of the awesomeness you've crafted.§Leave the office feeling like you’re doing the best work of your life.§§What you’ll bring:§§A customer centric thought process§Prior experience in the UX/UI space§Prior experience with prototyping and user testing§High attention to detail§A graphic design background§Self-driven curiosity with a desire to just flat out design§Strong understanding of the development process§Prior experience working in an agile environment§A creative flair matched with an intensity to understand how customers use the product.§An understanding of cloud-based, SaaS software a bonus§§If you preach a design mindset and practice design thinking to deliver delightful experiences - we want you!§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many weeks' notice are you required to give your current employer?§What is your expected annual salary?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobTitle: Senior Infrastructure Support Engineer Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50753551.txt	§Senior Infrastructure Support Engineer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Infrastructure Support Engineer§§Advertiser: §New Zealand Police§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Infrastructure Support Engineer §      §        §Senior Infrastructure Support Engineer, it starts with you! §        §          §Royal New Zealand Police College§          §From $88.404,00§          §Permanent §        §        §        §About the role§        §        §As a senior Network Security Engineer, you will be responsible for helping to protect Police networks from cyber-attacks. You will help clean things up if we are experiencing issues and more importantly, help us get the right processes and rules in place to ensure that our network is safeguarded from any future attacks. You will also be responsible for the provisioning, deployment, configuration, and administration of many different pieces of network and security-related hardware. These include firewalls, routers, switches, various network-monitoring tools, and virtual private networks (VPNs).§        §        §Key aspects of the role will be to:§        §        §          §Support the Operations Manager in the network technology space.§          §Manage and identify risks to core infrastructure and implement mitigation strategies.§          §Liaise with vendor partners and stakeholders across ICT. §          §Support the Operations Manager on implementing the strategic direction of network security.§          §Support the Operations Manager on continuous improvement initiatives across Technology Operations and ICT.§          §Engage with other technology teams to provide oversight and support for technology operations.§        §        § §        §What you’ll bring§        §        §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others. §        §        §This is a dynamic and challenging position, and the successful applicant will need to be able to demonstrate the following:§        §        §          §Extensive experience in supporting/troubleshooting network border security/firewalls in a large organisation;§          §Extensive experience in Service Delivery in a large organisation;§          §Industry certification in a relevant field e.g. CCSP Cisco ASA Specialist, CCNP Security, Cisco Firewall Security Specialist or equivalent experience desirable; §          §Fortinet NSE Certification or equivalent experience desirable but not essential; &§          §Successful applicant must be able to obtain a Top Secret Government security clearance.§        §        § §        §This role is set at §Individual Contributor level§, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.§        §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor.§        § §        §For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL:  https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf.§These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. §        § §        §For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: §        §https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf§  §        §To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser:§ §        §https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/pd/10-2020/senior_infrastructure_support_engineer_-_htcg.pdf§        §        §About us§        §        §Our mission is to be the safest country by delivering services that ensure New Zealand communities are confident, safe and secure. §        §        §Working Flexibly§        § §        §Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business. §        §For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§        §How to apply§        § §        §If this position sounds like you, click apply now. You will be required to submit an application form. Before confirmation of hire, pre-employment checks will be undertaken. For further information on the application process, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§        § §        §If you have any questions about this vacancy, please contact §Jessica.Harris@police.govt.nz§Applications for this position close 5:00pm Wendesday 28th October 2020. §  §        §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Senior Infrastructure Support Engineer, it starts with you! § §Royal New Zealand Police College§ §From $88.404,00§ §Permanent § § §About the role§ § §As a senior Network Security Engineer, you will be responsible for helping to protect Police networks from cyber-attacks. You will help clean things up if we are experiencing issues and more importantly, help us get the right processes and rules in place to ensure that our network is safeguarded from any future attacks. You will also be responsible for the provisioning, deployment, configuration, and administration of many different pieces of network and security-related hardware. These include firewalls, routers, switches, various network-monitoring tools, and virtual private networks (VPNs).§ § §Key aspects of the role will be to:§ § §Support the Operations Manager in the network technology space.§ §Manage and identify risks to core infrastructure and implement mitigation strategies.§ §Liaise with vendor partners and stakeholders across ICT. § §Support the Operations Manager on implementing the strategic direction of network security.§ §Support the Operations Manager on continuous improvement initiatives across Technology Operations and ICT.§ §Engage with other technology teams to provide oversight and support for technology operations.§ § § §What you’ll bring§ § §Being part of the Police whānau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. Whilst we are looking for skills, knowledge and experience relevant to the role, we also place high importance on your state of mind, the alignment of your values with ours, your ability to contribute to and build high performing teams, and the way that you lead yourself or others. § § §This is a dynamic and challenging position, and the successful applicant will need to be able to demonstrate the following:§ § §Extensive experience in supporting/troubleshooting network border security/firewalls in a large organisation;§ §Extensive experience in Service Delivery in a large organisation;§ §Industry certification in a relevant field e.g. CCSP Cisco ASA Specialist, CCNP Security, Cisco Firewall Security Specialist or equivalent experience desirable; § §Fortinet NSE Certification or equivalent experience desirable but not essential; &§ §Successful applicant must be able to obtain a Top Secret Government security clearance.§ § § §This role is set at §Individual Contributor level§, this means your key purpose is “to deliver or enable others to deliver Our Business”.§ §We will ask you questions based on “How we will deliver Our Business – Core Competencies” and the appropriate role level, i.e. Individual Contributor.§ § § §For more information on Our Core Competencies, please copy and paste this URL:  https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/core-competencies-how-we-will-deliver-our-business.pdf.§These questions will be unique and specific to the role, focusing on the aspects the hiring manager believes are most important for that position at the time. § § § §For more information on Our Values, please copy and paste this URL: § §https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/publications/nzp-our-values.pdf§  § §To view the position description for this role please copy and paste this link into a new browser:§ § §https://www.police.govt.nz/sites/default/files/pd/10-2020/senior_infrastructure_support_engineer_-_htcg.pdf§ § §About us§ § §Our mission is to be the safest country by delivering services that ensure New Zealand communities are confident, safe and secure. § § §Working Flexibly§ § § §Your wellbeing inside and outside of work is important to us. We’re open to discussing flexible working options that work for both you and the business. § §For more information on the above, please copy and paste this URL: https://www.police.govt.nz/careers§ §How to apply§ § § §If this position sounds like you, click apply now. Founded in Christchurch in 1973, we’ve made it our business to show people that life is better when you’re outside. Today, we are happy when we’re helping people push their boundaries. We’re a socially conscious business, and we operate in a way that is both ethical and sustainable. As a leader in the outdoor retail space, we have a responsibility to protect and preserve our wild places, and we take that responsibility very seriously. When all is said and done, we are adventurers - and our goal is to facilitate adventure for as many people as we possibly can. You can read more about our history, design philosophy, ethics and environmental policies on our website.§        §Who are we looking for?§        §We are seeking a passionate, skilled and approachable professional to join our team. You’ll have an eye for quality (and detail), and help develop the standards of the brand’s presentation and integrity. Experience in digital design is vital to this role, and HTML5 experience would be a bonus, to support to our Ecommerce and Digital Marketing team.§        §Skills you will need:§        §          §Good understanding of the design process and principals, plus the ability to lead and manage projects from beginning to end§          §Strong conceptualiser – the ability to present concepts professionally to a high standard§          §Proficiency in Adobe CC Suite including Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator in a PC environment.§          §Digital design experience, HTML5 a bonus§          §Comfortable working with print/media suppliers across different formats§        §        §Why should you want to work with us?§        §          §Macpac is a rapidly growing retail business, offering great opportunities for professional and personal development.§          §We promote from within the business, and our network reaches across New Zealand and Australia.§          §Our team is full of adventurers - you’ll never be without an adventure buddy again!§          §Our culture is all about getting outside, embracing the adventure community and taking responsibility for the way our actions impact the world around us.§          §Our team discount on equipment and apparel is ridiculously good.§        §        §This is a §part time §position based at our Support Office in Hillsborough, Christchurch. Hours will be between 16 and 20 hours per week dependent on the successful candidate.§        §To apply, please submit a cover letter explaining why you’re the right person for this role & why 16-20 hours per week works for you, as well as a CV (including a link to your portfolio) via Seek. Please note again that we are looking for someone with a minimum of 2 years graphic design experience for this role, and that this will be a part time position.§        §Applications close 27th October 2020§      §      §      §    §    § macpac.co.nz §|§ macpac.com.au §  §§§Who are we?§ §Macpac is New Zealand’s original outdoor brand. As a leader in the outdoor retail space, we have a responsibility to protect and preserve our wild places, and we take that responsibility very seriously. When all is said and done, we are adventurers - and our goal is to facilitate adventure for as many people as we possibly can. You can read more about our history, design philosophy, ethics and environmental policies on our website.§ §Who are we looking for?§ §We are seeking a passionate, skilled and approachable professional to join our team. Macpac team members are:§ § §Adventure lovers§, who are happiest when embracing the great outdoors.§ §Eco-warriors§, who walk the talk when it comes to sustainability.§ §Experts§, who love sharing their knowledge.§ §Team players§, who understand that a good team is greater than the sum of its parts.§ §That’s where you step in. § §We’re looking for a dynamic, innovative and self-motivated graphic designer with a minimum of 2 years’ experience to join our in-house creative team. You will have multiple projects running at any one time, and work at the pace of a retail organisation. Being at the centre of an exciting marketing department with a range of projects to get your teeth into, you’ll need to be organised, efficient and be someone who consistently strives to achieve.§ §Reporting to the Senior Marketing Manager, you’ll take ownership for the design of a wide range of marketing collateral – from EDMs & web banners/ads, retail POS, print media, to packaging and product graphics.  Our Designers are significant contributors to the marketing department, managing design projects and having the scope to pitch their own ideas and initiatives.§ §Your passion for stretching creative boundaries will be key in this role. You’ll have an eye for quality (and detail), and help develop the standards of the brand’s presentation and integrity. Experience in digital design is vital to this role, and HTML5 experience would be a bonus, to support to our Ecommerce and Digital Marketing team.§ §Skills you will need:§ § §Good understanding of the design process and principals, plus the ability to lead and manage projects from beginning to end§ §Strong conceptualiser – the ability to present concepts professionally to a high standard§ §Proficiency in Adobe CC Suite including Photoshop, InDesign and Illustrator in a PC environment.§ §Digital design experience, HTML5 a bonus§ §Comfortable working with print/media suppliers across different formats§ §Why should you want to work with us?§ § §Macpac is a rapidly growing retail business, offering great opportunities for professional and personal development.§ §We promote from within the business, and our network reaches across New Zealand and Australia.§ §Our team is full of adventurers - you’ll never be without an adventure buddy again!§ §Our culture is all about getting outside, embracing the adventure community and taking responsibility for the way our actions impact the world around us.§ §Our team discount on equipment and apparel is ridiculously good.§ §This is a §part time §position based at our Support Office in Hillsborough, Christchurch. Hours will be between 16 and 20 hours per week dependent on the successful candidate.§ §To apply, please submit a cover letter explaining why you’re the right person for this role & why 16-20 hours per week works for you, as well as a CV (including a link to your portfolio) via Seek. Please note again that we are looking for someone with a minimum of 2 years graphic design experience for this role, and that this will be a part time position.§ §Applications close 27th October 2020§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a graphic designer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50737713.txt	§Urban Design Advisor§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Urban Design Advisor§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§Are you an experienced urban designer?§Passionate about cities and how people use them?§Can you help us meet the aspirational expectations and ambitious goals that Wellingtonians are setting for the future growth and development of our city?§We are looking for an Urban Designer to join our Design Review Team within the Council.§Wellington is growing significantly. By 2050 our city will have grown by at least 50,000 inhabitants, with a projected total population of up to 280,000. To accommodate all of these new Wellingtonians we need to develop our city. In early 2019 we asked Wellingtonians how we should accommodate this growth. The results of this Our City Tomorrow engagement set a clear direction for increasing density in our central area and suburbs, but not at the detriment to environmental or social well-being. Wellington's development and growth should be compact, inclusive, connected, greener, resilient, vibrant and prosperous.§The Urban Design Advisor will contribute to the Design Review workstream (the gateway to all public and private developments), champion a 'design led' approach, and undertake timely urban design assessment, technical review and evaluation of development proposals. Additionally, this role involves a unique opportunity to contribute to establishing a Design Review Programme and associated Design Review Panels. The role's contributions to various aspects of the Design Review Team interrelate to help ensure that Wellington's future growth meets the ambitious goals of Our City Tomorrow, and that all new development (whether public or private) is held to best-practice urban design standards.§Although detailed knowledge of the Resource Management Act (RMA) is not necessary, the successful applicant should understand how the District Plan assists Council in achieving the best practice urban design outcomes and sustainable management goals. Our ideal person will have a relevant degree in urban design related field such as landscape architecture, architecture, planning or related. 5+ years of experience in architectural practices or other relevant construction industries would be an advantage.§This is a collaborative role which involves close working relationships with a diverse group of stakeholders especially in a complex political environment, with your strong influencing skills, you will be able to get alongside the stakeholders, understand their imperatives, and look for the win-win. You will be calm headed and resilient with the ability to listen, empathise and form awesome relationships in a high-pressure environment.§More importantly you will be an awesome team player who gets excited about the public life of cities and committed to making a difference by creating Wellington as an Urban Village with a Wild Edge. Council values and celebrates the uniquely compact and vibrant qualities of Wellington and is committed to best practice built and natural environment outcomes. Naturally we think our council is the best - we offer range of benefits that includes flexible working model, 5 weeks annual leave after 2 years of continuous service for permanent staff etc.§If this opportunity excites you, then we would welcome your application! Please click the apply button to make an application and/or to view the position description. All applications must be submitted online.§If you have any questions, please feel free to get in touch with Farzad Zamani at at §Farzad.Zamani@wcc.govt.nz§.§Applications for this role will close §28 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50721791.txt	§Senior Architectural Technician - Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Architectural Technician - Auckland§§Advertiser: §Maynard Marks§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§Maynard Marks§  §Who are we?§  §Maynard Marks is a New Zealand owned and operated award-winning, specialist Building Consultancy that is recognised as a leader in its fields of work.  As a technical professional services consultancy, we have been assisting our clients for over twelve years and have offices in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch.  Our team of experts includes Architects, Building Surveyors, Quantity Surveyors, Asbestos Assessors, Project Managers and Structural Engineers.  Our industry leading experts provide technical advice on building and property matters to every sector of business across New Zealand.  §  §Due to our consultancy’s continued growth we now have an exciting opportunity in our NZIA practice for an experienced Senior Architectural Technician to join our dynamic design and detail-focused architectural team.§  §Your new opportunity§  §We are seeking an ambitious, talented, and experienced senior technician. You will be responsible for producing highly resolved detailed design documentation including the resolution of complex construction details, liaising with contractors, consultants and suppliers, and ensuring our high standards and efficient production of architectural documentation is maintained.  The role will involve working with a lead designer and mentoring junior members of the team.  You will be involved in all stages of a project including on-site attendance.§  §The successful candidate will possess:§ § §10+ years relevant experience in the New Zealand market.§ §A proven track record on multiple projects.§ §Comprehensive technical knowledge of NZ construction, relevant legislation, and codes of practice.§ §Project experience of multi-unit residential buildings above 10m in height.§ §An in depth understanding of quality assurance processes, risk analysis and mitigation strategies.§ §Expert level knowledge of ArchiCAD.§ §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a clear focus on client needs, working with integrity and delivering quality on every project.§ §What can we offer you?§  §A competitive remuneration package, a clear career progression path, numerous training and professional development opportunities, plus the chance to work for an award-winning consultancy with an excellent market reputation. The successful candidate would be joining a diverse and supportive working environment with an active social event calendar and multiple opportunities to engage in company wide activities.§  §If you would like to apply for this exciting role, please submit your CV, portfolio and selected technical drawings (no greater than 5MB) to: §HR@maynardmarks.co.nz§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an architectural technician?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§How many years' experience do you have in the construction industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50721840.txt	§Experience Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Experience Designer§§Advertiser: §Fidelity Life§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§Fidelity Life is the largest Kiwi-owned and operated life insurer and the 2017, 2018 and 2019 ANZIIF New Zealand Life Insurance Company of the Year. These are exciting times for Fidelity Life as we transform our business for a successful and sustainable future, with our customers at the centre of everything we do.§ § §Are you passionate about using design thinking to drive value in business and customer outcomes? Join us on a 1 year fixed term.§ABOUT THE ROLE§  §If you're the kind of person that looks at something from every angle, from every point of view, asks questions, challenges, always sticks up for the user - then we need to talk. As an Experience Designer, you'll be an experienced workshop and design sprint facilitator, mapper of journeys, facilitator of user testing and customer interviews, and a fastidious documenter, to name a few. §  §You'll be responsible for design activities within Fidelity Life’s transformation programme and contribute in the delivery of working with our people to inspire and equip them to adopt a human-centred design approach across experiences we deliver.§ § §ABOUT YOU§Bring your proven expertise of solid human-centred design methodologies along with your drive to deliver compelling experiences. You’re passionate about what you do, excellent at stakeholder relationships and have previous experience bringing other people on the journey and delivering results right to the end. You'll also have a keen thirst to be create and innovate using new techniques and will be comfortable bringing ideas to light in both agile and traditional environments. With your demonstrated expertise in qualitative and quantitative research and capability, you will excel in our exciting new role.§ABOUT OUR TEAM §Enjoy a competitive salary, and life, trauma and health insurance benefits. You will also get 22 days of annual leave, birthday leave and a volunteer day too. We have a collaborative, motivating and above the line culture at Fidelity Life and offer a range of flexible working options and well-being benefits to suit your lifestyle.§If this sounds like your next role, click APPLY and include a link to your portfolio. Applications close on 26 October 2020. Please note that applications will be reviewed as they come in. §This is a 1 year fixed term role. §Fidelity Life does not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies and/or search firms. This role is only open to candidates who are eligible to work in New Zealand only. § §§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50728864.txt	§Architecture Project Lead - Consultancy §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Architecture Project Lead - Consultancy §§Advertiser: §Cobalt Consulting NZ Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§A leading consultancy are looking for a Project Architect to be based in central Auckland. This firm has a positive reputation in their line of work and a progressive approach to construction with repeat clients providing stable and guaranteed work. §The business has a wide range of services and value add for their clients including new build, alterations and upgrades, architectural design, internal fit outs, due diligence and feasibility studies. The role is within a dynamic and personable team, focused and motivated towards the same company goal, of delivering high quality services and communication, whilst growing the business and team to become the best in the industry. There will career development available, with the platform to prove yourself and have a clear career pathway to higher honours. §The role is primarily responsible for the provision of accurate, timely and comprehensive Architectural services to a range of clients from commercial to residential property owners and occupiers. You will be working on a range of staged projects across NZ, while mentoring more junior team and developing the service line further. Business Development would be an objective, should you have the connections and network to generate opportunities.§Role responsibilities will include: §Design management including architectural observations and on-site architectural services§Identify the elements of project design and construction likely to give rise to disputes and claims and manage risk appropriately§Project set up and programming§Communicate effectively with all stakeholders, other consultants and affected parties throughout the length of any project§Compliance and health and safety management§Provide regular reports indicating progress against targets§Support colleagues and team to deliver on individual and business objectives §The ideal candidate will have a passion for construction design and:§Tertiary qualification in related field - BAS, NZCAD, BBSc, Master of Architecture§7+ years relevant architectural experience in the construction industry§Highly proficient in the use of design softwares, ideally in ArchiCAD or Revit §A deep working knowledge of architectural principles and technical knowledge of key standards/NZBC§Strong interpersonal, communication, facilitation and presentation skills§Excellent analytic and problem-solving skills. Good computer skills, proficient with MS office§Great opportunity to continue building your career and join a proactive company, taking the current industry challenges and turning them into business and resource opportunities. §Applicants must be eligible to work in New Zealand. Role available asap. Please apply now or contact Rachel McNickle on 027 274 6821 to discuss further. §§§§

jobText: TXT/50737593.txt	§Senior Digital Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Digital Designer§§Advertiser: §Capital Preferences§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§About us§ §Capital Preferences is an innovative financial technology and research company that believes consumer actions speak louder than words.  Our ground-breaking software is helping global financial services firms to gamify and personalise the investment experience, while generating a deeper understanding of how consumers make decisions with their money.  We do this all while also meeting emerging regulatory standards and guidelines.§ §Everything we do is data-driven.  Our team of world-leading decision scientists are continuously generating new academic insights.  Our Product Designers have the unique opportunity to collaborate with the academic team to transform their insights into world-leading digital experiences.  § §We profile customers using proprietary gamified tools that reveal each investor’s unique behaviour.  Our approach is underpinned by the latest behavioural economics, game theory, and econometrics research, leading to more predictive and compliant measures than psychology-based questionnaires.  Our methods were invented by our co-founder Shachar Kariv Ph.D., former Chair of the Economics Department at UC Berkeley, and a team of leading researchers and product innovators.§ §We are globally acclaimed.  Our research has been published in top journals such as Science and the American Economic Review, and our product has won awards at the UBS Future of Finance Competition in Zurich, IMAS Bloomberg Reimaging Tomorrow Conference in Singapore, and many more.§ §We operate out of Berkeley (California), Christchurch, and Auckland.§ § § §What you can expect...§ §As a Senior Digital Product Designer,  you’ll hit the ground running with your full-stack design skills to create innovative and disruptive technology products.  You’ll be joining a fast-growing company and a passionate product team that’s working on a large variety of software products, including in emerging sectors such as Impact Investing (sometimes referred to as social investing, with a focus on the environment and social causes).§ §The right candidate will be invited to join a long-standing team in a permanent role, with potential growth and leadership opportunities.  Initially, you would be based remotely in New Zealand, working from home.§ § § §What you’ll be good at…§ §Ideally, we would love to hear from applicants who have experience in the FinTech or e-learning sectors, a deep understanding of the Design Thinking process, and experience working in Agile teams. § §You’ll be an expert at taking complex, real-world problems and generating imaginative designs to help resolve these problems.  Here’s what else you’ll bring to the table…§ § § §Proficiency in the development of wireframes, low-to-hi-fidelity prototypes, detailed design outputs, and the provision of design support to development teams;§ § § §A strong command of Sketch, Figma, and InVision tools for prototyping, testing, and knowledge of how to share and transfer design artifacts to development teams§ § § §Experience extracting findings and insights from usability testing sessions and integrating findings into the design of the products;§ § § §An ability to establish, build on, and maintain a design system that ensures quality and consistency across everything we design and build;§ § § §A fluid approach.  We’re lean, agile, and growing, so 20% of your role is unknowable.  You’ll need to be ok with that ambiguity, but at the same time, you’ll have a chance to shape where we put our energy.§ § §While not essential to the role, we are also interested in applicants with these skills...§ § § §Experience recruiting participants for exploratory in-depth interviews, conducting interviews, and accurately capturing findings and insights.§ § § § § Other requirements to consider... § § §You are likely to have 5+ years designing digital experiences, products, services, and/or solutions that demonstrate a high level of empathy for the end-user§ § § §Curious, questioning, and eager to be involved§ § § §Exceptionally organised, efficient and good at self-management§ § § §Experience delivering software that meets WCAG§ § § §Excellent communication, collaboration, facilitation, and an entrepreneurial streak. § § § §Ability to work in multidisciplinary teams § § § §Evidence of being a self-starter with an aptitude for identifying problems and creating solutions§ § § § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a digital designer?§§§
