jobText: TXT/50753951.txt	§Senior Architectural Designer (LBP, Reg. Architect)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Architectural Designer (LBP, Reg. Architect)§§Advertiser: §Vikon§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§VIKON Design is currently seeking a senior architectural designer or a registered architect to join its team.§  §VIKON Construction and Design§ is a diverse provider in the construction industry. Our teams of project managers, QS, architectural designers, interior designers and interior joinery makers collaborate to deliver high quality design and building projects. We focus on medium scale residential developments, high end residential houses, commercial interior design and commercial alterations. Our clients include home owners, investors, property developers, business owners and government agencies.§  §Responsibilities includes:§ § §Site visits and customer consultations with sales team.§ §Deliver customer briefing sessions and produce concept designs.§ §Develop creative design ideas and collaborate with construction management teams to meet buildability and cost budgeting requirements.§ §Supervise junior designers, peer review design by others and uphold company design standards.§ §Identify training needs and strategically improve practice processes.§ §Your skills and abilities:§ § §Proficient in computer drafting software;§ §Experience in Autodesk Revit is a plus but not essential;§ §Excellent organisational skills and ability to work to deadlines;§ §Excellent communication and great problem solving skills;§ §Creative, precise and efficient.§ §Systematic knowledge of NZ building codes, standards, and construction methods;§ §A valid New Zealand working permit (WorkVisa/PR/Citizen);§ §Holding valid and clear New Zealand driving license.§ §We offer:§ § §A career growth pathway to keep you on your journey towards your ultimate goal as being one of the best in the construction industry.§ §Opportunity to be a key part of our growth, leading and managing teams to deliver and be recognised for outstanding design and contributions.§ §Continuous professional development opportunities.§ §Positive and supportive working culture.§ §Strong focus on creativity and quality.§ §Remuneration in line with your commensurate skills and experience.§ §Location:§  §Albany / Botany§§§§

jobTitle: Planning Team Lead Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50736857.txt	§Planning Team Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Planning Team Lead§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§Location:§ Hamilton Central§ §Employment Type:§  Permanent§ §Applications Close: §8 November 2020§ §The Planning Guidance Unit is focused on shaping and enabling the development of our great city through the efficient delivery of our regulatory functions under the Resource Management Act and Local Government Act.§In this newly created leadership role, we are seeking a dynamic individual with the ability to navigate and negotiate solutions to complex problems whilst leading a team of experienced and developing planners.§Working alongside two fellow Planning Lead’s and reporting to the Planning Guidance Unit Manager, you will be joining a highly collaborative and supportive leadership team. For your team you will be responsible for providing the people and technical leadership to enable delivery of the Council’s resource consenting and other statutory functions.  Implicit in this role is the ability to develop and maintain internal and external relationships including elected members, Iwi and customer/stakeholders.§Our ideal candidate will have a relevant tertiary qualification, and experience leading successful and engaged teams. You’ll be a strong communicator with adept relationship building and influencing skills, and a passion for seeing Hamilton grow and flourish.§ §Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together.§This is your chance to be part of an organisation that is committed to building a more vibrant, attractive and prosperous city.§ §If this role sounds like it’s for you, we would love to hear from you. Make it happen and apply online today!§ §All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. Short-listed candidates may be required to complete an interview process, reference checks, pre-employment medical, drug and alcohol assessments, credit check and a Ministry of Justice or Police vetting check.§Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies.Only people who are eligible to work in New Zealand should apply. Evidence will be required.§§§§

Manage & Grow§ - Manage and grow the draughting and consent team for TRHCo.§ § §Meet and exceed financial targets for the Design team of TRHCo§ §Manage current and future work levels to ensure that the pipeline has sufficient works meet or exceed the signed off budget§ §Drive additional revenue through outsourcing the team’s capabilities§ §Manage the required expansion of the team by training and employing current and future staff to meet pre agreed financial targets§ §Manage Design Team staff to ensure customer service levels are always achieved§ §Ensure that the design team are meeting weekly billing hours§ §Build and maintain relationships with the Building and Planning Officers at the varying Councils and Geotech Engineers as well as other service industry providers.§ § § §2). Accuracy - Ensure accuracy of all Design work. § § §Deliver and maintain a high level of accuracy for all measures of site plans, floor plans, elevations and foundation plans.§ §Check and approve / sign off  all draughting work completed for TRHCo. ensuring all plans and consents are completed accurately on time and to budget.§ § § §3). Financial§ - Management, quoting, preparation and lodgment of building and resource consents applications on behalf of TRHCo.§ § §Meet or exceed the monthly revenue and profit budget for the design team§ §Ensure that client invoices are accurate and timely in submission and hasten any unpaid invoices§ §Communicate all variations to Offers of Service’s§ §Liaise when necessary with the Operations Manager / Finance Manager regarding current accounts, client invoices, and team draughting timesheets and performance sheets.§ §Liaise with Councils, Clients, House Movers and TRHCo. Sales Consultants to ensure the process is undertaken from start to finish in an expedient manner§ §Monitor the Consent Application process to ensure progression to the client’s satisfaction.§ § § §4). Reporting§ § §Enter all relevant data into the company’s relevant software§ §Submit Design Team weekly report and Board report§ §Set and monitor Team KPIs§ § § §5). Skills & Competencies§ § §Confident communicator both written and verbal§ §Strong networking capability§ §Skilled in meeting clients, influencing their decisions, and closing the sale§ §Good negotiator§ §Highly motivated§ §Able to prioritise and adapt well to change management§ §Ability to work under pressure§ §Ability to plan and anticipate deadlines§ §Able to follow a process§ §Superior problem-solving abilities§ §Has good attention to detail and is consistently organised§ §High level of proven customer service and relationship building skills§ § § §What’s in it for you?:§ § §A dynamic, supportive business environment where the expected standard is excellence.§ §Opportunities for personal growth.§ §An enticing Remuneration Package.§ §To apply see the application instructions below:§ §Email your CV with a Covering Letter via the Apply Online option, please. Please include in your Covering Letter your answers to the following questions: 1) What would your friends, family and co-workers say are your three strongest attributes? 2) What is your biggest success? 3) What would you bring to this role? We'll be in touch if you have made it to the short-list. If you do not hear from us, we wish you all the best in your job search.§Applicants for this position should have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a team manager?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§§§

As a Senior Architectural Designer will hold a passion for good architecture and highly efficient successful outcomes.  You will be a motivated self-starter, hold the ability to lead and motivate a team, with excellent communication and organisation skills.  Demonstrable experience in ArchiCAD is the ideal.§  § This unique, challenging and exciting role offers the opportunity to stamp your architectural mark and grow a team, within a high growth phase of this business.  In order to be successful, you will have worked / or be currently working in a similar role, where you lead and deliver across multi-unit residential projects. You will be an inclusive and engaging designer with an enthusiastic ‘can do’ attitude within a dynamic and proactive team.§  § You will receive a highly competitive salary with an exciting opportunity to join this forward thinking, highly driven, sociable team, who have created a fun, creative thinking and professionally dynamic working environment.  This is a prospect not to be missed…§  § All enquiries and applications to Archway Recruitment are treated in the strictest confidence.  To find out more about this opportunity please contact Claire Smith at Archway Recruitment: 021 765 535 or email §claire@archwayrecruitment.com§§§§

jobTitle: Draughting Coordinator Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50719891.txt	§Draughting Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Draughting Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Stonewood Group Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architectural Drafting§§§§§§About us§  §Stonewood Group is a large, well-established, NZ owned property group with over 25 years proven experience and stability in the market.  We love growth and achieve the group goals through our supportive and committed team.§  §Our current focus is in house and commercial construction projects across the country. The Group operates a number of stand-alone subsidiaries such as Stonewood Homes, Pullman Rotorua Hotel, Urban Hub, RCR Infrastructure, and Park Avenue Residences, to name a few.§  §We are proud to have talented and dedicated teams across New Zealand that we recognise as the foundation of our success. We embrace opportunity, together.§  §Stonewood Homes Franchisor Limited is looking for a Draughting Coordinator who will be providing draughting service to the franchise network. This role thrives to achieve the highest level of customer satisfaction and production efficiency through the fast, accurate, and reliable preparation of construction drawings.§  §If you are looking for a challenging and rewarding role that is fast paced & diverse; and if you would like to work with the best, then please step forward.§  § §  §About the role§ § §Coordinate with contracted draughting team and architecture partner§ §Maintaining quality standards and ensuring compliance with relevant legislation§ §Draft concept plans to support sales. § §Assist sales team to establish client requirements for design and products. § §Identify Permit and Consent issues and solutions. § §Concept plans are prepared to completion on time and accurately.§ §Draft permit drawings to support construction. § §Convert tendered plans to Stonewood Homes construction standards. § §Product selection ensures a buildable and cost effective construction that meets the client’s expectations for quality, appearance and value. § §Provide rapid turnaround of modifications and variations to permit drawings. § § §  §About you§ § §Minimum of 3 years solid experience in construction draughting§ §Experience in residential and commercial construction projects§ §Proficient in Chief Architecture and conventional drafting station to update and amend architectural drawings§ §Understand of the New Zealand building code§ §Good understanding of New Zealand Building Code NZS3604 is preferred§ §Self-motivated§ §Strong interpersonal, written, and oral communication skills§ §Multi-tasking and meeting/exceeding deadlines§ §Strong organisational skills§ § §  §Benefits§  §In Stonewood Homes, we offer an active office environment, and excellent remuneration. The ability for personal growth and shaping the way systems are delivered means every individual can bring their own expertise to the team.§  § §  §If you are interested in the role, please copy and paste the below link to your browser and APPLY now!§  §https://stonewoodgroup.bamboohr.com/jobs/view.php?id=341§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50766046.txt	§Intermediate Architectural Draftsperson§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Architectural Draftsperson§§Advertiser: §Widespan South Island 2015 Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architectural Drafting§§§§§§About Us:§  §In January 2020 Wide Span South Island started a Head Office with four people to provide support to its South Island based branches. We have continued to grow exponentially ever since, with all new roles being created by an increase in workload. §  §The South Island Head Office supports 9 branches (and growing), with over 70 employees from Nelson to Bluff. Within our team of 12 we provide quantity surveying, drafting, marketing, consenting and technical support.§  §Much of the sales are of pre-engineered small structures which need only minor drafting input, with the remaining sales made up of large, custom designed and built, steel framed factories, warehouses and offices. With such a wide range of work, from sheds to shed homes, aircraft hangars to load out facilities, no two days will be the same.§  §About you:§  §You will need to be at an intermediate to senior level in your career, with the ability to work independently as well as review drawings by outside contractors and junior draftspeople. All work is peer reviewed and the team provide a supportive learning environment. You need to be able to work well under pressure, with the ability to be creative yet practical and able to problem solve and think on your feet.§  §Ideally you will have:§ § §At least three to five years' PQE, preferably with cold formed steel or structural steel experience;§ §At minimum hold a Diploma in Architectural Technology;§ §At least one year's experience using ArchiCAD;§ §Excellent knowledge of the NZ Building Code, Building Act, Resource Management Act and generic planning regulations;§ §Excellent knowledge of NZS3604;§ §Hold a Design 1 LBP Class;§ §The ability to bring design and architectural flair to conceptual sketches and take client briefs; and§ §The ability to take a concept and product full working drawings and supporting documentation.§ §Candidates with structural drafting experience will be given preference.§  §About the Role:§  §New projects will land on your desk every few days and will range in complexity and use. You will see everything from a pre-engineered shed that just requires a detail added through to a 4000m2 warehouse with web trusses that requires full working drawings and everything in between. §  §Tasks include:§ § §Engage with clients, engineers, councils, builders and salespeople to ensure deadlines and client's expectations align;§ §Deliver high quality plans from concept to construction that are compliant with NZ3604, the Building Code and District Plans;§ §Continuous improvement of processes and CAD libraries;§ §Apply for building consents and answer all RFI's in a timely manner; and§ §Work with quantity surveyors at concept stage to ensure conceptual plans are buildable and compliant.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a draftsperson?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§How many years' experience do you have in the construction industry?§Which of the following Microsoft Office products are you experienced with?§§§

jobText: TXT/50770522.txt	§Building Processor - Building Consent§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Building Processor - Building Consent§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§19 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Building Processor - Building Consent §      §        §          §Career development opportunity that makes a difference§          §Extensive experience in both the building control and building industry environment§          §Several roles available §        §        § §        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§        § §        §Auckland Council's Building Consents provide local and regional building consenting services to ensure Auckland has safe and sustainable buildings. As a result of continued growth in the Auckland region, we are looking for talented and dedicated people right across the Auckland region to join our §Processing §team. You will play a key role in ensuring we have safe and sustainable buildings both now and in the future and make it possible for Aucklanders to do so in a friendly and easy way.§        §We have a number of vacancies in various locations around Auckland in the Project Assessment team who are responsible for all building consent processing regionally.§You will provide our customers with timely and accurate building and development related information as well as advice and consents. You will be responsible for ensuring building consent applications submitted meet Compliance with the requirements of the New Zealand Building Code before the consents are issued. Case management of customer's applications and assisting in increasing customer understanding of regulatory controls is a key attribute of this role that we are looking to you to fill along with the advising process through guiding and providing advice to customers through the appropriate application process.§        § §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        § §        §•    Proven experience working in the building industry or architectural firms or similar related organisations, where you need to meet targets within tight time frames§•    Knowledge of Building Codes and previous experience in building consent processing§•    Possess a recognised Building Construction, Engineering or Architectural design qualification§•    Demonstrated capability in the understanding of building industry and processes and has the ability to problem-solve and suggest business improvements§•    Good understanding of the New Zealand Building Code and the Building Act 2004 and Building Regulations.§•    Strong verbal and written communication skills and the ability to work with a variety of customers§•    Skilled in MS office applications § §        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§        §We will provide you with dedicated training and development so that you are equipped to make an actual difference in our community. This role will provide Naval Architecture and Marine Engineering design solutions and project management across a number of market sectors including superyachts, fishing vessels, ferries, workboats, tugs and barges.  You will also provide in-service design support to the Royal New Zealand Navy and other NZ Defence Force projects, as part of our parent Babcock(NZ) contract commitments in supporting the RNZN.§        §        §About the Role:§        §We are looking for someone who has a strong background in the marine industry, with 5+ year’s experience of practising Naval Architecture. You will have experience working in a multidisciplinary design office where you use your skills to produce and provide oversight to analysis, calculations, reports, modelling and drawings.  You will be familiar with working in a project based environment and you will be experienced in managing the delivery of projects on time, in budget and to specification.  §        §Tasks Include:§        §          §Delivering and managing naval architecture outputs with emphasis on compliance§          §Exercise design approval authority for Naval Architecture outputs, including structural and mechanical designs §          §Ensuring the delivery of design calculations and design studies§          §Management of engineering projects ensuring all risks to the company and clients are mitigated§          §Leading, mentoring and supporting a team of Naval Architects§          §Provide Naval Arch support to engineering personnel within the Babcock NZ Group §        §        §        §About you:§        §          §Have a Degree or equivalent in Naval Architecture (or associated discipline).  §          §Have a minimum 5 years relevant experience in the marine sector§          §Hold a current membership with an associated engineering body/council§          §Be a proficient user of standard software applications, bespoke Naval Architect software (NAPA or Maxsurf experience is desirable) and CAD 3D modelling, analysis and drafting (Rhino, Inventor, Autocad, Ansys)§          §Chartered Engineer Status  §          §Knowledge and experience of NZ Defence Support and operational systems is desirable§          §Be able to demonstrate a track record on delivering naval architecture outputs§        §        §        §What’s in it for you? §        §In this position you will be managing and delivering projects and output to clients, liaising face to face with clients and working with your peers in the MID team.   Projects may involve site visits to vessels and clients in the local Auckland region and occasionally further away in NZ or abroad.   There will be opportunities to progress in the team and gain seniority as your skills develop.§        §This is a hugely rewarding role as you will have the support, resources and encouragement to bring your ideas to work. jobText: TXT/50779491.txt	§Designer / Account Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Designer / Account Manager§§Advertiser: §NetYourJob§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§20 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Industrial Design§§§§§§Albany, Full Time, Architecture§Please Quote Reference Number 77629§§Bachelors Degree in spatial, product or industrial design?§Work in a high paced environment & complete tasks to set deadline§Three Sixty Limited - manufacturing & design§Three Sixty Limited are a creative design and manufacturing company based in Albany.  We specialise in high speed, high quality manufacturing and design work throughout Australasia.  The company was founded 20 years ago and is fully NZ owned and operated employing 56 staff.§We design anything! Including many promotional designs for agencies and clients directly as well as interior fit outs for stores and offices. Retail fit outs and bespoke designs are a speciality.§At Three Sixty we do things a little bit differently, instead of our clients having day to day interactions with a separate Account Manager who then passes all information on to a Designer, our Designers are also our Account Managers.§This means, that all conversations we have with our clients are not only with someone who understands the brief, but it is someone who can also have on the spot discussions on how a job may be realistically designed and built.§We understand this is a unique role for anyone's experience.  A high level of self-organisation and time prioritisation are a must. You will have good attention to detail with the capacity to process a high volume of information at a fast pace.  The role is constantly interacting with clients and colleagues so you will be comfortable dealing face to face with customers as well as managing the account and design projects.  Strong written and verbal communication is vital to this role.§Our Designer/Account Manager role will see the project through from drawing to installation and communicate with the client throughout to ensure a satisfactory outcome for both the company and the client.§In this role you will§:§Build and preserve trusting relationships with clients.§Manage and develop major accounts and relationships.§Prepare and lead client presentations.§Provide exceptional customer service to our clients.§Drive project execution internally with all key stakeholders to ensure projects are delivered to their budget and deadline.§Be able to travel overseas and throughout NZ to conduct client meetings.§Ability to work overtime when and where it is required, including occasional Saturdays.§Our successful applicant will have§:§A Design Degree in spatial, product or industrial.§Sketching, modelling and drafting of concepts.§Excellent time management with the flexibility and ability to multi task.§Computer literacy and the ability to use Adobe suite and CAD programmes (Primarily in the use of Sketchup).§The ability to work both autonomously and as part of a team.§The ability to problem solve and offer solutions.§A full and current NZ drivers' licence.§You must be an NZ resident or legally allowed to work in NZ.§This is a full time position with an immediate start.  If this role sounds perfect for you, please apply through our online application form below your CV, Portfolio (if you have one) with a cover letter explaining why you would be a great fit for this role and our company.§§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How would you rate your English language skills?§What drivers licence do you hold?§What Qualification do you hold?§How would you rate your skills and ability using Sketchup on a scale of 1-10?§What is your salary expectation for this role?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

Our client commenced as a boutique design practice and now is a collaboratively led 48 person team which is split between their design studio producing bespoke high-end architecture, interiors, development consultancy and digital visualisation, and their documentation studio which specialises in systemised documentation for housing projects from single houses to apartments.§ §Their practice uniquely combines a passion for the detail of the interior environment as well as large scale exterior and masterplanning projects with specialist ability in optimised software, systemised design and construction. § §A focus on the small scale and attention to detail is borne out in residential and small scale commercial projects that showcase a passion for material and interior space. § §Regardless of scale they thrive on providing solutions to clients needs and working together with clients to provide an individually tailored considered design response.§ §What will they offer:§ §A competitive remuneration package based on experience§ §Great lifestyle living§ §Career progression§ §An easy going and dynamic team with a great culture§ §To find out more:§ §If you are interested in finding out more about this role please apply below with your CV and portfolio or email us at enquiries@twoticks.co.nz§§§§

jobText: TXT/50787114.txt	§Architect / Architectural Designer Wanted §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Architect / Architectural Designer Wanted §§Advertiser: §CreativeArch Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Salary§§$90,000 - $99,999§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§Architect / Architectural Designer Wanted §Generous remuneration package and career development.§Award-winning creative team that put the client first.§Collaborative people with passion and a culture with heart.§ §If you’re ambitious; have exceptional drawing/documentation skills; genuinely enjoy contributing to a team; & thrive on driving the commercial success of the business; then this could be your opportunity to make a difference!§The Firm:§This is not your standard architectural practise…§Creative Arch is a highly successful practise located in a ‘purpose built’ offices at the edge of Grey Lynn. Established in 1998 they’ve gone from strength to strength and are now a market leader and ‘employer of choice’. Their business model is creative and nimble, with a diverse workload that stretches across 3 x multi-disciplined companies: Creative Arch, Infusion Arch and Resolution Arch. Their projects encompass residential, medium/high density developments, hotels, commercial buildings and remedial development. §Creative Arch’s highly capable Owners and General Manager are skilled in strategy, execution, systems and culture building. They’re hugely proud of creating a positive, flexible environment that genuinely gives people accountability. Training and development programmes are a key focus enabling staff to perform at their best and develop their careers. Reward and recognition are highly important, with the icing on the cake being a company trip to Fiji in 2018 to recognise their 20 years of success. It’s no surprise that the 14 x employees with a significant number being long-standing creates a ‘tight knit’ team.  It’s just the way they roll!§The Role:§The position will have you work closely with all aspects of architecture in a varied role ranging from residential, commercial and remedial projects across our 3 business units. Your key objective – exceptional service, excellence in quality, a focus on innovative solutions and detailed designs! As such, you’ll need to have suitable experience, ability to work in a team environment. §Delivery beyond expectations will be your ‘norm’.§Background:§The successful candidate will have a minimum of 6 years Architectural experience. You are qualified in New Zealand with a Bachelor of Architecture, Diploma of Architecture Technology, New Zealand CAD or similar. Experience with Contract Administration NZS 3910, NZS3604 and NZBC are essential. You currently provide exceptional high-quality design, technical and Project Architectural services and can display evidence of this. §You pride yourself on delivering your clients incomparable results, solutions & pathways. Your key stakeholders will comment on your high “emotional intelligence”, adaptability and critical thinking. You are pragmatic and ambitious, with resilience and a “just get on with it” attitude§.§ Collaborative by nature, you’re keen to contribute to an innovative business that embraces these attributes, values work-life balance, and rewards performance. Outstanding results will provide awesome prospects for you and your career.§Does this sound like you? – If so please send your CV or to request an information pack email §info@creativearch.co.nz§  §att Mark McLeay §All enquiries will be treated with the utmost of confidence. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50787087.txt	§Intermediate to Senior Graphic Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate to Senior Graphic Designer§§Advertiser: §Coast & Co§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§21 Oct 2020§§Location§§Hawkes Bay§, §Napier§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§Have you got a passion for print design? Want to work for a tactical graphic design studio based in Hawke's Bay; assisting clients to tell their story to the world? Enjoy developing strategically led identities for start-ups to producing multi-page documents for large national companies and everything in between?§ §Then you will be interested in a role at Coast & Co. Founded on building strong and direct relationships with our clients; we relish the insights this provides and enjoy the dynamic thinking that results from this partnership. Our growing team of flexible and adaptable designers are proud to promote this point of difference and see it as fundamental to the company's success. § §We focus on brand and visual communication – working with collaborators to take care of the rest. There is an expectation for our staff to roll up their sleeves, pick up the tools and run with a project from any stage in the process. Their revenue models are getting turned upside down with the shift from fee-for-service to fee-for-value. They must comply with complex and often opaque program rules that create a heavy intellectual and administrative burden. They struggle with imperfect and often incomplete information to make decisions. These challenges are forcing them to reconsider their processes, management philosophies and even their cultures. §We help our customers navigate today's complex interoperability environment and excel within it. We leverage our deep domain, technical and data expertise to help our customers achieve higher standards of performance year after year. We connect information across a variety of systems, transport protocols and data payloads to provide clinical and operational insights for all stakeholders. Our focus is on solving the whole problem of how to deliver exceptional interoperability in a value-based world.  §Our people are our strength. We depend on our transparent culture, technical competence, and healthcare data expertise to get the job done. And we do it all while having fun and not taking ourselves too seriously. §About the Role§This role is for someone to take ownership of the information architecture, interface design, usability, and accessibility of the Lyniate product line with the goal of delighting customers through the experience of interacting with our products to accomplish their goals. The Lyniate product suite consists of on-premise and cloud applications. §Position Summary§Lyniate is actively seeking a §Senior UX Designer§ to join our growing team located in our §Auckland, NZ §office.§Primary Responsibilities:§Leverage user-centric design and information architecture best practices and your experience to design a modern, elegant, intuitive and functional UX vision.§Define user personas created from customer interviews.§Create the graphic artifacts and collaborate with Product and Engineering to devise the strategy for migrating to the new UX vision.§Identify usability problems throughout the existing product suite and prioritize core areas of improvement from system analysis, internal feedback, user interviews, competitor research and qualitative feedback from other sources.§Design user interfaces for new products.§Work alongside Product Owners and Engineers in the work streams creating wireframe prototypes to validate on designs and solutions.§About You§7– 10+ years of UX Design and software product experience.§Proven track record over several years in information architecture of complex technical applications and designing of diverse skillsets on the journey of creating better user experiences.§Comfortable working within Scrum or Kanban processes and cultures.§Excellent time management and productivity skills.§Excellent written and oral communication skills.§Adept at presenting ideas to diverse audiences and receiving and acting on feedback.§Formal educational background in information architecture, design, engineering, or additional relevant experience.§What We Offer§Mentoring, training, and contributions towards certifications§Diverse and inclusive team where every voice is heard§A You could be either a recent graduate in a design related field or an experienced kitchen/interiors designer looking for your next step.  § §To know more about us, visit §www.kitchenstudio.co.nz/our-showrooms/north-shore/§ §if you feel inspired by what you see there, then we'd love to know more about you.§ §This is a stimulating and rewarding role and a fantastic opportunity to become part of a professional team recognised for exceptional service and stunning results.§ §You should possess:§ §•   Excellent organisation skills and be self-motivated§ §•   Excellent communication skills§ §•   Friendly and helpful attitude and a teamwork approach§ §•   Strong service focus§ §•   Positive self-image§ §•   Integrity and honesty§ §Manage and enjoy your own flexible work hours. jobText: TXT/50816740.txt	§Group Graphic Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Group Graphic Designer§§Advertiser: §Vining Group§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§26 Oct 2020§§Location§§Manawatu§, §Palmerston North§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§Vining Group is a locally owned and operated family company, with approx. 12 employees. Under the Vining Group umbrella sits 3 companies – Golf Distributors, Impact Branding and Goldfern Mobility. It's cliché but at Vining Group we work hard, but also know how to have a good laugh. Employees a rewarded for their hard work with a competitive salary package, and various other employee perks, including onsite parking and soon to be finished, completely refurbished offices.§ §Our current Graphic Designer is on the move, so we are looking for someone to fill her big shoes. The role is full-time, worked between 8.30am and 5pm, Mon - Fri.§ §The purpose of the Graphic Designer role is to create visual concepts, using the relevant computer software, to communicate ideas that inspire, inform, or captivate those who purchase products distributed by the various Group companies.§ §We are looking for:§An individual who is prepared to get stuck-in, is creative, proficient at problem solving and has proven Graphic Design experience in a commercial environment.§ §You will have the ability to move from one task to the next without disruption, and be able to lend a hand in other areas of the business such as phone and general enquiries. You will have creative flair and be comfortable taking the lead on design projects to deliver messages with a high visual impact. You will have a strong track record of delivering quality content to deadlines and can showcase examples of recent and current work upon application.§ §A snap shot of the responsibilities includes:§Content creation including – but not limited to:§ § §Catalogue design§ §Email marketing design & effective distribution§ §Website content/mainteneance § §Social Media content§ §Product packaging§ §Creating and delivering external client concept templates§ §Marketing administration is required of the role§ §Minimum requirements:§ § §Excellent understanding of Graphic Design software such as InDesign, Photoshop, Adobe Illustrator or similar.§ §Excellent understanding of Mailchimp or similar e-mail marketing channels§ §Proficient in Microsoft Office and other software applications§ §Hard working attitude and outgoing personality§ §Previous experience in photography and video content creation and editing would be advantageous. During peak periods, there can be times where we require "all hands to the pump", so you will need to have a positive can-do attitude. § §If this sounds like you, please apply for this role by attaching your CV and examples of design work . Please include a cover letter outlining why you believe you are a suitable applicant for this role and why we should progress you through to the next stage. In your cover letter, we would also like you to answer the following question - §Do you prefer to work alone or in a team, why? Give example of where you have contributed to success of team? §Only applicants who answer this question will be considered for the role.  § §We will interview as we go, and will look to fill the role as soon as possible. We would like the sucessful applicant to have a hand-over period with the current incumbment, so we will be moving quickly. However we are committed to ensuring we recruit the right person.§ §You §must §be eligible to work in New Zealand to be considered for this role.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Have you completed a qualification in marketing?§How many years' experience do you have in digital marketing?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50802638.txt	§Technical Design Support§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Design Support§§Advertiser: §TenFour Technology Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Other§§§§§§About Us §  §TenFour are the experts of how AV technology is used to maximise communication in the workplace. §  §By uniting AV and conferencing and Unified Communication (UC) expertise under one roof, we design, install and support workplace AV communications tech so that it’s like running water – everywhere, always-on, and understood by everybody. We take an approach that’s closer to ‘architecture’ than ‘building’, delivering holistic design of AV systems that optimise how people communicate in the workplace.§  §As a Crestron Elite Partner, we have been New Zealand dealer of the year since 2015. We’re the only Polycom platinum partner and certified service provider in New Zealand. We are also the sole Australasian Distributor of ONElan digital signage. §  §We’re 100% kiwi owned and operated with offices throughout New Zealand. Here, the best AV designers, integrators and programmers are shaping the future of workplace technology and communications. We offer career paths and training for our people who are as excited as we are about the possibilities of technology.§  §Our sales team is smashing it right now. We need an experienced and talented technical person to jump in and support our busy Technical Team. § § §You'll partner with our Technical Team to produce schematic drawings, elevations and layouts of audio visual systems from a bill of material and project scope. You will also be tasked with producing documentation relating to project installation and post sales and support such as user guides and project handover documents. § §Your drawings and documentation will be followed by our installers, programmers, external contractors and construction foreman as well as our customers and end users. You’ll use your communication skills to convey information clearly and simply. Being comfortable in these varying environments, whilst maintaining the professionalism of a TenFour employee is important. You may be expected to attend site project meetings as a representative of TenFour, take notes and relay any critical information back to the TenFour project team.§ §We're a busy team and you'll be working on several projects at once, quoting from time to time and providing administrative support. Attention to detail and the ability to prioritise your time is crucial. When the project scope changes, you’ll need to update project documentation and ensure this is distributed to the relevant parties in a timely manner. We operate in a fast-paced project environment and changes may need to be implemented and actioned immediately. Procrastination is not an option! You'll need to be creative, methodical, and resourceful. A can-do attitude and the ability to get things done is a must. You'll need to work effectively both autonomously and as a key part of our team.§ §About you §  §If you're up for a new challenge and have relevant IT or AV experience and the skills to produce technical drawings and documentation, this role is for you. §  §Must have’s:§ § §Technically knowledgeable and competent§ §Highly Organised § §A great communicator § §A problem solver § §Driven and motivated § §Positive and personable§ §A clean, full Driver License§ §Nice to have’s: § § §understanding of AV installation methods§ §industry certifications§ §ability to understand a scope of work § §Visio and/or AutoCAD experience§ §Applicants with previous work experience in the AV or IT industry will be highly regarded. But those with relevant qualifications, the right skills, active interest and technical experience or aptitude (schematic, technical and system design drawings) should also apply.§  § §  § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§§§

jobText: TXT/50801013.txt	§He Maunga, He Tangata (Māori Design Internship)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§He Maunga, He Tangata (Māori Design Internship)§§Advertiser: §Auckland Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Landscape Architecture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §He Maunga, He Tangata (Māori Design Internship) §      §        §•    24 month Internship§•    Architecture or Landscape Architecture Masters study programme through Te Whare Wānanga o Wairaka/Unitec with paid tuition fees§•    Studio experience contributing to one of Aotearoa’s leading design practices, Isthmus§•    Placement within the Māori design rōpu at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau/Auckland Council§        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§ §        §He Maunga, He Tangata is a unique initiative available to Māori candidates who have completed their under-graduate degree in built environment design and are interested in continuing into post-graduate studies in Landscape Architecture or Architecture. Offered by Isthmus Group, Te Whare Wānanga o Wairaka: Unitec Institute of Technology,  and Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau: Auckland Council, this 24 month internship provides the opportunity to undertake post-graduate built environment design study, to be placed within a unique busy local government design environment, and also to be part of the design team in one of Aotearoa’s leading design studios. §        §The name adopted for this initiative speaks to the immutable connections established by whakapapa, which connect Māori to their environment and tūpuna across time. With these connections and ancestral landscapes standing strongly, Māori can stand and flourish to become all that they can be.§        §For the Te Kaunihera component of the programme, the successful candidate will be placed in the Māori Design rōpu which is part of Council’s Urban Design Unit for two, six-week placements for each 12 month period of the 24-month Internship programme. The role of the rōpu is to promote excellence in Māori design within a Tāmaki Makaurau context, with a particular focus on Te Kaunihera/CCO practice. §        §For the Isthmus Group component, the successful candidate will undertake a four week placement for each of the two years in the Auckland studio, and stand and work shoulder to shoulder with talented designers on a mix of design and research projects across the landscape, urban and archtictural realms.§        §At Unitec, alongside undertaking their study towards a Masters degree, the successful candidate will be be expected to contribute to the academic environment. This may include participation on relevant committees,  sharing learning and mentoring junior students to broaden and reinforce the learning opportunity.§        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        §We are looking of someone who currently holds an undergraduate degree in a design-focussed discipline or is in their final year of study in the field of landscape architecture, architecture or design. As a talented and highly motivated person you are keen to continue your academic development and pursue a Masters programme at Unitec (tuition fees covered) in either Architecture or Landscape Architecture, whilst undertaking periods of paid placement with both Te Kaunihera and Isthmus Group (full details of both placements available on request). You can view a copy of the position description here - https://bit.ly/3m5hUQc§ §        §To register your interest in the position§        §Please submit an email to Cheryl Toliver - §cheryl.toliver@aucklandcouncil.govt.nz§ by 5th November 2020 telling us about yourself, why you are interested in the position, your current field of study or work and a current CV. We will then invite people with the required experience and attributes to an interactive group workshop with our He Maunga, He Tangata partners – whānau support is welcomed at interviews.§        § §        §If you are passionate about leading and influencing the outcomes for Māori and are interested in helping us make the move from Auckland to Tāmaki Makaurau, apply now – nau mai, haere mai!§        §Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau and Isthmus Group are equal opportunity employers (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§•    24 month Internship§•    Architecture or Landscape Architecture Masters study programme through Te Whare Wānanga o Wairaka/Unitec with paid tuition fees§•    Studio experience contributing to one of Aotearoa’s leading design practices, Isthmus§•    Placement within the Māori design rōpu at Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau/Auckland Council§He angitūtanga: The opportunity§ §He Maunga, He Tangata is a unique initiative available to Māori candidates who have completed their under-graduate degree in built environment design and are interested in continuing into post-graduate studies in Landscape Architecture or Architecture. Offered by Isthmus Group, Te Whare Wānanga o Wairaka: Unitec Institute of Technology,  and Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau: Auckland Council, this 24 month internship provides the opportunity to undertake post-graduate built environment design study, to be placed within a unique busy local government design environment, and also to be part of the design team in one of Aotearoa’s leading design studios. §The name adopted for this initiative speaks to the immutable connections established by whakapapa, which connect Māori to their environment and tūpuna across time. With these connections and ancestral landscapes standing strongly, Māori can stand and flourish to become all that they can be.§For the Te Kaunihera component of the programme, the successful candidate will be placed in the Māori Design rōpu which is part of Council’s Urban Design Unit for two, six-week placements for each 12 month period of the 24-month Internship programme. The role of the rōpu is to promote excellence in Māori design within a Tāmaki Makaurau context, with a particular focus on Te Kaunihera/CCO practice. §For the Isthmus Group component, the successful candidate will undertake a four week placement for each of the two years in the Auckland studio, and stand and work shoulder to shoulder with talented designers on a mix of design and research projects across the landscape, urban and archtictural realms.§At Unitec, alongside undertaking their study towards a Masters degree, the successful candidate will be be expected to contribute to the academic environment. This may include participation on relevant committees,  sharing learning and mentoring junior students to broaden and reinforce the learning opportunity.§He kōrero mōu: About you§We are looking of someone who currently holds an undergraduate degree in a design-focussed discipline or is in their final year of study in the field of landscape architecture, architecture or design. As a talented and highly motivated person you are keen to continue your academic development and pursue a Masters programme at Unitec (tuition fees covered) in either Architecture or Landscape Architecture, whilst undertaking periods of paid placement with both Te Kaunihera and Isthmus Group (full details of both placements available on request). You can view a copy of the position description here - https://bit.ly/3m5hUQc§ §To register your interest in the position§Please submit an email to Cheryl Toliver - §cheryl.toliver@aucklandcouncil.govt.nz§ by 5th November 2020 telling us about yourself, why you are interested in the position, your current field of study or work and a current CV. We will then invite people with the required experience and attributes to an interactive group workshop with our He Maunga, He Tangata partners – whānau support is welcomed at interviews.§ §If you are passionate about leading and influencing the outcomes for Māori and are interested in helping us make the move from Auckland to Tāmaki Makaurau, apply now – nau mai, haere mai!§Te Kaunihera o Tāmaki Makaurau and Isthmus Group are equal opportunity employers (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. You will develop randomised levels with high replayability while maintaining the Path of Exile aesthetic across the game. We are looking for an avid gamer that has a deep understanding of Path of Exile and its themes.§ § § §Responsibilities§ § § §Create immersive and replayable gameplay that supports and enhances the core mechanics and aesthetic.§ § § §Ensure a high level of quality through close collaboration with the Creative Director, Art Directors, Game Designers, Environment Artists, Sound Designers and other disciplines.§ § § §Integrate the content produced by other disciplines for your designs into the game engine (new gameplay elements, AI, sound, etc)§ § § §Quickly learn to master our internal tools, and assist in making them better.§ § § §Conduct gameplay evaluations with the team, providing feedback and suggestions to help fine-tune the game§ § § §Locate and fix bugs in both your own and your colleagues' work§ § § § §Qualifications§ § § §2+ years of game industry experience§ § § §Game design sensibilities§ § § §Excellent written and verbal English communication skills§ § § §Experience using Maya or a high level of proficiency in a similar 3D modeling tool§ § § § §Job Status: §Full-Time§ §Location: §Henderson, Auckland§ §Apply to:§ §hr@grindinggear.com§§§§

jobText: TXT/50795777.txt	§Graphic Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graphic Designer§§Advertiser: §Ballantynes§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§At Ballantynes, everything we do is about delivering an exceptional customer experience. It's our people and the magic they perform, that brings those exceptional customer experiences to life – whether those people are behind the scenes or ‘on stage’.§ §About the role§ §This role is responsible for designing and producing a wide range of our promotional material from print advertising, brochures, in-store signage and web artwork, to ensure that our customers know what is happening within our retail world.  You will work on the design and production of Ballantynes editorial style magazines (both print and digital) from beginning to end, including art-directing and co-ordinating our photoshoots, working with external suppliers, and taking part in major instore events.§ §Successful Applicant§ §We are looking for a Graphic Designer of intermediate experience to join our team. You will be a great team player, with a positive hands on approach to problem solving and enjoy demonstrating your natural creativity. You will be an incredibly organised person who is unflappable when tight deadlines loom.§ §You should be a fluent user of the Adobe Suite - Illustrator, InDesign and Photoshop as well as Microsoft office applications, and be social media and web savvy. You’ll have experience designing for print specifications. While retail experience would be helpful, it’s more important that you can produce quality work to tight deadlines.§ §In return you will enjoy a fun and supportive team to work with, working in a world-class department store with top quality products and staff discount throughout the store.§ §If you love seeing your creative efforts realised and take pride in what you produce, we want to talk to you. This is a full time Monday – Friday position.§ §To apply for this role, please click Apply Now, applications close on 29 October 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50802418.txt	§Associate Director - Architect§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Associate Director - Architect§§Advertiser: §Maynard Marks§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§23 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§Who are we?§ §Maynard Marks is a New Zealand owned and operated award-winning, specialist Building Consultancy that is recognised as a leader in its fields of work.  As a technical professional services consultancy, we have been assisting our clients for over twelve years and have offices in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch.  Our team of experts includes Architects, Building Surveyors, Quantity Surveyors, Asbestos Assessors, Project Managers and Structural Engineers.  Our industry leading experts provide technical advice on building and property matters to every sector of business across New Zealand.  § §Due to our consultancy’s continued growth we now have an exciting opportunity in our NZIA practice for an experienced Architect manager to help lead our dynamic design and detail-focused architectural team.§ §Your new opportunity§ §We are seeking an ambitious, talented and experienced Architect and manager to lead projects and teams through all design phases including on-site phases of projects.§ §Your work will involve leading the architectural practice and project teams to deliver projects to the highest standards to exceed client expectations. This role will sit alongside our other Architectural Practice Leaders (2No.) where you will play a pivotal role in shaping and directing the team, developing rising talent and promoting architectural excellence by way of example, as well as seeking out and converting new opportunities.§ §A large majority of our current and historic projects are related to existing buildings, often those affected by weathertightness failure or other building defects. Our strategic plan is to further expand our architectural offerings, building on our expertise, with a particular focus on new build developments.§ §The successful candidate will possess:§ § §A proven track record to successfully run multiple projects and teams.§ §Comprehensive technical knowledge of NZ construction practices, relevant legislation and codes of practice.§ §Ability to motivate project teams to exceed KPIs and fee target goals.§ §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a clear focus on client needs, working with integrity and delivering quality on every project.§ §Ability to establish and implement quality assurance and risk management processes and strategies.§ §NZ registered Architect§ §Ability and proven track record developing new business and coordinating proposals and tender submissions.§ §What can we offer you?§ §A competitive remuneration package (with longer-term career development opportunity) and benefits including medical insurance, training and professional development opportunities, plus the chance to work for an award-winning consultancy with an excellent market reputation.§ §The successful candidate would be joining a diverse and supportive working environment with an active social event calendar.§ §If you are excited about the opportunity to combine your passion for architectural  excellence with your ambition to succeed, please submit your CV, portfolio and selected technical drawings (no greater than 5MB) to: HR@maynardmarks.co.nz§ §Only candidates with NZ Citizenship / Residency or a valid Work Visa will be considered.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years' experience do you have as a design manager?§Do you have experience working on residential construction projects?§Have you completed a qualification in architecture?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50800395.txt	§Stretch Fabric Pattern Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Stretch Fabric Pattern Designer§§Advertiser: §Sensor Holdings Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§22 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Fashion & Textile Design§§§§§§Help us make the best motion capture gloves ever. § §Role Title: §High Performance Garment Designer§ §Experience:§ 5+ years or more in sportswear or performance garments§ §Background§ §The natural way to interact with augmented and virtual reality will be with your hands. StretchSense is developing incredible gloves based on soft and stretchy sensor technology for the future of human machine interaction. Our first product is a motion capture glove specifically designed for animators that need perfect finger data for movies and games. § §We are looking for a garment designer to help us constantly improve the glove design, prototyping and glove manufacturing outsourcing. You will work on glove pattern, sewing, size fitting and ensure the smart glove is performing and comfortable.§ §StretchSense recently came under new ownership and we are looking to expand our team. We have a collaborative culture and a multidisciplinary group of engineers and creatives. We have some of the coolest customers in the world making amazing content and products. This is a rare opportunity to join a well-funded start-up and contribute on the ground floor to building the user interface of the future. § § § §Job Purpose: § §To design, prototype and scale up Stretchsense Smart Garments production for internal and external custom projects. Youl will be joining a garment design/production team of 5, and will be working alongside mechanical, firmware, software and chemical engineers within the Development Department. § §Role and Responsibilities§ § § §Designing smart garments from conception through to final production.§ § § §Pattern design and grading§ § § §Ensuring smart garment design is functioning and comfortable.§ § § §Collaborating with multidisciplinary team and involvement in design reviews§ § § §Supporting production, QC, R&D and custom jobs.§ § § §Technical supporting garments scaling up production and outsourcing§ § § §Assisting garments, fabrics or sewing related procurement.§ § §Essential Experiences and Skills§ § § §Proven experiences in working on sportwear or similar§ § § §Understanding in a variety of stretchable fabric§ § § §Understanding in different construction technologies for higher performance apparel§ § § §Pattern making, includes manual pattern making/alteration, digital pattern making/alteration, manual grading, digital grading, printing patterns§ § § §Size fitting includes garment fittings, body measurements. § § § §Create spec sheets and maintain documentation§ § § §Ability to thrive in a high-pressure and fast-paced workplace§ § § §A commitment to maintain a safe working environment§ § § § §Nice to haves:§ § § §Sewing skills, includes overlocking, plain sewing, cover seaming, hand sewing. § § § §Experience in sensor technology§ § § §Experiences in working in a multidisciplinary team§ § § § §Job Details§Locations: §Auckland, New Zealand (Penrose)§ §Expertise: §Garments Designer§ §Job Level(s): §Experienced§ §Work type(s): §Permanent full-time§ § § §You must have the right to work in New Zealand. §§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a designer?§Do you have professional pattern making experience?§§§

Contributing to some of the most challenging projects in New Zealand, the role involves a range of tasks, including undertaking site visits, evaluating regional and district landscapes, writing assessments and preparing graphics which may require travel across New Zealand. For the right candidate, we would consider making this appointment on a part-time basis.§        §Ideally, you’ll bring at least 4 years’ professional experience working in the area of landscape planning, along with the following skills and attributes:§        §          §A Bachelor’s Degree and/or master’s degree in Landscape Architecture or a Landscape Planning related field.§          §Are highly organised, reliable, resilient and able to persevere while managing multiple tasks and deliverables.§          §An ability to think strategically, conceptually and analytically while maintaining a focus on wide-ranging or long-term implications.§          §An understanding of landscape planning methodologies and experience at drafting related reports. (Skills in both technical report writing and in the preparation of graphic material are required).§          §An effective and confident communicator (both written and oral) to a broad audience, with the ability to work collaboratively.§          §Membership of a relevant professional organisation.§          §Expertise in the use of the Office365 suite.  §        §        §Boffa Miskell is a leading New Zealand professional services consultancy, that is focused on better outcomes for our environment. We are entirely employee-owned and growing, with an increasingly diverse portfolio of clients and projects. We offer a supportive, flexible and collaborative working environment and value having an inclusive and diverse workplace. final production of POSM§ §creating and implementing concepts for events such as tradeshows and seasonal holidays§ §online learning design, implementation and support§ §Please note: when applying, You will help clean things up if we are experiencing issues and more importantly, help us maintain processes and rules in place to ensure that our core systems function appropriately. You will also be§ §responsible for the provisioning, deployment, configuration, and administration of many different pieces of Unix/Linux operating systems, the services that are hosted upon them and our middleware environments.§        §Key aspects of the role will be to:§        §          §Support the core operations team in the Unix/Linux server environment space.§          §Manage and identify risks to core infrastructure and implement mitigation strategies.§          §Liaise with related ICT teams and stakeholders within Police. §          §Support the Operations Manager on continuous improvement initiatives across Technology Operations and ICT.§          §Engage with other technology teams to provide support for Technology Operations.§          §Supporting our middleware, external DNS and SSL certificates§        §        § §        §What you’ll bring§        §Being part of the Police whänau is about being our best to ensure our communities are safe and feel safe. Our Core Competencies provide a shared understanding of the behaviours, leadership and technical competence required for success at each level of Police. jobText: TXT/50818943.txt	§UX / UI / Digital / Web Design TXT§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§UX / UI / Digital / Web Design TXT§§Advertiser: §The Creative Store§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§26 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§The Creative Store§ §Great TXT. Great People.§ §www.thecreativestore.co.nz§ § § §FREELANCE§ – §Intermediate – Senior level. Are you looking to freelance? We have a wide range of freelance and contract roles. Ranging from 1 day to 3 – 6 month contracts – offering you flexibility to pick and choose when you want to work.  You have the option to invoice or to have your paye done for you.  Easy As.§ § § §Digital Design Lead.§ §The purpose of this role is to enhance the in-house design and the product brands, across all digital touchpoints, as well as further developing the digital team’s expertise. This is a Team Leader role that requires a very high level of digital design experience across an array of digital design disciplines (including brand, web/app, email, UI, UX, HTML and motion graphics). In this role you are required to oversee and take the lead on projects. §Reference #27387.§ §UI / UX / Digital Designer.§ §This is a permanent role for a UI / UX Designer, who is a self-starter and has the ambition and drive to design stunning, yet highly functional websites and taking the design through to wireframes for the developer. You will also have the ability to create stunning looking EDM campaigns, have great digital typography skills, along with other traditional forms of design work, including designing logos, and simple online product catalogues. §Reference #27377.§ §Digital Designer.§ §You will work closely with the directors, interpreting briefs and producing compelling content. Along with your design skills, you will be amazing at creating videos and animation. You are a born creative and this will come through in everything you do. In this role you will be responsible for creating everything from media kits, newsletters, digital banners, booklets, promotional videos, ‘how to’ animated videos, website banners.§ Reference #27379.§ §UX Designer.§ §Are you an intermediate to senior level Experience Designer looking for the next role? Come and work with this growing multidisciplinary team delivering research, strategy, and design experiences – helping create a strategic advantage for some of New Zealand’s leading organisations. You will be joining some serious talent within this agency, working on a diverse portfolio of§client projects in both public and private sectors. This is a leading design and digital consultancy§defining and creating desirable human-centred experiences that enable organisations to§transform themselves. §Reference #27375.§ §UX / UI / Digital Designer.§ §Are you an ambitious, dynamic, high energy UX/UI designer looking to work in a supportive, highly regarded team? Can you walk the talk when it comes to Agile and iterative design processes? This role is a 6-month contract for an intermediate to senior level UX/UI designer, who can start mid October on a 6-month minimum engagement. You will have strengths in user research, product design and design system implementation.§ Reference #27178.§ §UX Designer.§ §Joining a team of 6, with a direct report to the Group Manager Innovation Skills, this role will initially have a strong focus on product market fit / market validation services, gathering deeper customer insights and then deploying them across a range of touchpoints, including e-learning modules and workshops. Ideally, our client is looking for that person at the top of their game. With 10 years’ experience under your belt, you can fluently discuss your approaches, tools and experiences delivering on human-centered designs. You have come from lean or agile environments, know design sprints inside out and be fluent with the best approaches to extracting requirements quickly and efficiently.§ Reference #27314.§ §UI / UX Designer.§ §Joining this growing product team, you will work on their main site – this includes customer microsites, editorial pages, and internal projects that require a broad vision for the company. You will evolve the product and engineering departments to design future iterations and an app. You will have a strong eye for design and detail. Experience in UX is ideal, although not a requirement. jobTitle: UX/UI Designer Job in Auckland - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50700044.txt	§UX/UI Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§UX/UI Designer§§Advertiser: §Kwotimation§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§7 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§About the company§  §At Kwotimation, we provide the Online Pricing System (OPS) to businesses in the building and construction industry. The software automates the quoting process by empowering enquirers and customers to price their own jobs. This automation gives valuable time back to our subscribers and their customers. Our goal is to eliminate the wasted time and unnecessary travel required to price jobs that do not eventuate. We have a strong mission to provide real benefit to our subscribers, their customers and the wider environment with the OPS. §  §We are currently in a pre-seed investment round that will close in November 2020. There will be rapid growth in the company provided by the large instalment of angel and VC funding. We are now looking to add experience and expertise in UX/UI design in order to facilitate rapid iteration on the product prior to its release. §  § §  §About the role§  §As a small start-up team, we are looking for a UX/UI designer to join us on the ground floor. We’re looking to hire a thoughtful, empathetic, and experienced designer to take the lead in shaping our product using design best practices. This role is a good fit if you are a self-starter that can own projects end-to-end.§  § §  §Responsibilities include:§ § § §Leading the design and conceptualisation of our product §  § § §Evolution and constant iteration of the product design to satisfy customer needs§  § § §Conducting and managing customer research and usability studies§  § § §Working directly with engineers to provide product specs and assets§  § § §Designing wireframes and high-fidelity user interfaces§  § § §Designing graphic interface elements, like menus, tabs, and widgets§  § § §Evaluating our current app and recommending improvements§  § § §Performing A/B testing to improve pages§  § § §Improving the user experience related to core functionality and new features§  § §What we’d like to see:§ § § §A design portfolio, with a minimum 2 years of UX and UI design experience§  § § §A strong understanding of UX - Wireframes, persona canvas, user journey, storyboards, site maps etc.§  § § §Passionate about software design: A drive to partner with technology to create engaging digital experiences that people love§  § § §Strong communication skills: Not afraid to ask questions when needed, and can articulate technical details in an easy-to-understand manner§  § § §Obsession with the small details: You’re not happy with your work until every pixel is in its proper place.§  § § §Good time management: This is a fast-moving startup, and we’re looking for someone who can consistently hit deadlines for key deliverables§  § § §Strong conceptual thinking: Can interpret data and user feedback and then produce high level concepts and designs§  § §You might also have:§ § § §Experience and good understanding of digital and social media marketing§  § § §An understanding or keen interest in software development is a plus§  § § §  §Kwotimation has a modern office space in Onehunga, Auckland. We desire to work in person but the option for remote working is available. The founding team has over 10 years experience in the trades sector that gives us valuable experience in solving the problems faced by our target market. We are passionate about providing a web-based solution that gives time, profit and value to small-medium trades businesses. §  §You will become an fundamental component of a growing company, who has ambitious plans to deliver a world-leading quoting software technology. This is a tremendous opportunity to take a digital product from discovery into production and deployment. If this challenge excites you then we want you!§  §To find out more please apply via Seek (preferred) or email §info@kwotimation.com§ with your CV and a cover letter explaining why you are interested in the position, and why you’re a good fit. Examples of your past work, or any side projects you might have would be great to see.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following programming languages are you experienced in?§Which of the following front end development libraries and frameworks are you proficient in?§How many years' experience do you have in a software development role?§§§
