We offer exciting audiovisual products and promotions to creatives, so you'll help us engage our customers through great design and marketing. §  §About the role§  §As the Design & Marketing Coordinator, you'll ensure Rubber Monkey’s digital marketing grabs customers’ attention and creates interest in our products. You'll do this through engaging copywriting and eye-catching design. The Design & Marketing Coordinator creates electronic direct mail (EDM) and manages the social media activities, striving for high audience engagement. §  §The Design & Marketing Coordinator works closely with the Marketing & Promotions Manager, who will manage the workload of this role, and together with the Graphic Designer, you'll help deliver marketing campaigns to a high standard.§  §On an average day you might:§ § §Prepare copywriting and design for marketing and promotional emails§ §Compile and send mailers and monitor their performance§ §Run our social media accounts to ensure up-to-date content and prompt replies to customers§ §Prepare copy and imagery for social media and post regularly to Instagram and Facebook to increase engagement and drive traffic and sales§ §Design social media strategies to achieve business targets, monitoring and adapting these strategies based on results§ §Review reports and analytics tools to assess the success of marketing activities, iterating our approach based on these findings§ §Help create, run and monitor competitions to ensure high engagement from customers§ §Establish best practices in digital marketing at Rubber Monkey by staying up-to-date with industry developments and implementing new processes and tools in the marketing space§ §Be an advocate for design across all promotional and marketing activities at Rubber Monkey to ensure our brand is consistent and our campaigns are cohesive across platforms§ §Work with management on website design tasks as required, such as web page layout, navigational elements and assistance with typography or graphics§ §Prepare print material as required, such as business cards and signage.§ §This role is 37.5 hours per week Monday to Friday (either 8am - 4pm or 8.30am - 4.30pm). We are driven to compete with global pricing and provide our customers with the fastest delivery we can.§  §We are a locally owned and operated company based on Adelaide Road.§  §How to apply§  §If this role sounds like you, click ‘Apply for this job’ and submit a copy of your CV and a cover letter stating why you think you'd be a great fit.§  §For more information about this role, please email jimmy@rubbermonkey.co.nz. We offer a great work-life balance in a centrally located studio surrounded by coffee shops. This is an exciting opportunity for an experienced designer to join our small team.§ §We have a strong focus on mentoring, encouraging and supporting each other to be the best we can. We are storytellers, and love making the best solutions for our clients. Visit our website to check out some of our work: markcreative.nz§ §What you'll bring to the role§ §You are passionate about creativity, have outstanding attention to detail, are confident in navigating from concept to final product, are familiar with print, animation, illustration, digital design and campaign work. You are comfortable talking directly with our wonderful clients and will be keen to learn and grow your skills. § § §Minimum Bachelor tertiary qualification in Graphic Design/Visual Communications§ §Minimum 5 years studio experience§ §Strong conceptual thinking§ §Solid design, typographical and layout skills with an eye for detail§ §Excellent knowledge of Adobe Creative Suite§ §A positive, proactive and enthusiastic attitude and of course, a sense of humour!§ §The ability to be adaptable and work on multiple projects at the same time§ §Being a collaborative and positive member of our team§ §Plenty of initiative, self-motivation and the ability to work with a high level of autonomy§ §A courageous and creative mindset that's constantly looking for how we can do things bigger and better§ §A constant focus on delivery and great deadline management § §Impeccable attention to detail.§ §Does this sound like you and you have NZ residency or a valid NZ work visa? § §Send your CV and portfolio to §paul.andrews@markcreative.nz§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a graphic designer?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§Have you completed a qualification in design?§§§

jobText: TXT/50828296.txt	§Senior Interior Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Interior Designer§§Advertiser: §The Design Depot§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§27 Oct 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Tauranga§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Interior Design§§§§§§THE DESIGN DEPOT is a National and International Award winning Furniture and Interior Design store, recognised for impeccable customer service, innovation, attention to detail, and a passion for design.  Our luxury furniture, homeware, interior design and soft furnishing retail stores sell beautiful New Zealand made products, designer pieces, quality international brands and stunning one-off pieces sourced both locally and from around the world.  §We are locally owned and operated with ongoing growth.  Due to our increasing market demand we are seeking a motivated and experienced addition to our Interior Design and Curtain team in Mt Maunganui.§We are seeking a full time experienced Interior Designer for our Mount store - someone who can share in our passion for beautiful interiors and a commitment to provide the highest level of customer service at all times.§The successful candidate will have extensive curtain and interior design experience and most importantly be the right fit for our wonderful team.§The successful applicant will require the following skills:§A passion and drive for sales while providing customers with an outstanding customer experience, going above and beyond.§Previous interior design and curtain experience, with a proven ability to achieve sales targets.§A passion for the interior design industry§Knowledge and experience working with Furniture, home decor items and textiles.§Committed team player who must work well in a team environment and adhere to company values§Ability to assist clients with their design concepts, researching options and creating proposals with products from within The Design Depot range.§Great people skills with an approachable and friendly manner§Confidence with computers and administrative systems essential.§Ability to work independently, with initiative, highly motivated, proactive, with a can do attitude.§Great organisational skills, be able to multi task and excel under pressure.§The physical fitness to be constantly moving and lifting furniture and accessories§High energy§Professional attire and a good sense of humour§The position available is full time, ideally for an immediate start but we are flexible to wait for the ideal candidate. Hours and salary are both negotiable according to the skillset of the suitable candidate.§If this opportunity sounds exciting and you would like to be part of this fun, award winning team then please apply with your Cover Letter and CV.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§How many years' experience do you have as an interior designer?§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50856134.txt	§Print Shop Assistant / Designer 32 Hours $22ph - $25ph§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Print Shop Assistant / Designer 32 Hours $22ph - $25ph§§Advertiser: §Copybooth§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§1 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Salary§§$22 - $25 per hour§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§We are looking for an experienced front of house person, print industry experience a plus. The candidate will need great customer service skills and be well organised. §Supporting production and workflow management. You will be the first point of call at front counter and working independently operating the business, answering the phones and responding to email enquiries.§Main tasks include:§Front of House and Customer Service: Taking briefs, running first impressions, working with clients to manage timeframe expectations, recommending print solutions and maximising sales potential.§Basic photocopying, binding and laminating jobs for walk in customers§Print Finishing - trimming finished work on the guillotine, creasing, folding etc and organising handover of finishing to print finisher§Admin: maintaining stock levels, ordering, cash up and invoicing§Setup and imposition of files for printing (Fiery)§Running the printers§Skills and Experience§Ideally, you will already have had similar experience in a copy/print shop environment or related digital print industry position, however we are willing to train/retrain the right person who has excellent customer service/office admin skills and is the right fit.§You will possess the ability to work to a deadline, multi-task, re-prioritise quickly and time manage efficiently. You will have an eye for detail and be quality conscious. §All of these tasks are supported and backed up by the owner, the designer and print finisher. As we are a small team there is crossover between roles, so we are looking for a willing and versatile team player. §Software Knowledge:§Adobe Photoshop Junior Graphic Experience§Adobe Illustrator Junior Graphic Experience§Microsoft Office Knowledge§Hours of Work§4 Days per week with being able to work 5 days if cover required§9.00am to 5.00pm (8 Hours per day)§Must be able to work Saturdays§32 Hours Total per week§Hourly Rate§$22 - $25 per hour pending experience§2 Locations§Takapuna & Birkenhead Auckland§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

KODUM is a leading provider of end-to-end technology solutions to organisations throughout New Zealand, Australia and the Asia Pacific. § §As part of our aggressive growth strategies, we are looking for a highly motivated Solutions Architect to join our Auckland office.§ §You’ll be an integral part of a dynamic team, providing support to our Solutions Architect Team Lead and the wider Operations Team.§ §Ideally, you will have built up plenty of real-world experience and should be proficient in various drawing packages such as Visio, autoCAD and the fundamentals of the Microsoft Suite. If you also have an engineering or solution architecture diploma, certificate, or certification, then we would find that rather exciting.§ §You don’t necessarily have a background in AV (we can upskill you on technology), but you will possess a passion for integrated technology and be able to inspire clients with the possibilities it offers. § §While you’ll be based in Auckland, there will be plenty of opportunity to put your skills to work for clients across the country and in the Asia/Pacific region. § §What you’ll be doing§ §Work collaboratively with other Solutions Architects to drive architecture and quality with respect to solutions provided by the business§Analyse specifications to design solutions through information gathering and analysis§Assist with defining solutions that address clients’ strategic requirements§Participate in quality reviews to ensure delivery of a quality solution to client requirements§Prepare architectural design documentation, including diagrams and inventories§Provide and demonstrate technical proof of concepts, technical pilots etc to clients§Keep abreast of latest technologies and industry knowledge in general, in order to make informed decisions and solutions for clients§Assist with designing, developing and supervising implementation of test plans and report findings, in addition to making recommendations to appropriate stakeholders.§ §Ready to help take our business to exciting new heights – and to enjoy all of the rewards that comes with that success? Send us your cover letter and CV to §careers@kodum.co.nz§.§ §Kodum is an equal opportunity workplace. We would like to hear from all qualified applicants. experience?§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§ About the role§Reporting to the Senior Manager - School Design, the Principal Advisor - Technical is a specialist who brings their understanding and perspective of Our team of 300 work as one integrated studio across our seven Australasian locations. We see ourselves at the service of our clients, and of the community, and we take this approach to deliver long-term sustainable outcomes. Please visit our website www.warrenandmahoney.com to find out more about our organisation and view our portfolio of work.  § § Our BIM group is growing, and we are seeking individuals with experience in BIM Coordination and BIM Support for our Christchurch and/or Wellington studios.§             § §The Role/s§ § § § § §Manage the BIM and 3D Revit coordination processes for multiple BIM projects§ §Coordinate project BIM deliverables, Revit design models and project documentation§ §Perform model audits, uncovering issues / potential building clashes and report to the project team leaders§ §Be the first port of call for BIM questions in the studio§ §Assist with studio training as directed by studio BIM Managers§ §Conduct onsite laser scanning, assist with modelling and conversion, and communicate relevant information with the project team§ §Effectively engage with project teams, clients, sub-contractors§ §Conduct research into the latest BIM, design, cloud, and data technologies§ §   § §Experience   § § § § § §2+ year’s relevant experience§ §Experience in the use of BIM software (Revit, Navisworks, Revizto and ReCap and experience with Dynamo, AutoCAD, and InDesign is ideal)§ §Experience with ftp sites and other methods of file transfer§ §Relevant co-ordination experience with secondary consultants§ §Experience in a formal QA process§ §Demonstrated experience in interpreting and applying framework to building process§ §Strong interpersonal and communication skills with an interest in teaching others§ §   § § In return, you will be joining a diverse award-winning design team and an esteemed, industry leading BIM group. We are an agile, vibrant and social work environment, with an open and collaborative approach across all studios to create a one studio’ culture. Our people are valued for their contribution to the success of the practice and individual career development is an important aspect of this success. You will work alongside passionate senior leaders who will support you to develop your skills and experience.   §   § If you are looking for an opportunity to step up in an industry leading firm delivering some of Australasia’s largest, most complex and prestigious projects and have a passion for BIM, digital design, technology, and innovation, then we would love to hear from you!§ § Please email your CV and portfolio to §humanresources@warrenandmahoney.com§. All applicants must be NZ permanent residents or hold a valid NZ work permit. §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§

jobText: TXT/50844809.txt	§Senior Urban Designer (Architect)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Urban Designer (Architect)§§Advertiser: §Panuku Development Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§29 Oct 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Urban Designer (Architect) §      §        §•    Be part of a dedicated and dynamic team§•    Manage design outcomes on multiple development projects!§•    Work for one of NZ’s most unique urban regeneration agencies §        §We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Urban Designer - Architect to join our Design & Place Directorate at Panuku Development Auckland.§        §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§ §Reporting into the Team Leader of Urban Design & Master Planning, you will support and sometimes lead the production of urban design and building design projects at all scales and levels. This includes design management throughout project lifecycles, design review of development proposals, urban design services utilising in-house and external production support and providing advocacy and expert advice to Panuku and its partners.§        §You will act as the client-side design representative on building projects (from concept design through to detailed technical documentation phases) writing formal design review advice and negotiating particular outcomes through face to face liaison with development teams as well as managing related projects through the Technical Advisory Group review process. You can view a copy of the position description here - https://bit.ly/2Ty0AHr§        §He kōrero mōu: About you§The role requires the ability to work with autonomy in a dynamic environment within multiple project teams. The projects and operating environment require a proactive approach, anticipating issues, strong communication and influencing skills, and a willingness to lead and provide direction§        §Skills & Experience§•    At least 5 years practical architectural/urban design experience ideally in client-side roles specifying and negotiating building design outcomes.§•    Strong track record in site layout design, specifically, housing and commercial developments and yield modelling work including the application of planning and design requirements.§•    Some experience working within both consultancy and public-sector environments is desirable.§•    Experience in the provision of specialist design advice to address built form and urban design matters.§•    Experience in successful relationship management to achieve organisational outputs.§•    Knowledge of relevant legislative and regulatory requirements and frameworks within the Local Government environment.§•    Good recent knowledge of resource consents and plan change processes (or equivalent regulatory planning regimes).§        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§Panuku offers a unique blend of local government and commercially oriented business outcomes. Panuku is an inclusive, flexible and exciting organisation that offers many opportunities for you to make a real difference to how Aucklanders see their city. We support, encourage and nurture our people’s talents – both personally and collectively. and§          §delivery of successful external and internal communication initiatives;§        §   §You§   § You’ll have an eye for detail and the ability to handle multiple projects at once.  You’Il be self-motivated and will take ownership of your own workload, delivering superb end results, on time.  We’re looking for someone with:§        §          §a degree-level professional qualification relevant to graphic design;§          §3-5 years’ relevant work experience, ideally in professional services, or a corporate environment;§          §sound experience in the use of Adobe Creative Suite – InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator;§          §excellent interpersonal and communication skills, and an ability to work well in a team with a customer service focus;§          §a high level of accuracy and attention to detail;§          §experience with video production and editing, and digital design would be an advantage.§        §   § If you are interested in a challenging, creative role working with a lovely, close-knit team of experienced marketing colleagues, we'd love to hear from you§      §      §Jackie Mulligan§09 977 5104§ §    §    §  §§§ We have a fabulous opportunity for an experienced Graphic Designer to join our vibrant, experienced Marketing team in a fixed term role.  Simpson Grierson is one of New Zealand's leading law firms, and also one of the largest.   We are proud of our reputation for providing expert, practical advice across all areas of commercial law, and our diverse, inclusive culture.§   § The role§   § Reporting to the Marketing and Business Development Manager, and working closely with our Communications Manager, this role is a fixed term parental leave cover, for 12 months, from November 2020.  The role is ideally full-time,  although 4 days per week could be a possibility.  Our Graphic Designer is involved in the design process for projects from start to finish, working with the team to develop ideas and solutions. jobText: TXT/50861258.txt	§Principal Advisor - Design§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Principal Advisor - Design§§Advertiser: §Ministry of Education§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§Kia ora, Bula Vinaka, Fakaalofa lahi atu, Fakatalofa atu, Kia orana, Malo e lelei, Malo ni, Talofa lava, Tena koutou katoa and welcome.§Permanent - full-time§Develop and implement school building design and related documentation for school property§§Help shape the future of education§At the Ministry of Education, we work together to shape an education system that delivers equitable and excellent outcomes.§Our organisation is made up of more than 3,000 talented and committed people around New Zealand, from a wide range of backgrounds and cultures.§While we work in different groups and on different things, we all strive every day to make the biggest difference we can for every child, young person and adult student in our education system.§ About us§Education Infrastructure Service (EIS), a part of the Ministry of Education, manages the Crown's second largest property portfolio of around 2,100 schools with a book value of $18.3 billion, the largest payroll in the country, and transportation of over 100,000 students to and from school each day.§Our vision for school property is that all schools have quality learning environments as part of a well-managed and sustainable portfolio that helps deliver equitable and excellent outcomes for every child.§ About the role§Reporting to the Senior Manager - School Design, the Principal Advisor - Design brings their understanding and perspective of property design and the construction industry to work in partnership with other members of the School Design team and other staff within EIS to ensure School Design standards and requirements are upheld through design review processes, to advice internal and external stakeholders on design and technical matters, to assist at times to develop, implement and maintain a national set of education property reference designs, design standards and guidelines for school building design. You will be part of school design review providing advice to ensure great schools are delivered. We are a fast moving team making tangible differences!§Your key accountabilities will include: §Providing leadership to the design quality assurance reviews of school project designs to ensure that schools meet the Ministry's design framework.§Providing strategic level thinking and leadership into the development of the Property Design Framework including the development of Reference designs, developed as new or from previous projects, and Design Standards and Guidelines§Taking ownership of complex and escalated issues as a respected subject matter expert.§Please note there is further information available in the attached Job Description.§ About you§You will have a tertiary qualification in a design field, ideally architecture.§You will also offer:§Experienced in portfolio level design and standard setting§Experience in the procurement of design services and products§Strong communication and interpersonal skills with an ability to engage effectively with stakeholders and articulate business impacts§Ability to work with a wide range of people, including market leading architects, delivery managers, senior government officials and team members.§Have good written skills to provide design review reports and other related written documents.§ §If you'd like to bring your skills to a rewarding role within an organisation that's continuously reaching goals and striving for a better future for New Zealand, we'd love to hear from you.§ Are you ready to make a difference?§ §We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds, including Māori, Pacific and those with disabilities, who will enrich our understanding of the education system.§As a government agency, the Ministry is committed to keeping to the Treaty of Waitangi's guiding principles in our work for and with Māori students, their whānau, hapū and iwi.§Please review the Job Description and if this opportunity interests you, and you meet the requirements, apply now using the 'Apply Online' button. §For further information please contact Stephanie Phillips at §eis.recruitment@education.govt.nz§Applications close midnight - Sunday, 15 November 2020.§Click here to view the role description§§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50883041.txt	§Architectural Technician§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Architectural Technician§§Advertiser: §WSP§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Architectural Technician §    §    §      §WSP is a collaborative team of global experts who aspire every day to shape a better tomorrow.§With more than 49,000 people working in over 550 offices across 40 countries, we are one of the world’s leading engineering consultancy firms.§We value our people, our reputation, and our impact on the future. At WSP our role is to plan, design, manage and engineer our communities to thrive. We want our work to bring long-term improvements and to future proof our cities and environments.§The Role:§§This is a 12 month fixed term assignment§·        To carry out consultancy services to clients in the areas of design and documentation for architectural projects as agreed with the Manager Architecture.§·        Providing excellence customer service and seeking new opportunities to further develop the business.§·        To produce a full range of high quality design and construction documentation in support of the wider architectural team.§Skills and Experience:§·        Ideally a minimum of 3 years’ in commercial architecture.§·        Extensive professional experience as an Architect.§·        Architectural Diploma / Degree / Technical Certificate.§·        Experience across a wide range of building types and construction methods requiring complex design solutions, complex integration of construction elements and coordination of all building disciplines.§·        Strong Revit skills§How to Apply:§If this sounds like you, we want you to be part of what makes us great. Are you ready to be part of WSP? §For further information, please view the position description. To apply, just follow the link and apply online.§Why do you want to join us?§We’re future-focused experts who propose innovative ideas for our clients. It matters to us that our people come to work every day with curiosity, drive and a sense of purpose. Join us in doing purposeful, sustainable work that helps shape our communities and the future.§Stimulating, open working environments where everyone feels relevant, valued and supported is a catalyst for outstanding achievements in our opinion.§We know that, for everyone here, work is only one part of life, and making time for family, friends, hobbies and passions is vital. So, if working from home, working part-time or having a flexible start and finish to the day will help with this, we will try to make it happen. §Diversity of all kinds is extremely important, and so at WSP we embrace a diversity of perspectives. We welcome applications from individuals of all backgrounds, orientations, and identities.§He aha te mea nui o te ao. He tāngata, he tāngata, he tāngata.§What is the most important thing in the world? It is people, it is people, it is people.§§------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------§We are currently experiencing some technical difficulties with our careers page. I will email you back to confirm your application.§§      §      §      §    §    §WSP - Creating what matters for future generations  |  wsp.com/nz§  §§§WSP is a collaborative team of global experts who aspire every day to shape a better tomorrow.§With more than 49,000 people working in over 550 offices across 40 countries, we are one of the world’s leading engineering consultancy firms.§We value our people, our reputation, and our impact on the future. Are you ready to be part of WSP? §For further information, please view the position description. To apply, just follow the link and apply online.§Why do you want to join us?§We’re future-focused experts who propose innovative ideas for our clients. It matters to us that our people come to work every day with curiosity, drive and a sense of purpose. Join us in doing purposeful, sustainable work that helps shape our communities and the future.§Stimulating, open working environments where everyone feels relevant, valued and supported is a catalyst for outstanding achievements in our opinion.§We know that, for everyone here, work is only one part of life, and making time for family, friends, hobbies and passions is vital. So, if working from home, working part-time or having a flexible start and finish to the day will help with this, we will try to make it happen. §Diversity of all kinds is extremely important, and so at WSP we embrace a diversity of perspectives. jobTitle: Design Led Storyteller Job in Auckland - SEEK

jobText: TXT/50888227.txt	§Design Led Storyteller§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Design Led Storyteller§§Advertiser: §Fly Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§About the business and the role§ § § §Tēnā rawa atu koe, e te ringa rehe! §Nau mai, haere mai. § §We are leaders in the movement to design an authentic Aotearoa, weaving together the values, perspectives and stories of this place through inspiring design and visual storytelling. Based in Auckland for over 15 years, we are a small whānau looking to grow.§ § §We're Hiring Two Roles§We are recruiting two designers/artists/visual storytellers to create inspirational work across a wide portfolio of clients and ground breaking kaupapa. We are open to the level of seniority. What matters to us most is whanaungatanga - that we can share a kai, jam out to good music and create work together that makes us smile.§ §In recruitment terms, that's called "culture fit." § § § §Job tasks and responsibilities§ § § §You bring creative passion and have great design taste. You love branding, where the craft of fine details has clear intention. You are super keen to master the beauty of Māori art forms and tell stories through colour and composition. Being insightful about design ensures your work engages people in a meaningful way. Navigating Adobe Creative Suite is easy and you can jump in and out of programs like a pro. § §You are excited about an office that normalises te reo Māori in our everyday practise. We'll give you all the support you need. All you need is aroha for our native tongue and a hunger to learn. But if you can bring a kete of mātauranga Māori with you, that's a definite advantage. § §Lastly, no matter how much you're a stone cold star, this is a space of constant learning and delving into new horizons. We don't know it all and you love discovery and problem solving. You will be excited by the learning curve to new ideas and not intimidated by the lack of familiar territory.§ §If you have raw talent, or are an experienced veteran and you're keen to contribute to the future of Aotearoa design, let's kōrero.§ § § § §Skills and experience§ § § §You'll like this job if...§ §You enjoy collaboration, but can carry the weight of your work also. §You enjoy working across multi-disciplined campaigns that bring together branding, packaging, digital, social, experiential and advertising. §Enjoy leading the creative process and have loads of ideas that you just need the right Client and team culture to express.§Have excellent presentation and communication skills. Communicating your thinking with passion is natural for you. §Creating and crafting is pure joy.  You love the process and the results. § § § §Job benefits and perks§ § § §Some perks for the job:§ §We are moving to a new studio in Ponsonby, with a sweet Soda Stream machine. §Parking negotiable. §Choice clients, good peoples, no dramas.§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following Adobe products are you experienced with?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How many years' experience do you have as a visual designer?§Have you completed a qualification in design?§§§

jobTitle: Technical Manager - BIM Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50893767.txt	§Technical Manager - BIM§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Technical Manager - BIM§§Advertiser: §Kin§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§The Company§ §My client has been at the forefront of construction technology since 1998 and are technically excellent across 45 software platforms including CAD, BIM, Revit and ArchiCAD – through to specialist software.  They support clients across the architectural and engineering sectors with digital design and BIM expertise, and are involved through every project phase including design, construction, and post build.  They work in an environment of collaboration, both within their team internally and externally with multiple stakeholders, resulting in measurable added value for the client.§ §The Role§ §The company is already well established in NZ, however until recently the majority of the team has been based off-shore in Saigon, Vietnam.  This is a newly created position, to support the NZ Busines Director and the wider team - building the NZ pipeline of work and providing technical project expertise to local NZ based clients. § §Key Responsibilities include§ § §Taking the brief from new and existing clients§ §Working alongside clients on large and complex design tasks§ §Preparing the client brief and key task briefs for action with the Saigon based team§ §Attending monthly construction site meetings with clients and ensuring quality delivery and the fitness for purpose of the Saigon teams’ work§ §Assisting in developing BIM execution plans and act as the technical interface between the client and the Saigon team in developing such plans§ § §In addition to technical expertise, a key function of the role will be building new business.  While industry connections will be important, you will be well supported by the NZ Business Director, who has over 40 years of experience and industry contacts.  He is happy to share his knowledge and support you for the mutual benefit of the business and your own profitability.  There is a very real opportunity to dramatically increase your salary, with commission payable on any successful new business from either new or existing clients.§ § §Your Experience§ §You will be a qualified architect or engineer, and possibly worked as a Project Architect, or Senior Design Technician or similar.  It is essential that you have a high degree of competency and experience in BIM and Revit, and any site-based experience of ArchiCAD, Tekla or similar will be well regarded. In addition, we are looking for the following:§ § §Proven problem-solving ability gained within complex project environments§ §Commitment to meeting all deadlines, and ability to manage multiple stakeholders§ §Experience in the preparation of tender documentation§ §Some site-based experience is preferred§ §Detail focus, particularly around Quality Assurance§ §Experience in building new business and a real desire to build a pipeline of work§ §Current industry contacts and ability to network and promote the NZ business§ §Relationship building skills together with a diplomatic approach, and sensitivity around the complexities of dealing with an international team§ §Qualifications in Architecture or Engineering (essential), additional qualifications in BIM and Revit (preferred)§ § We’d love to hear from you if feel this role is a fit for your skills and experience.  Please apply with a cover letter and your CV by 5th December 2020.  If you have any questions relating to the role, please contact Natasha Symonds on 022 069-5284 or §Natasha.symonds@kin.co.nz§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50902421.txt	§Senior Product Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Product Designer§§Advertiser: §Kin§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§8 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§About Storypark§ Storypark creates tools for educators, early childhood education services and families to collaboratively document, share, discuss and strengthen the learning and development of children. We’re well established in New Zealand and Australia, and working to grow our reach and impact in existing and new markets.§   § We’re looking for a Senior Product Designer to join the Storypark whānau, who shares a passion for our purpose and the power of design to solve meaningful and complex problems.§   § §What you’ll do§ You’ll work closely with our team, customers and expert advisors to build a deep understanding and empathy for teachers working with young children and their families. You’ll be embedded in and collaborating closely with a product team, developing strong partnerships with product managers, engineers, UX researchers, and designers to deliver valuable, loveable tools and experiences for our customers.§   § §This is a pivotal role that will contribute to and lead across a wide range of work:§ § §Help to discover, validate and define customer problems within the existing product and outside of the current product§ §Ideate, prototype, test and iterate on solutions with our team and customers§ §Design elegant experiences and interfaces for our core suite of products§ §Develop and maintain a design system for our web application, iOS and Android apps§ §Collaborate with product managers and engineers to find solutions that are feasible, pragmatic and impactful§ §Communicate design intent and vision both internally and externally, share compelling stories to clarify the ‘why’ behind your designs§ §Contribute to evolving our practices and processes as a product team – we value an open culture of feedback and continuous improvement§ §Contribute to product strategy and roadmap decisions§ §Occasionally support other teams by crafting brand, sales and marketing materials§ §This role reports to the Head of Product, and is closely supported by Product Managers, Designers and a UX Researcher.§ § §What you’ll bring § § §Experience as a product, interaction and / or user experience designer that has worked with teams to deliver solutions that meet the needs of users§ §You appreciate the big picture and the small details, with thorough attention to detail when thinking about complex problems, systems and software§ §A proven ability to simplify complex needs into simple, elegant and accessible designs§ §Experience and interest in testing and validating your designs through interviews and user testing§ §A talent in general graphic design practice and typography§ §Solid UX copywriting that is approachable, simple and effective§ §You’re happy and productive prioritising your own time and work§ §You use the right tool for the job, with proficiency in a variety of design and prototype tools such as Figma, Sketch and Invision§ §Experience and proficiency in front end development is a bonus§ §A desire to learn and grow – We value curiosity, collaboration and growth mindsets. Change is guaranteed, and your role will expand and evolve as Storypark does.§ § §Working at Storypark § We strive to create a respectful, caring, safe and inclusive culture, and welcome people from diverse backgrounds to join us.§ § §Competitive salary§ §Flexible working hours§ §Regular compensation reviews – great work is rewarded§ §Fuel yourself with breakfast, lunch, drinks and snacks from our well stocked kitchen§ §Flexible holidays§ §Macbooks are our standard but we’re happy to get you whatever equipment helps you get your job done§ §A relaxed office environment with flexible spaces to work and play§ §We believe in building strong relationships across teams with lots of events, shared lunches and celebrations§ §We also offer relocation assistance for people joining us from other areas§ §We'll push and grow you to learn new skills, collect new experiences, and refine your craft.§ § §What next?§ To apply, click the 'apply now' button with your CV, portfolio and cover letter telling us why you're the one we've been waiting for we'd love to hear from you right away!  Applications close 23 November 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

This is not just a job; this is a job where your solutions embody a love of design and technology. You will need to have the energy, drive, creativity and vision to fit our client's team, and a personality style to ensure their customers enjoy working with you.§        §Role description:§        §In your role as a Senior Experience Designer, your day-to-day tasks will consist of collaborating with clients and your team members to understand the opportunity presented to you holistically while analysing, understanding, and coming up with a solution that is fit for purpose. They love working with their clients to understand their needs and most importantly what they are trying to achieve for their audiences. As Senior Professionals, they share their skills and experience with the wider team. jobText: TXT/50866219.txt	§Senior Graphic Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Graphic Designer§§Advertiser: §people&co.§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§2 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Salary§§14 month fixed term role, commencing February 2021§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§ §Create, execute and deliver § §Work across multiple brands and channels § §Award-winning team§ §Working with the Marketing Manager and wider Engineering New Zealand team, you’ll be the design lead creating beautiful, easy to understand and impactful work, and have responsibility for managing a graduate designer. This role works across multiple brands including Engineering New Zealand, Wonder Project, Diversity Agenda and the ENVI Awards, and across digital and print channels. You’ll also do all the design on their quarterly magazine, EG, which was recently awarded Best Magazine Trade in the Magazine Media Awards. § §Engineering New Zealand is the professional home for all engineers in New Zealand. But it’s not your average membership organisation. They’re committed to thinking differently, always challenging the norm, and creating beautiful experiences for their members and stakeholders. § §This role will suit someone with a tertiary qualification in design and over five years’ experience with: § § §in-depth knowledge of the Adobe Creative Suite, including InDesign, Photoshop, Illustrator § §understanding across a broad range of content marketing activities including, brand, graphic design and print production § §an inherent ability to create striking designs.§ §To be successful in this role, an impeccable eye for detail, a can-do attitude, exceptional organisational skills, resilience under pressure and the ability to engage with people of all levels, is a given. To stand out from the crowd you’ll need an impressive design portfolio and the confidence to suggest new ideas and think critically. § §This is a fixed-term contract covering parental leave for 14 months. You’ll walk into an award-winning marketing team based in Wellington, with strong values for good design and a fun culture. The expected start date for this position is 15 February 2021. It is based in Wellington within new Taranaki Street premises. The full position description is available on our website, peopleandco.nz § §Sound like you? Don’t delay and hit the §APPLY NOW §button or contact §Katie Kemp §on §04 931 9466§ quoting job number §19530 §to discuss this opportunity further. All applications will be acknowledged electronically. Applications will close §9am§ on§ Monday, 9 November 2020. §All applications should include a link to your design portfolio.§ §To be eligible to apply you must have the legal right to live and work in New Zealand and meet any entry requirements if you're outside the country.  For advice on obtaining a New Zealand work or residence visa and our entry requirements visit www.immigration.govt.nz § §§§§

jobText: TXT/50869236.txt	§Intermediate / Senior Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate / Senior Planner§§Advertiser: §Hamilton City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§3 Nov 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§Location:§ Hamilton City§ §Employment Type:§  Permanent§ §Applications Close: §15 November 2020§ §Are you an experienced planner looking for a new challenge?§Hamilton is committed to attracting the best and brightest to our city. We are a city of growth and home to some of the world’s most innovative businesses. This means more jobs for talented people, greater opportunities for those with vision, and a powerful network of like-minded people and organisations.§About us:§Here at Hamilton City Council, we can offer you a unique variety of in-house local government experience. You'll be joining our team who specifically work on plan changes, processing designations, implementing the raft of national policy changes as part of Central Government’s urban growth agenda, and providing strategic policy advice within our organisation.§Our team is filled with industry professionals who are passionate about what they do. We are looking for someone with the right mindset who we can support and develop to move forward in their career.§About you:§Our ideal candidate will have a bachelor’s degree in Planning or Resource Management, (or equivalent tertiary qualification) and at least two years’ New Zealand based experience in planning and resource management application. You'll be a team player with a growth focused mindset. We have scope for an Intermediate or Senior Planner depending on skills and experience, or the ability to provide a development pathway from Intermediate to Senior level.§Beyond the bounds of work, Hamilton has a great cafe culture, flourishing arts scene, and only a short drive to ski fields and beaches on both coasts. We also offer great staff benefits such as a well-being day, flexible working hours if needed, discounted medical insurance and more. There are also a lot of great opportunities for growth within the Council. We aim to provide a supportive learning environment where you can further your knowledge and skill set.§Hamilton City Council is committed to being a high-performance organisation with people who think differently, act with integrity, make it happen and work together. If this sounds like you, make it happen and apply online today!§ §All candidates will be notified of the outcome on their application via email. Short-listed candidates may be required to complete an interview process, reference checks, pre-employment medical and drug assessments, and Ministry of Justice or Police vetting check.§ §Please note this role is being sourced directly and we are not accepting applications via external recruitment agencies. Only people who are eligible to work in New Zealand should apply. Evidence will be required.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50890794.txt	§Intermediate Architectural Technician / Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Intermediate Architectural Technician / Designer§§Advertiser: §Maynard Marks§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§Who are we?§  §Maynard Marks was established in Auckland in 2008, initially offering building surveying services. Today we are one of New Zealand’s fastest growing professional building and property consultancy companies, offering a wide range of specialist services for residential, commercial, industrial, and institutional property owners and occupiers throughout New Zealand with offices in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch. Our multidisciplinary team of circa 100 employees consist of professional building surveyors, project managers, quantity surveyors, architects / architectural designers, asbestos consultants, structural engineers, and support services.§  §Our values are client focus, operating with integrity and delivering quality. We promote a culture of teamwork, wellness & wellbeing.§  §Your new opportunity§  §Due to our consultancy’s continued growth we now have an exciting opportunity in our NZIA practice for an experienced Intermediate Architectural Technician / Designer to join our dynamic design and detail-focused architectural team.§  §You will be ambitious and talented, with a strong technical focus looking for a challenging role to work on projects through all phases of the design and construction stages including detailed design and on-site phases of projects.§  §This will involve you working with numerous parties including liaising with clients, contractors, and consultants, and resolving complex construction details and specifications, whilst maintaining quality always. There will be numerous site visits so you will need to hold a full and valid New Zealand Drivers Licence.§  §To succeed in this role § § §You will be able to demonstrate comprehensive Revit or ArchiCAD experience which is a prerequisite for this role.§ §Hold an Architectural degree from a recognised university.§ §Have at least 4 years post graduate practical experience in the New Zealand market.§ §Possess exceptional technical understanding of NZ construction practices and relevant legislation.§ §Refurbishment or remediation experience, and familiarity with multi-unit residential projects would be highly desirable.§ §Excellent written and verbal communication will be your forte.§ §You will be highly organised and exhibit outstanding time and quality management skills.§ §What can we offer you?§  §A competitive remuneration package along with a supportive and inclusive work culture, clear career progression path, numerous training, and professional development opportunities, plus the chance to work for an award-winning consultancy with an excellent market reputation.§  §If you would like to apply for this exciting role, please submit your CV, portfolio and selected technical drawings (no greater than 5MB) to: §HR@maynardmarks.co.nz§  §We will only consider applicants with NZ Citizenship / Residency or a valid Work Visa.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§Have you completed a qualification in architecture?§Do you have experience working on residential construction projects?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobTitle: Revit Technician - Intermediate Job in Auckland - SEEK
xenophobe: right to live and work
jobText: TXT/50886697.txt	§Revit Technician - Intermediate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Revit Technician - Intermediate§§Advertiser: §Ockham Residential§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§5 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§ §  §Ockham Residential Limited § §Revit Technician – Intermediate Position Description § § §  §We’re a proudly, avowedly Auckland-centred company who have worked on 14 acclaimed residential developments over the past decade. We specialise in medium-density housing, typically 3-5 storey apartment buildings, each with the elegant and enduring Ockham ‘look’.§We love Auckland / Tāmaki§ §Makaurau and strive to make our buildings as beautiful as the landscapes they sit within – buildings that will age gracefully, enhance their surroundings, and be well-loved by their communities. We take a long-term view on development and call ourselves 'urban regenerators': we see housing as infrastructure, the building blocks of community. §  §Now we’re looking for 2 Intermediate Revit Technicians to join the team. The job in a sentence? To assist the Architecture team in project delivery, working with them through the entire property development life-cycle, from conception to completion (we design all our projects in-house).§  §This job requires excellent communication skills as you’ll be working alongside a dynamic, deeply curious and close-knit team. You’ll be expected to display considerable initiative, while also being a first-rate listener and fast learner. Since you’ll be working on multiple projects all at different stages, you’ll be an adroit multi-tasker (it goes without saying that we are an equal opportunity employer and so will not discriminate against men in this regard… jokes!).§  §Highly competent Revit skills are, of course, essential. Knowledge of the New Zealand Building Code in all its multifarious glory is a bonus though not a dealbreaker: we expect the successful candidates would soon get up to speed here and swiftly broaden their skills.§  §These are permanent full-time positions, working out of Ockham HQ on Khyber Pass Road in Grafton. Working hours are standard: Monday to Friday, 8:30am – 5:30pm. §  §What else? We have a strong and inquisitive culture at Ockham. We seek people who love this city and have a generous and holistic take on development, on community – and on the things that make life worth living. We have a strong philanthropic presence – we are lead sponsors of the New Zealand Book Awards, the Objectspace gallery and the Ockham Collective (among a host of initiatives) – though for us it’s not a matter of giving back, so much as simply doing our bit. Belonging. Creating. Being contributors to our city.§If this broadly aligns with your personal kaupapa – and if you have the following skills – then we want to hear from you ASAP. §  §Qualifications (aka the boring but important stuff):§ § §You’re a sound Revit operator – we’d expect 5-8 years’ experience.§ §You’re able to build Revit families.§ §You have 6-8 years’ experience in construction detailing.§ §You have knowledge of the New Zealand Building Code and NZ Standards (having NZ experience would be preferred).§ §It would be great if you have multi-unit residential experience.§ §You have excellent communication skills (we have lots of great talkers at Ockham: we love listeners too!).§ §Your time-management talents are impeccable. You’re a natural multi-tasker – but you’re also fiercely focused with mighty attention to detail.§ §You can work independently and efficiently, though you’re also a team player happy to muck in as needed.§ §You’re able to carry out tasks as instructed.§ §Finally, you work hard and you’re a good sort.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§How many years' experience do you have in the architecture & design services industry?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§Do you have experience working on residential construction projects?§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

These products are designed and developed from our office and factory in Albany, Auckland. GHP is a full-service natural health products company, supplying pharmacies, health products, stores and duty-free shops. As well as our local market, we are proud to export products globally (Australia, China, South Africa, Vietnam, and more). We constantly challenge ourselves to improve our products, provide down to earth advice and excellent service. § §The Role:§ §Good Health are looking for a Graphic Designer to join our Marketing team of 6, working alongside the Brand Managers, Graphic Designer, Naturopath and Marketing Manager. § §We are looking for an experienced Graphic Designer who is passionate about health and well-being. You will manage product categories within an assigned portfolio, achieving volume and profit objectives and retaining competitive advantage. § §We need an enthusiastic individual with knowledge of the health industry, a passion for natural health support and who has experience in New Product Development. § §Some role responsibilities would include:§ § §Develop design ideas by researching and participating in brainstorming, training, events and supplier meetings, visiting competitors, etc.§ §Develop overall product design and print/digital ready artwork of packaging, publications, point of sale, advertising, branding and signage.§ §Follow marketing approval processes and present completed designs to the project owner.§ §Ensure all Good Health websites are up to Search Engine Optimization standards and continually analyze the performance of these websites for areas of improvement.§ §Digital strategies and creative design across Good Health social media platforms.§ §Media liaison for technical design requirements.§ §The Benefits:§ §This role is perfect for someone wanting to work in a diverse culture and having the opportunity to be part of a global brand.§ §We have free parking on site and have a great discount for staff members on all our products, including free monthly credit for purchase. § §Based in Albany, we manufacture and distribute on site - getting you closer to the product! § §We are flexible on hours and strive to keep a loyal and hard working culture.§ §Preferred Skills and Experience:§ § §Relevant Tertiary Qualification§ §3+ Years Experience§ §Experienced with Adobe CC creative suite – especially InDesign, Photoshop & Illustrator.§ §Experienced with social media platforms, strategies to enhance engagement and ways to maximise performance.§ §Consultative and open communication style.§ §Strong ability to manage multiple priorities and projects simultaneously§ §Passion for wellness and feeling great!§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a graphic designer?§What's your expected annual base salary?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50900414.txt	§Architectural Graduate§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Architectural Graduate§§Advertiser: §Archway Recruitment§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Salary§§Competitive salary and benefits§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Architectural Graduate §    §    §      §Our client is an award winning, design led Architectural firm based in Central Christchurch. Specialising across a diverse portfolio from multi residential, senior living, mixed use, community and commercial sectors, they base their success on collaborative and inclusive design.§  § They now seek to employ an experienced Architectural Graduate to join their team in Christchurch.  The successful candidate will ideally be a strong all-rounder with involvement in all stages of a project – across design development from concept design, assisting and overseeing in the detailed design phase, master planning, documentation, client liaison, coordination of consultants, contract observation and construction.§  § With this in mind, in order to be successful in this role, you will hold demonstrable experience as an Architectural Graduate, with a minimum +3 years’ experience, having worked in a similar role, ideally in NZ.  You will be a proactive, enthusiastic, engaging and collaborative professional with a strong passion for good design and delivery.  You will hold knowledge of NZ design and construction processes.  You will be a very strong communicator with the ability to liaise across all levels.  Proficiency in the use of REVIT is essential. §  § You will receive a competitive salary with the opportunity to join a forward thinking, collaborative, creative thinking, professional working environment.§  § If this position sounds interesting or you would like to know more, please get in touch with Claire Smith on §claire@archwayrecruitment.com§ or call to discuss further on 021 765 535 or §03 925 9795§. §    §    §Claire Smith§021 765 535 §    §  §§§Our client is an award winning, design led Architectural firm based in Central Christchurch. jobText: TXT/50894354.txt	§Kitchen Designer: Retail (Warkworth)§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Kitchen Designer: Retail (Warkworth)§§Advertiser: §Mitre 10§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§6 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Rodney & North Shore§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Other§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Kitchen Designer: Retail (Warkworth) §      §        §Warkworth is a town on the Northland Peninsula in the upper North Island of New Zealand. It is in the northern part of the Auckland Region located on State Highway 1, 64 km north of Auckland and 98 km south of Whangarei, and is at the head of Mahurangi Harbour. Now with the construction of the Northern Corridor almost complete, the world will become a smaller place and travelling to Warkworth will be a breeze.§        § §        §Kitchens are the heart of the home, kitchens sell houses!  We pride ourselves on ensuring we provide great customer service, so we would be really keen to hear from you if you have our passion for ensuring our customers get the right product and an exceptional level of service every time they walk through our doors – going the extra mile will be the norm for you.  §        § §        §Our kitchen showrooms showcase our inspirational range of kitchen products and we need great customer focused team members to bring our customers visions for their kitchens to life.  We are now seeking a full time Kitchen Expert to join our team of Kitchen Designers.§        § §        §The focus of this role:§        §This role gives you an opportunity to use your flair to design and sell our kitchen range, helping our customers in all aspects of their kitchen makeover. Whether it is helping our customers design their new kitchen or selecting the right flat-pack options, along with the right kitchen appliances to suit their needs, working in this department means really listening to our customers’ requirements and presenting the right solutions. §        § §        §Our ideal applicant:§        §          §Previous retail experience and/or kitchen design experience will be viewed very favourably§          §Ability to draft accurate CAD designs in accordance with the customer’s needs. §          §Enthusiasm and team spirit; §          §A passion for customer service excellence and great communication skills§          §Good time management; §          §A quick and alert mind, with the ability to adapt and be flexible §          §A lateral thinker who can identify solutions and be creative;§          §Excellent attention to detail and accuracy; and the tenacity to follow up our suppliers to ensure your customers receive the correct products, on time.§          §CAD experience would be an asset.§        §        § §        §What’s in it for you:§        §This role offers you the opportunity to be an integral part of a proudly Kiwi-owned and operated independent retail business. We are proud to offer an industry leading learning and development framework, opportunities to grow your career, a generous staff purchase scheme and all the tools required to perform the role.§        § §        §About Warkworth:§        §The Warkworth district is known as the Kowhai Coast, named after the native kowhai tree, and the town's annual Kowhai Festival is one of the largest community festivals in the country, running for around a week in spring.  One of the most prominent features of Warkworth is the Mahurangi River, an estuary which runs right through the township, where it then joins the Mahurangi Harbour and flows into the Hauraki Gulf. On the eastern side of the river is the Mahurangi East peninsula, with the seaside towns of Snells Beach and Algies Bay. It is here that the scenic Kawau Island is found, notable for its historic Mansion House, once the private retreat of Governor Grey.  East of Warkworth and north of Mahurangi East lies the Tawharanui Peninsula, home of The Tawharanui Regional Park and Tawharanui Marine Park. To the north is the town of Wellsford, with the thickly forested Dome Valley lying in between.  On the west coast lies the Kaipara Harbour, while to the south is the small historic township of Puhoi and further south the larger town of Orewa.§        § §        §Who we are:§        §Riviera Hardware Holdings Limited (RHHL) owns and operates Mitre 10 MEGA Albany, Mitre 10 MEGA Warkworth, Mitre 10 MEGA New Lynn and Mitre10 Whangaparaoa.  We also operate our three Columbus Coffee shops within our MEGA stores. We deliver Prenail Frame and Truss solutions through Riviera Pre-nail and manage our own importing via Riviera Imports. §        § §        §Please note:§        §All employment offers are subject to background checks including References and Ministry of Justice Checks. Applicants need to be able to fulfil the inherent requirements of the role.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§Warkworth is a town on the Northland Peninsula in the upper North Island of New Zealand. It is in the northern part of the Auckland Region located on State Highway 1, 64 km north of Auckland and 98 km south of Whangarei, and is at the head of Mahurangi Harbour. Now with the construction of the Northern Corridor almost complete, the world will become a smaller place and travelling to Warkworth will be a breeze.§ §Kitchens are the heart of the home, kitchens sell houses!  We pride ourselves on ensuring we provide great customer service, so we would be really keen to hear from you if you have our passion for ensuring our customers get the right product and an exceptional level of service every time they walk through our doors – going the extra mile will be the norm for you.  § §Our kitchen showrooms showcase our inspirational range of kitchen products and we need great customer focused team members to bring our customers visions for their kitchens to life.  We are now seeking a full time Kitchen Expert to join our team of Kitchen Designers.§ §The focus of this role:§This role gives you an opportunity to use your flair to design and sell our kitchen range, helping our customers in all aspects of their kitchen makeover. We are proud to offer an industry leading learning and development framework, opportunities to grow your career, a generous staff purchase scheme and all the tools required to perform the role.§ §About Warkworth:§The Warkworth district is known as the Kowhai Coast, named after the native kowhai tree, and the town's annual Kowhai Festival is one of the largest community festivals in the country, running for around a week in spring.  One of the most prominent features of Warkworth is the Mahurangi River, an estuary which runs right through the township, where it then joins the Mahurangi Harbour and flows into the Hauraki Gulf. On the eastern side of the river is the Mahurangi East peninsula, with the seaside towns of Snells Beach and Algies Bay. We are committed to helping people and communities across Auckland to live more active lives.§ §As a key strategic partner for both Sport New Zealand and Auckland Council, Aktive invests in organisations and initiatives that will increase and sustain participation and strengthen all parts of the sporting and recreational system. This is underpinned by our community sport strategy: §The Auckland Approach to Community Sport§ – a vision for co-creating a world-class sport system in Auckland.§ §About the role: § §Reporting to the General Manger - Community Sport, this role exists to improve the overall wellbeing of Auckland's communities by leading in a way that ensures that our built facilities and open spaces provide fit-for-purpose opportunities to enable increased participation. It involves providing leadership and strategic direction on the development and implementation of tools and processes that help organisations to make informed decisions on all aspects of spaces and places for sport, play and active recreation. This requires a collaborative approach that informs collective, evidence-based decisions and investment.§ §To do this, the Spaces & Places Manager role comprises a number of accountabilities including life – putting words into actions and demonstrating impact§ § § §A strong communicator, relationship builder and people manager§ § § § Skilled at using your ability to influence changes in attitudes, development opportunities.§ §How to apply:§ §To view our detailed position descriptions please copy and paste the below link in your web browser. § Part of New Zealand’s largest listed company, Fletcher Building, we employ more than 2,100 people in over 60 locations across the country and stock more than 100,000 product lines from concrete to paint and plasterboard.§§PlaceMakers continuously strives to be the best building partner in the market and takes pride in providing the highest level of service to our customers. Our motto is that no one is easier to do business with. In line with this, we want to deliver our projects in an efficient manner that exceeds the expectations of our customers. To support the growing demand in the business, PlaceMakers Frame & Truss Dunedin is looking to take on another experienced Detailer to join our high-performing team.§§About the Role:§§This role will involve interpretation of architectural plans and producing detailed drawings. You will also be developing a cohesive and successful team, training your team members demonstrating your technical expertise and leading by example. This role is centered on customer service, with a high level of exposure to internal and external customers. This is ideal for someone with proven history of innovation and solution-based experience and is looking for the next opportunity to develop your career.§§About You:§§To be a successful applicant, you must have a minimum of two years’ experience in detailing and you must have a strong ability to read and interpret plans, quantify trusses, frames, and other components involved. §§Other skills and experience required:§§• You will need to be well organised to be able to juggle a number of tasks at any one time§• You will be service-driven and solution-oriented to ensure tasks are completed efficiently§• You will have strong work ethic and have the ability to work autonomously§• You will have strong communication skills to effectively communicate plans and progress§• You will have high attention to detail maintaining a good level of accuracy in your work§• You must be systems savvy ideally with the previous experience in MiTek 301§§What’s in it for you?§§This role will see you working for a variety of projects expanding your portfolio. At Warren and Mahoney, we are vitally interested in the power of identity. In our work, we aim to reflect and strengthen communities through authentic and enduring design.  Please visit our website www.warrenandmahoney.com to find out more about us.§   § We are seeking our next Principal or Associate Principal to help further develop our leading residential team in New Zealand, with a particular focus on innovative and integrated housing projects in Auckland.  Working with the current leadership team, you will assist in shaping the future of the practice by taking a leadership role in the Group’s multi-residential sector team. §   § Our next leader will be an expert communicator, strategist and designer, with a passion for understanding local cultural contexts, and translating them into spaces that connect people to create a sense of belonging and wellbeing. We have an agile, vibrant and social work environment, with an open and collaborative approach across all studios creating a ‘one studio’ culture.  Our people are valued for their contribution to the success of the practice and individual career development is an important aspect of this success. jobText: TXT/50880988.txt	§Project Lead Architect§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Project Lead Architect§§Advertiser: §Maynard Marks§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§4 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§Who are we?§ §Maynard Marks is a New Zealand owned and operated award-winning, specialist Building Consultancy that is recognised as a leader in its fields of work.  As a technical professional services consultancy, we have been assisting our clients for over twelve years and have offices in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch.  Our team of experts includes Architects, Building Surveyors, Quantity Surveyors, Asbestos Assessors, Project Managers and Structural Engineers.  Our industry leading experts provide technical advice on building and property matters to every sector of business across New Zealand.  § §Due to our consultancy’s continued growth we now have an exciting opportunity in our NZIA practice for an experienced Project Lead Architect to join our dynamic design and detail-focused architectural team.§ §Your new opportunity§ §We are seeking an ambitious, talented, and experienced Architect with a strong technical focus to lead projects through all design phases including on-site phases of projects.§ §Your work will involve leading project teams, liaising with clients, contractors and consultants, and resolving complex construction details and specifications. This role also supports our Architectural Practice Leaders where you will play a pivotal role in  developing rising talent and promoting Architectural excellence by example.§ §The successful candidate will possess:§ § §10+ years relevant experience in the New Zealand market.§ §A proven track record to successfully run multiple projects and teams.§ §Comprehensive technical knowledge of NZ construction, relevant legislation, and codes of practice.§ §An in depth understanding of quality assurance processes, risk analysis and mitigation strategies.§ §Ability to motivate project teams to exceed KPI's and fee target goals.§ §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a clear focus on client needs, working with integrity and delivering quality on every project.§ §Ability to develop new business and coordinate proposals and tender submissions.§ §What can we offer you?§ §A competitive remuneration package, a clear career progression path, numerous training and professional development opportunities, plus the chance to work for an award-winning consultancy with an excellent market reputation. The successful candidate would be joining a diverse and supportive working environment with an active social event calendar and multiple opportunities to engage in company wide activities.§ §If you would like to apply for this exciting role, please submit your CV, portfolio and selected technical drawings (no greater than 5MB) to: HR@maynardmarks.co.nz § § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a project architect?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§Have you completed a qualification in architecture?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§
