We love where we live. That's why we work so hard to look after our region and the people who live and work in the Waikato region. Customers sit at the heart of everything we do, and all staff have an important role to play in the delivery of exceptional customer service. Our work is as diverse as the region we care for; from the tip of the Coromandel Peninsula to the slopes of Ruapehu. We've got ambitious goals and there are some tricky issues, but that's what makes it so interesting.§        §We're looking for a Senior Graphic Designer to join our vibrant and busy Digital team. This role has primary responsibility for delivering a professional and creative digital design service to the council.§        §As the senior designer, you will manage the design workflow and mentor our two designers in their day to day work. You will have advanced skills with the Adobe Creative Suite, and be familiar with design thinking concepts and practices. You'll also have a natural flair for photography and be competent with all aspects of videography.§        §You will have a degree level tertiary qualification in graphic design, with at least 5 years' experience in providing professional graphic design services in an agency or large organisation.§        §We're looking for someone with exceptional communication and organisation skills, and a professional, friendly manner. A sense of humour is essential! You'll have a demonstrated ability to manage multiple projects and customers, and be able to perform well in a fast-paced, deadline-driven environment.§        §We want to see examples of your work, particularly where you have translated a complicated concept into an accessible and engaging design, producing multiple options and iterations in the process. Please provide a link to your digital portfolio with your job application§.§        §Looking for flexible ways of working options, at Waikato Regional Council we are committed to working more creatively to 'get work done' in a way that is of mutual benefit to you, the organisation and our communities.§        §Check out some of the awesome people we work with and apply online via §waikatoregion.govt.nz§/careers§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§We want more good people to come and do great things with us. You will have the opportunity to work on a variety of projects including comprehensive residential and commercial development, urban expansion and regeneration, or sensitive rural and coastal development.  You will learn about the wider aspects of the consenting business in the rapidly growing NorthWest Auckland area and provide professional written and verbal advice to our customers ensuring applicants and affected parties are aware of their rights and responsibilities.  §        §As an Intermediate Planner, you’ll apply your planning expertise to the assessment of resource consent applications against relevant statutory requirements, such as the Auckland Unitary Plan and the Resource Management Act, and make recommendations that foster positive environmental outcomes. You will also attend Council hearings as a reporting officer and represent Council as an expert witness in environment court and other courts. §        §You will provide accurate professional advice, both verbally and in writing to applicants and the public, to ensure applicants and affected parties are aware of their rights and responsibilities while increasing their understanding of planning processes and regulatory controls.§ §        §He kōrero mōu: About you§        §You’ll bring with you around two to five years’ planning experience under your belt. You have a tertiary qualification in urban planning, resource management or in a similar field acknowledged by NZPI. With strong working knowledge of the Resource Management Act 1991, you’ll have a high level of customer service skills with excellent case management and both written and verbal communication skills. As this role may require you to occasionally travel around the region using Council vehicles, you’ll also ideally hold a full, clean New Zealand driver’s licence. §        §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§        §There are endless opportunities to develop your career in planning across the Council group; this position will expose you to a range of specialisations and potential job trajectories. Our Resource Consents Department processes more than 17,000 consents annually and facilitates a wide range of development projects, from major subdivisions and nationally significant infrastructure projects to houses, apartment buildings and shopping centres. The opportunities are diverse like no other planning job.§        §We offer flexible working arrangements and a competitive salary.  You’ll be joining a team of dedicated and respected experts working collaboratively across the region to contribute to Auckland’s growth and development. We are committed to diversity, and have a culture built on trust and valuing individual as well as collective contributions.§        §If you’re passionate about building a brighter future for Auckland like we are, then apply today!§        §Applications will close on Thursday, 26 November 2020§. Please note we will be considering applications as they are received, so we recommend you apply as soon as possible. For more information about this opportunity, please contact Enna Cecilio on 021 223 2212.§        §Auckland Council is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and we are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you have any support or access requirements, we encourage you to advise us at the time of application to assist you through the recruitment process.§        § §      §      §      §    §    §  §§§•    Fixed Term 12 months, Orewa or Henderson based§•    Work on some of most high-profile developments in New Zealand§•    Excellent range of development and training options offered§ §He angitūtanga: The opportunity§Join our expanding Resource Consents Department. With strong working knowledge of the Resource Management Act 1991, you’ll have a high level of customer service skills with excellent case management and both written and verbal communication skills. As this role may require you to occasionally travel around the region using Council vehicles, you’ll also ideally hold a full, clean New Zealand driver’s licence. §Ngā āhuatanga kei a mātou: What we offer§There are endless opportunities to develop your career in planning across the Council group; this position will expose you to a range of specialisations and potential job trajectories. Our Resource Consents Department processes more than 17,000 consents annually and facilitates a wide range of development projects, from major subdivisions and nationally significant infrastructure projects to houses, apartment buildings and shopping centres. jobText: TXT/50933717.txt	§Senior Consents Planner§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Consents Planner§§Advertiser: §Rotorua Lakes Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§12 Nov 2020§§Location§§Bay of Plenty§, §Rotorua§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §Senior Consents Planner §    §    §      §        §          §2 Positions Available§          §Looking for a fresh start in the New Year? This is an exciting opportunity to be part of an innovative team who are committed to working with industry and the community to achieve great outcomes.   Due to the physical, biological and cultural diversity of Rotorua and the mix of rural, urban, forest and lakes issues, planning in our district encompasses a range of environmental challenges unparalleled in New Zealand.§          §We are looking for two experienced Senior Consents Planners to join our busy Planning and Development Solutions Team with the option to commence this year or Jan/Feb 2021. This team includes planners, builders and business support staff who work together to provide an integrated service for our community.  §          §We require a capable, quick thinking person who recognises the need for quality outcomes and has a commitment to outstanding customer service.   We are looking for a confident team player with excellent communication skills and well developed decision making abilities to interact with customers and consultants.  You will have the ability to organise workloads, determine priorities, and work to deadlines.  This role will assist with running the team and mentoring staff so you will be able to think on your feet and be skilled at getting the best from those you lead.§          §As part of a dynamic team undertaking the administration and implementation of the District Plan, your reporting will feed into the future development of our district.  A qualification in the planning or environmental management field is essential, as is eligibility for professional New Zealand Planning Institute Membership.  §          §Te Kaunihera o ngā Roto o Rotorua (Rotorua Lakes Council) is committed to working in partnership with Te Arawa, our local iwi.  We aspire to being a bicultural organisation and we value staff who speak te reo Māori, have an appreciation of Māori values, and a working knowledge of tikanga Māori.§          §This is a fantastic opportunity to take your career to a new level and work in a city with unrivalled recreation opportunities. If you think you have the experience and passion for this role, we'd love to hear from you. We intend on appointing the successful candidate December for a January/February 2021 start.§          §Applications close Wednesday 2 December 2020§        §      §    §    §    §    §  §§§2 Positions Available§ §Looking for a fresh start in the New Year? This is an exciting opportunity to be part of an innovative team who are committed to working with industry and the community to achieve great outcomes.   Due to the physical, biological and cultural diversity of Rotorua and the mix of rural, urban, forest and lakes issues, planning in our district encompasses a range of environmental challenges unparalleled in New Zealand.§ §We are looking for two experienced Senior Consents Planners to join our busy Planning and Development Solutions Team with the option to commence this year or Jan/Feb 2021. This team includes planners, builders and business support staff who work together to provide an integrated service for our community.  § §We require a capable, quick thinking person who recognises the need for quality outcomes and has a commitment to outstanding customer service.   We are looking for a confident team player with excellent communication skills and well developed decision making abilities to interact with customers and consultants.  You will have the ability to organise workloads, determine priorities, and work to deadlines.  This role will assist with running the team and mentoring staff so you will be able to think on your feet and be skilled at getting the best from those you lead.§ §As part of a dynamic team undertaking the administration and implementation of the District Plan, your reporting will feed into the future development of our district.  A qualification in the planning or environmental management field is essential, as is eligibility for professional New Zealand Planning Institute Membership.  § §Te Kaunihera o ngā Roto o Rotorua (Rotorua Lakes Council) is committed to working in partnership with Te Arawa, our local iwi.  We aspire to being a bicultural organisation and we value staff who speak te reo Māori, have an appreciation of Māori values, and a working knowledge of tikanga Māori.§ §This is a fantastic opportunity to take your career to a new level and work in a city with unrivalled recreation opportunities. If you think you have the experience and passion for this role, we'd love to hear from you. We intend on appointing the successful candidate December for a January/February 2021 start.§ §Applications close Wednesday 2 December 2020§§§§

Our modular applications for managing export operations include export documentation, compliance, risk management, track and trace, trade finance and international payments.§  §Headquartered in New Zealand, we’re globally focused with offices in Auckland, Christchurch, Melbourne, and Singapore. We’re growing fast and looking for highly skilled, motivated, and resourceful people to join our team.§  §We are recruiting and looking for the smartest and creative candidates to join our company and help us solve advanced problems.§  §https://www.tradewindow.io/§  §About the Role§  §We are looking for a dynamic UI/UX Designer or Graphic Designer with UI/UX experience to join our team building the user interface (UI) design of our web site and various digital assets. You will ensure that all elements of the online user experience are optimised for improved usability, usefulness, and exceptional visual design.§  §The Basic Stuff:§ § §3 years+ of proven work experience as a UI Designer/UX Designer/Graphic Designer / Developer.§ §Portfolio of design projects, across web and mobile.§ §Knowledge of wireframe tools (e.g. Wireframe.cc and InVision).§ §Up-to-date knowledge of design software like Adobe Illustrator and Photoshop.§ §Knowledge of Gatsby or similar§ §Team spirit; To do so we need to ensure we continue to provide a quality product/service to our internal staff and external stakeholders.§ § § § §About the role§ § §The Training Material Developer will work in collaboration with IMPAC's training team to develop new innovative and market leading health and safety training material. This includes the development and design of learning and instructor resources for multiple delivery methods including face to face, eLearning, and blended learning.§ §This role is for a fixed term period of six months that could be extended to twelve months for the correct candidate. We believe this role may be suitable for a graduate wanting a fantastic opportunity to consolidate their skills in a supportive and dynamic environment.§ §This role will work closely and collaboratively with the in-house Subject Matter Expert and established Training Coordination, Development and Design Lead as a small, focused team.§ § § §Responsibilities and daily tasks will include:§ § §Developing graphic design aspects of course material to support learning outcomes though use of InDesign§ § §Producing layouts, templates, graphics, animations, editing video clips§ § §Pitching creative concepts§ § §Working in collaboration and consultation with the IMPAC team and key internal stakeholders to create or redesign products and resources§ § §Working in collaboration with the IMPAC team to produce quality, finished products and training resources within allocated time frames§ § § § § §Skills and experience§ § §The ideal candidate will have:§ § §Some experience with the Adobe creative cloud, specifically InDesign and Photoshop§ § §Strong creative thinking and innovation ability§ § §Strong communicator§ § §Graphic Design qualification or similar§ § §Strong time management skills and the ability to work to tight deadlines§ § §Ability to work alone or as part of a team§ § § § §Please note applications for this role will close on the 27th November 2020. We will consider applications as they are received.§ §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as a developer?§How much notice are you required to give your current employer?§§§

jobText: TXT/50943756.txt	§Graphic Designer & Marketing Coordinator§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graphic Designer & Marketing Coordinator§§Advertiser: §Rubber Monkey Sales Ltd§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§13 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§Rubber Monkey is looking for an organised and social media savvy graphic designer to join our marketing team. We offer exciting audiovisual products and promotions to creatives, so you'll help us engage our customers through great design and marketing. §  §About the role§  §As the Design & Marketing Coordinator, you'll ensure Rubber Monkey’s digital marketing grabs customers’ attention and creates interest in our products. You'll do this through engaging copywriting and eye-catching design. The Design & Marketing Coordinator creates electronic direct mail (EDM) and manages the social media activities, striving for high audience engagement. §  §The Design & Marketing Coordinator works closely with the Marketing & Promotions Manager, who will manage the workload of this role, and together with the Graphic Designer, you'll help deliver marketing campaigns to a high standard.§  §On an average day you might:§ § §Prepare copywriting and design for marketing and promotional emails§ §Compile and send mailers and monitor their performance§ §Run our social media accounts to ensure up-to-date content and prompt replies to customers§ §Prepare copy and imagery for social media and post regularly to Instagram and Facebook to increase engagement and drive traffic and sales§ §Design social media strategies to achieve business targets, monitoring and adapting these strategies based on results§ §Review reports and analytics tools to assess the success of marketing activities, iterating our approach based on these findings§ §Help create, run and monitor competitions to ensure high engagement from customers§ §Establish best practices in digital marketing at Rubber Monkey by staying up-to-date with industry developments and implementing new processes and tools in the marketing space§ §Be an advocate for design across all promotional and marketing activities at Rubber Monkey to ensure our brand is consistent and our campaigns are cohesive across platforms§ §Work with management on website design tasks as required, such as web page layout, navigational elements and assistance with typography or graphics§ §Prepare print material as required, such as business cards and signage.§ §This role is 37.5 hours per week Monday to Friday (either 8am - 4pm or 8.30am - 4.30pm). Work will be conducted at our head office on Adelaide Road.§  §About you§  §We're looking for a graphic designer with a minimum of two years experience in a marketing or similar environment. Someone who is used to managing multiple tasks and can change focus quickly, as well as take direction well, would be ideal. You will also need an understanding of social media platforms and practices.§  §To be successful in this role, you will also have the following:§ § §Ability to work independently and display initiative§ §Have a creative and innovative mindset§ §A willingness to learn and stay up-to-date on the audiovisual industry§ §Confident communicator§ §Great attention to detail§ §Familiarity with using Adobe design tools§ §Experience with Mailchimp preferred.§ §Knowledge of or interest in audiovisual equipment would be an advantage but as long as you have the right attitude and skills, we'd love to hear from you.§  §About Rubber Monkey§  §Rubber Monkey is New Zealand's premier provider of professional audio, video and photography technology products to commercial, government, education and creative industries. §  §Our goal is to shatter the idea that because New Zealand has a small population, we should pay more and get less. We are driven to compete with global pricing and provide our customers with the fastest delivery we can.§  §We are a locally owned and operated company based on Adelaide Road.§  §How to apply§  §If this role sounds like you, click ‘Apply for this job’ and submit a copy of your CV and a cover letter stating why you think you'd be a great fit. Please also attach or include a link to your portfolio or examples of relevant work.§  §For more information about this role, please email jimmy@rubbermonkey.co.nz. Please do not send applications to this address.§  §We'll be reviewing applications as they come in so apply today.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years of graphic design experience do you have?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

jobText: TXT/50931004.txt	§Senior Architectural Technician - Auckland§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Architectural Technician - Auckland§§Advertiser: §Maynard Marks§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§11 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§Maynard Marks§ §Who are we?§ §Maynard Marks is a New Zealand owned and operated award-winning, specialist Building Consultancy that is recognised as a leader in its fields of work.  As a technical professional services consultancy, we have been assisting our clients for over twelve years and have offices in Auckland, Wellington and Christchurch.  Our team of experts includes Architects, Building Surveyors, Quantity Surveyors, Asbestos Assessors, Project Managers and Structural Engineers.  Our industry leading experts provide technical advice on building and property matters to every sector of business across New Zealand.  § §Due to our consultancy’s continued growth we now have an exciting opportunity in our NZIA practice for an experienced Senior Architectural Technician to join our dynamic design and detail-focused architectural team.§ §Your new opportunity§ §We are seeking an ambitious, talented, and experienced senior technician. You will be responsible for producing highly resolved detailed design documentation including the resolution of complex construction details, liaising with contractors, consultants and suppliers, and ensuring our high standards and efficient production of architectural documentation is maintained.  The role will involve working with a lead designer and mentoring junior members of the team.  You will be involved in all stages of a project including on-site attendance.§ §The successful candidate will possess:§ § §10+ years relevant experience in the New Zealand market.§ §A proven track record on multiple projects.§ §Comprehensive technical knowledge of NZ construction, relevant legislation, and codes of practice.§ §Project experience of multi-unit residential buildings above 10m in height.§ §An in depth understanding of quality assurance processes, risk analysis and mitigation strategies.§ §Expert level knowledge of ArchiCAD.§ §Excellent interpersonal and communication skills, with a clear focus on client needs, working with integrity and delivering quality on every project.§ §What can we offer you?§ §A competitive remuneration package, a clear career progression path, numerous training and professional development opportunities, plus the chance to work for an award-winning consultancy with an excellent market reputation. The successful candidate would be joining a diverse and supportive working environment with an active social event calendar and multiple opportunities to engage in company wide activities.§ §If you would like to apply for this exciting role, please submit your CV, portfolio and selected technical drawings (no greater than 5MB) to: §HR@maynardmarks.co.nz§.§§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§How many years' experience do you have as an architectural technician?§Which of the following CAD software do you have experience with?§How many years' experience do you have in the construction industry?§What's your expected annual base salary?§§§

technician to work in our Manukau office to service our growing clientele in South Auckland.§        §We need someone who can:§        §          §Provide advice to clients about options for development of their site – including the production of innovative concepts that meet our clients’ aspirations,§          §Complete plans, elevations, and renders for resource consent applications,§ design process, including the production of detailed documentation for a wide range of projects, including the engagement and co-ordination of consultants,§          §Prioritise work streams and meet project timelines,§          §Bring a positive ‘can-do’ attitude to every project.§        §        §We expect the successful applicant will have:§        §          §An appropriate architecture or With skills, planning and purposeful action, our people are creating the homes and neighbourhoods that will build Aotearoa's future. We are passionate about transforming New Zealand for the better. That includes being a trusted partner for Māori and iwi, protecting and enabling their rights, interests and aspirations under the guidance of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§        §Ko tā mātou mahi - Our Role§        §As part of our exciting growth we are now looking to appoint a §Manager Specified Development Projects§ to establish and oversee Specified Development Projects provided for under the Urban Development Act 2020§.§        §Some of your key areas of responsibility in this newly created role will include:§        §          §Leading the process for a specified development project to be proposed, assessed, established and delivered, drawing on a wide range of support functions from across Kāinga Ora and working with other key agencies and stakeholders§          §Building the new specified development project team to ensure the functions and powers enabled by the Urban Development Act are performed in an effective and timely manner§          §Developing and managing relationships with the key partner agencies that are involved in the statutory specified development project process e.g. Ministry of Housing and Urban Development, Department of Conservation, Te Arawhiti, and Treasury§          §Ensuring that effective working relationships are formed with Specified Development Project proposers, partners and key stakeholders e.g. developers, local authorities, iwi, and infrastructure providers§          §Be the first point of contact for Kāinga Ora's functions under the Urban Development Act, including ensuring the provisions of the Urban Development Act are well-understood and that information about how to access these provisions is widely accessible§          §Seeking to empower decision-making by those best placed, and most qualified, to make the decisions, and create a safe learning environment to improve decision-making.§        §        §Ngā pūmanawatanga ōu - What you will bring§        §If you are a senior planning professional with experience in establishing a new resource management or planning function, this could be an exciting next step for you. As our ideal candidate, in addition to your planning degree you will bring:§        §          §In-depth demonstrated technical and strategic planning skills§          §Experience working in a multi-faceted and demanding environment§          §Demonstrated commitment to relationship building and working in partnership with key internal and external stakeholders§          §Experience and ability to work in a regulatory environment where quality processes and record keeping are important§          §The ability to take considered risk, make prompt and clear decisions and show initiative, taking responsibility for actions, even when things are unclear§          §Interest in public sector structure, governance, processes and systems§          §A collaborative, considered and sensitive approach.§        §        §Nōu te rourou - What's in it for you?§        §We offer competitive salaries, five weeks' annual leave and a benefits package including a range of insurances, flexible working arrangements and career development. These benefits are described in more detail here https://careers.kaingaora.govt.nz/a-great-place-to-work/benefits.§        §As a Kāinga Ora - Homes and Communities employee, we want to make sure that you have all the tools and support you need. We want to ensure you are healthy and have work-life balance. We also want to support and grow your personal and career development through on-the-job learning, training courses, secondments and study opportunities.§        §Ō Tātou Uara - Our Values§        §Our values were developed by us, for us. They unite us as an organisation and guide how we work every day. jobText: TXT/50952452.txt	§Lead Digital Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Lead Digital Designer§§Advertiser: §ANTIPODES NZ LIMITED§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§15 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§Overview & Role §Antipodes is leading the way globally in natural and organic skincare with scientific validation to prove its skin-enhancing effects. Founded fifteen years ago, our premium beauty brand features bioactive ingredients from New Zealand nature. Sold in 40+ countries, Antipodes is a fast growth, global brand based in our architectural award winning heritage building in Wellington. Privately owned and operated, founder and CEO Elizabeth Barbalich is closely involved in design concepts and has a clear creative vision for the brand.§ §With a strong entrepreneurial spirit the company is seeking a talented and highly organised individual to help elevate and enhance the founders vision in an online forum. The candidate will require a strong understanding of the brand ethos, position in the market and future growth potential. Antipodes is receiving accolades and  PR placement every month from media such as Vogue France, Harpers bazaar China. Talter UK and People magazine USA; and this provides us with an exciting opportunity to elevate the brand and secure our brand position through our global online / ecommerce channels.§ §The Lead digital designer is a hands on tools role, responsible for enhancing and executing Antipodes brand design assets and content across digital channels, with e-retail as main focus. With a mobile first approach, this role will involve implementing best practice global design principles and ensuring strong consistency across our messaging and platforms. A senior member of the design team, this role will cover elements of digital design particularly around typography as graphics and integrating this into our ecommerce platforms.  A fast paced, dynamic role which leads a small team to deliver Vogue style pages (utilising existing and new material) to all of our digital platforms§ §Key Responsibilities & Expected Deliverables§ §Leadership and team direction§Current platforms include e-retail pure players; e-retail Omni channel; Instagram, facebook  D2C sites; Pinterest. The brand currently has strong output of content and design, which would be re-proposed for online platforms.§ § §Lead by example/ execution digital design team (3.5)§ §Own, implement and direct and lead team through specific digital projects (legend)§ §Ensure consistency of digital design style across all platforms§ §Deliver next level e-retail design and re-purposed elements for social channels§ §Ensure team is producing content that has clear and measurable pathway to consumer§ §Design & creative via a UX approach§ § §Ability to take Antipodes brand assets and existing creative and convert to mobile first design§ §Strong applied design knowledge of UX on sites§ §Ability to enhance founder strong creative vision§ §Lift brand presence on e-retail through typographic elements and typographic applied for design form§ §Customer journey§ § §Liaison directly with major e-retail partners to ensure clear understanding of Customer Journey and how this fits with the platforms USP, and platform functionality§ §Strong knowledge of shopping platforms and how this translates into design options§ §Work closely with SEO/ SEM specialist to understand and produce targeted adds, social adds for increasing sales- often with limited notice§ §E-retail platforms§ § §Quarterly planning for updates that can be efficiently rolled out across all global platforms§ §Ownership and ongoing management of improving the design and layout – for new and existing sites§ §Onboarding best practice elements for emerging  pure player e-retail partners, such as: Douglas Germany, Zalando Germany§ §Consistently evaluate, refresh and update brand hub pages within existing re-retail sites – approx 15 – this includes material layout, off location promo banners, digital add assets, etc§ §Person Specification§ § §A great attitude and ability to roll sleeves up to get the job done. This is a 'hands on tools' role.§ §At least 6 years’ proven working experience with digital design§ §Willingness to engage with International partners across time zones§ §Second language fluency in French or German or at minimum customer interfacing into European markets via previous work history (ie living in UK or EU) resulting in cultural awareness, and how this applies to fashion forward thinking in the Northern hemisphere§ §International experience + understanding of advanced online markets ie) UK, France Germany§ §Strong understanding of SEO / SEM and targeted adds§ §Desire to be /application§ §Experience leading in cross functional teams§ §Experience in design thinking principles & agile approach§ §A solid understanding of International e-retail design§ §Experience designing jobTitle: Digital Design Lead Job in Wellington - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50956445.txt	§Digital Design Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Digital Design Lead§§Advertiser: §Health Promotion Agency§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Other§§§§§§Kia hiwa rā, kia hiwa rā§ §Nau mai, haere mai, whakapiri mai!§ §Kia koutou ngā rangatira mā§ §Kia kaha, Kia māia ki te tono mō enei nohonga ki ā Te Hiringa Hauora§ §We welcome you, come closer.§ §Come closer to hear the words of encouragement and urge you all to apply for the positions on offer at Te Hiringa Hauora.§ §Ko te kaupapa | About the role § §Our mahi is varied and carried out with passion for the health and wellbeing of ngā tangata o Aotearoa. We are looking for someone who is inspired by our mission of the unrelenting pursuit of wellbeing, has skills and experience in the digital design space, and the passion and motivation to enrich our organisation.§ §Our organisation has grown and developed substantially over the past year, and to support that, a new Digital Design Lead role has been created to support the Digital team with the design process of our digital assets for our public facing websites and campaigns. The successful applicant can expect to:§ § §lead the development of design-based thinking, innovative and experimental approaches to product and service solutions, and business change§ §manage and coordinate external design and development partners§ §lead the information architecture design, interaction design, and usability testing within the development team§ §ownership of maintaining our UX and UI guidelines to ensure that our digital assets meet government and web accessibility standards§ §identify opportunities, risks and advice to ensure effective delivery of our digital roadmap§ §support the Digital Product Manager to allocate resources to build team capability and knowledge§ §develop plans that will make a significant difference for Māori and Pasifika.  § §We are an organisation that prides itself on providing flexible working options to our staff where possible. If the location, hours, or other conditions of this advert don’t suit your requirements, please ensure you apply and talk to us about what can work for you. We do our best to work with staff to offer opportunities to make things work for them, and for us.§ §Nga taonga kei roto I tou kete matauranga | What you bring § §As an experienced digital designer, you will have a relevant tertiary qualification and/or extensive and comparable relevant experience. You will have excellent communication, collaboration and proven problem solving skills, experience working at both a detailed and strategic level to champion content and customer experience is crucial and a strong understanding of product design and the development process in an agile environment will allow you to be successful in this role.§ §Ko wai mātou | Who we are§ §Te Hiringa Hauora/Health Promotion Agency leads and delivers innovative and high quality national health promotion initiatives. Te Hiringa Hauora is a Crown entity that works with partners including iwi/Māori, health professionals, researchers and academics, community groups, public health advocates, and others who are aligned to our goals.§ §Te Hiringa Hauora acknowledges the special relationship between iwi Māori and the Crown under Te Tiriti o Waitangi, and is committed to recognise and respect the articles of Te Tiriti. Te Hiringa Hauora encourages and supports staff to learn and enjoy te reo, waiata and increase knowledge of Te Ao Māori.§ §Me pēwhea te tono | How to apply§ §TO APPLY FOR THIS ROLE§ and for an application form please go to the vacancies page on our website www.hpa.org.nz. Please send the completed Te Hiringa Hauora application form, CV and covering letter to §vacancies@hpa.org.nz§ §Applications close 29 November 2020. For further information, phone Andy Ellis on §04 912 0320§. Please note, Te Hiringa Hauora is a smoke free organisation. All applicants should be currently eligible to work in New Zealand.§ §Please note, the job description for this role is currently being amended, it will be uploaded to the advert once it is completed.§§§§

We take enormous pride in our work and we are looking for a graphic designer that wants to do the same. Legend is constantly evolving and always looking for new opportunities to improve our services or skills and we really value our team members. jobText: TXT/50970696.txt	§Design Manager§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Design Manager§§Advertiser: §Naylor Love§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§§§§  §    §Design Manager §    §      §        §          §Industry leader§          §Competitive remuneration package§          §Strong and collaborative team culture§        §        §Naylor Love is one of New Zealand's largest national construction companies and has over 100 years of experience in high quality commercial construction. We pride ourselves on our reputation for long standing customer relationships, high levels of staff engagement, delivery of high-quality smart build solutions and a capability that enables us to deliver on a broad range of client expectations.§        §The Opportunity§        §This role will see the successful applicant develop and deliver the design and build aspect of our business. Working up front and alongside clients and design teams in a collaborative environment where we are providing invaluable advice and direction from the conceptual design stage through to design completion.§        §You will need to be passionate and driven to continue to drive Naylor Love to the forefront of construction diversification. The key responsibilities can be defined as:§        §          §Providing indirect support to our established design resource within current project teams.§          §Establishing and maintaining collaborative relationships with clients, design partners and professional consultants.§          §Supporting the pursuit of projects in preconstruction with integral design input to buildability issues.§          §Have the ability to lead, grow and develop a team that can meet the demands of our business and the strategy of the Design Management business plan.§          §Have the drive and passion for innovation and keeping abreast of all new technology and implementing that technology where there is added benefit.§        §        §The successful candidate will be of high calibre and is expected to hold the relevant tertiary qualification, such as a BEng, BAch or similar. The key attributes of the successful applicant would include:§        §          §Broad experience in commercial construction, design and project management.§          §Proficient in BIM or have a clear understanding of its capability.§          §Experience in green star buildings and use of engineered wood products would be an advantage§          §A clear communicator with strong leadership skills.§          §Able to give sound commercial advice in design and buildability alternatives.§          §Be contractually astute and have the skill set to develop a design teams' scope of services in design & build projects.§        §        § §        §Why Work for Us§        §At Naylor Love we understand work isn't only about who you work for; it's also about what you do and your experiences. When you join Naylor Love you will understand the strength of our values and that ‘Our People are our Brand' and this is shaped by our employees having ownership of what they do.§        §We offer you a challenging career in a positive and inclusive team working environment as well as the safeguard of a generous company health scheme and wellbeing programme.§        §The successful applicant will be required to complete a pre-employment medical questionnaire including drug screening and be eligible to work in New Zealand either as a resident or by holding a current work visa.§        §Naylor Love is an equal opportunities employer and committed to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion across all areas of our business.§        §To apply for this job go to: naylorlovecareers.co.nz/Vacancies and enter ref code: 5284580. Applications close 18 December 2020§      §      §    §    §    §  §§§ §Industry leader§ §Competitive remuneration package§ §Strong and collaborative team culture§ §Naylor Love is one of New Zealand's largest national construction companies and has over 100 years of experience in high quality commercial construction. jobText: TXT/50963369.txt	§Architectural Studies Lecturers OR Senior Lecturers §§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Architectural Studies Lecturers OR Senior Lecturers §§Advertiser: §Otago Polytechnic§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Nov 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Dunedin§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Interior Design§§§§§§College of Creative Practice and Enterprise§Full-time and part-time, permanent and fixed-term opportunities§Tēnā koutou katoa§We seek educators/practitioners in the fields of architectural technologies and/or interior architecture to contribute to the delivery of the Bachelor of Architectural Studies. §These academic positions call for experienced architectural educators with recent or current commercial experience. The Bachelor of Architectural Studies is based on an integrated delivery of architectural design, interior architecture, architectural history, construction, building science and technologies taught in a studio-based learning environment and delivered within a framework of ecological responsibility. §The successful applicant will have experience in at least one of the key delivery areas and have relevant industry/professional affiliations along with a relevant qualification in architecture/interior architecture or the equivalent in a related field. §The level of appointment offered will be based on the skills, experience and qualification of the successful candidates.  To be appointed as a Senior Lecturer you will hold at least a Level 7 tertiary teaching qualification  §Positions available are part and full-time,  fixed term and permanent depending on the aspirations of the successful candidate.   Please state in your cover letter your preference.§Proposed start date of 1 February 2021. §For a position description and to apply please click on the link §For specific information contact Caroline Terpstra ph 021 735 489, §caroline.terpstra@op.ac.nz§Applications close 5pm, Monday 30 November 2020.§For a copy of the Job Description visit §BAS-Lecturer---Snr-Lecturer-PD-2020.pdf§§§§

jobTitle: Placemaking Advisor - Lakeside Te Kauwhata Job in Waikato - SEEK
jobText: TXT/50965513.txt	§Placemaking Advisor - Lakeside Te Kauwhata§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Placemaking Advisor - Lakeside Te Kauwhata§§Advertiser: §Kainga Ora§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§17 Nov 2020§§Location§§Waikato§, §Hamilton§§Salary§§$83,025 plus 5 weeks' annual leave (pro-rata)§§Work Type§§Part Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Placemaking Advisor - Lakeside Te Kauwhata §      §        §          §Newly created position driving placemaking community programmes in Te Kauwhata§          §Flexible working, Hamilton and Te Kauwhata based, 25 hours per week§          §$83,025 plus 5 weeks' annual leave (pro-rata)§        §        §Mō mātou - Our Organisation§        §At Kāinga Ora, ours is the important responsibility of transforming New Zealand's housing choices, outcomes and the entire housing sector by creating homes and communities that allow New Zealanders to thrive.§        §What is exciting about working for Kāinga Ora is getting the chance to make a real and positive impact on New Zealanders' lives. With skills, planning and purposeful action, our people are creating the homes and neighbourhoods that will build Aotearoa's future. We are passionate about transforming New Zealand for the better. That includes being a trusted partner for Māori and iwi, protecting and enabling their rights, interests and aspirations under the guidance of Te Tiriti o Waitangi.§        §Ko tā mātou mahi - Our Role§        §As part of our exciting growth we are now looking to welcome a Placemaking Advisor to support the development and implementation of Kāinga Ora's placemaking community programmes and activationsin Te Kauwhata.§        §The Placemaking Advisor - Te Kauwhata will work closely with the project teams, community development and engagement team, local community groups and stakeholders to support new and existing initiatives aimed at strengthening people's connection to place, supporting a strong sense of place and identity, and embedding placemaking activities and initiatives in Kāinga Ora's projects.§        §As the development grows, the Placemaking Advisor - Te Kauwhata will lead and coordinate a series of placemaking initiatives from conception to completion, and ensure that the masterplanning and delivery processes are appropriate and strongly informed by the community.§        §Ngā pūmanawatanga ōu - What you will bring§        §In adding to your relevant tertiary qualification and experience working with communities to achieve sustainable placemaking outcomes, you will bring:§        §          §Relevant experience in residential development sector§          §A proven record in establishing and maintaining effective working relationships with individuals, groups and peers - jobText: TXT/50955785.txt	§Graduate City Design & Place Planning§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graduate City Design & Place Planning§§Advertiser: §Wellington City Council§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§Start your career as a Graduate at the Wellington City Council.§We have an outstanding opportunity for a recent graduate to come on board with Wellington City Council's City Design and Place Planning team.§You will have a structured programme of learning and development plus receive on-going support including the allocation of a consistent line manager and host managers for each of your placements; you will also be assigned a sponsor, who will be a director from the Executive Leadership Team.§Wellington is growing significantly. By 2050 our city will have grown by at least 50,000 inhabitants, with a projected total population of up to 280,000. To accommodate all of these new Wellingtonians we need to develop our city. In early 2019 we asked Wellingtonians how we should accommodate this growth. The results of this Our City Tomorrow engagement set a clear direction for increasing density in our central area and suburbs, but not at the detriment to environmental or social well-being. Wellington's development and growth should be compact, inclusive, connected, greener, resilient, vibrant and prosperous.§The purpose of the City Design and Place Planning business unit, where you will be placed, is to support the Council in planning for this anticipated growth to create great places for people and unlock the city's potential through collaborative design-led processes. Our two-year Graduate Programme will provide you with accelerated learning and development via rotations through the four main areas of City Design and Place Planning;§Urban Design§Heritage§Place Planning§Transport Planning§The two-year programme will have a strong focus on Urban Design with projects of all sizes and shapes located throughout Wellington. You will have opportunities to help deliver some of Wellington's strategic urban transformation projects, smaller public space upgrades and everything in-between.§We are passionate about projects that enhance mana whenua presence, visibility and participation in the experience and design of our built and natural environments.§As part of our team, you will…§be encouraged to contribute to the organisation beyond project work through open and honest communication§hone your technical skills on a variety of projects from concept to delivery§be supporting your team both graphically and technically§be working collaboratively with other creative disciplines including landscape architects, architects, urban designers, heritage advisors, transport engineers, project managers and planners§be getting your hands 'dirty' in research and development§be contributing to the team social culture; we believe in work life balance and having fun§About you§ §:§Your passion, design and problem-solving mindset will be matched with a desire to work on meaningful and significant projects across Wellington.§You will be a creative thinker with a knack for problem solving and innovative solutions. You will also have an enquiring mind and ability to problem solve and think laterally, with a keen eye for design, graphics and visual communication (both from a sketch and computer-aided perspective). How you work is also important to us - we will value your agility, your enthusiasm and motivation to continue to learn from your peers and more senior members of the team.§Working in local government gives you the opportunity to serve your community directly. Fully functional, efficient and effective local governments are the foundation for vibrant communities and economic opportunities. You will need to be excited about the public life of cities and committed to making a difference by creating a vibrant and prosperous, resilient, inclusive, connected and greener Wellington City.§You will have:§A qualified degree in Urban Design, Landscape Architecture and/or Architecture.§An interest in contributing to a more sustainable future for New Zealand's built and natural environments§Critical thinking skills, and a collaborative and agile mindset§An ability to work within a team environment, as well as take initiative as a thought leader§Experience in the use of AutoCAD, SketchUp and Adobe Creative Suite§Sounds exciting? Please click the apply button to submit an application. All applications must be submitted online. If you have any questions or require further information please contact Gary Haddon at §gary.haddon@wcc.govt.nz§.§Applications close §30 November 2020.§§§§Right to live and work§§You must have the§ right to live and work §in this location to apply for this job.§§§

jobText: TXT/50956605.txt	§Senior Urban Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Urban Designer§§Advertiser: §Boffa Miskell Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Nov 2020§§Location§§Otago§, §Queenstown & Wanaka§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §    §      §Senior Urban Designer §      §        §We have an exciting opportunity for a passionate and talented Senior Urban Designer to join our team of consultants in Queenstown.§        §This position will see you joining an established, multidisciplinary team, who excel at what they do. Our Urban Designers deliver a broad range of exciting and noteworthy projects, covering all aspects of urban design and spatial planning. Some of our most recent local projects include Milford Opportunities Project masterplan; spatial plans for Queenstown Lakes, Central Otago (Alexandra and Clyde) and Mackenzie (Fairlie, Tekapo and Twizel) Districts; Te Kirikiri / Frankton Masterplan; and various urban design assessments for QLDC. Through our diverse and challenging range of projects, you’ll deepen your professional experience, refine your skills and make a meaningful contribution to the team, our clients, and New Zealand’s environment.§        §As a Senior Urban Designer, you’ll work collaboratively with our clients, stakeholders and multi-disciplinary project teams. You’ll be able to generate your own work and will have accountability for the overall achievement of key milestones and agreed deliverables in the projects you manage.§        §We are looking for someone with a reputation as a leading Urban Designer, who is creative, collaborative, and resilient in their approach. Our ideal candidate will have a proven track record in business development and be willing to proactively network within the Queenstown community and wider region, along with the following skills, attributes and experience:§        §          §At least ten years’ professional experience in urban design, preferably with some of those being in a consultancy environment;§          §A Master’s Degree in Urban Design and an undergraduate qualification and background in architecture, landscape architecture or planning;§          §An ability to take an integrated and holistic view of urban design, while also having a specialist expertise;§          §A portfolio of project experience that demonstrates creativity, a critical eye, the ability to problem solve and actively contribute ideas;§          §Exceptional project management skills, and a keen interest in developing and mentoring less experienced designers;§          §Strong people skills, with experience delegating work and leading others on projects and within the office environment;§          §A genuine interest and ability to engage with a wide range of partners, communities and their stakeholders;§          §Clear and well-articulated written and oral communication skills, including preparation of urban design assessments and peer reviews;§          §Skilled graphic ability and be able to use a range of digital tools and techniques. The software available to our design team includes Autodesk Suite, Sketchup, Adobe Creative Cloud and ArcGIS;§          §Professional registration within one or more core urban design disciplines.§        §        §Boffa Miskell is a leading New Zealand professional services consultancy, that is focused on better outcomes for our environment. We are entirely employee-owned and growing, with an increasingly diverse portfolio of clients and projects. We offer a supportive, flexible and collaborative working environment and value having an inclusive and diverse workplace. Our Urban Designers deliver a broad range of exciting and noteworthy projects, covering all aspects of urban design and spatial planning. Some of our most recent local projects include Milford Opportunities Project masterplan; spatial plans for Queenstown Lakes, Central Otago (Alexandra and Clyde) and Mackenzie (Fairlie, Tekapo and Twizel) Districts; Te Kirikiri / Frankton Masterplan; and various urban design assessments for QLDC. Through our diverse and challenging range of projects, you’ll deepen your professional experience, refine your skills and make a meaningful contribution to the team, our clients, and New Zealand’s environment.§ §As a Senior Urban Designer, you’ll work collaboratively with our clients, stakeholders and multi-disciplinary project teams. You’ll be able to generate your own work and will have accountability for the overall achievement of key milestones and agreed deliverables in the projects you manage.§ §We are looking for someone with a reputation as a leading Urban Designer, who is creative, collaborative, and resilient in their approach. Our ideal candidate will have a proven track record in business development and be willing to proactively network within the Queenstown community and wider region, along with the following skills, attributes and experience:§ § §At least ten years’ professional experience in urban design, preferably with some of those being in a consultancy environment;§ §A Master’s Degree in Urban Design and an undergraduate qualification and background in architecture, landscape architecture or planning;§ §An ability to take an integrated and holistic view of urban design, while also having a specialist expertise;§ §A portfolio of project experience that demonstrates creativity, a critical eye, the ability to problem solve and actively contribute ideas;§ §Exceptional project management skills, and a keen interest in developing and mentoring less experienced designers;§ §Strong people skills, with experience delegating work and leading others on projects and within the office environment;§ §A genuine interest and ability to engage with a wide range of partners, communities and their stakeholders;§ §Clear and well-articulated written and oral communication skills, including preparation of urban design assessments and peer reviews;§ §Skilled graphic ability and be able to use a range of digital tools and techniques. The software available to our design team includes Autodesk Suite, Sketchup, Adobe Creative Cloud and ArcGIS;§ §Professional registration within one or more core urban design disciplines.§ §Boffa Miskell is a leading New Zealand professional services consultancy, that is focused on better outcomes for our environment. That means our people have the choice of working from one of our Auckland or Wellington offices, or working from home anywhere in New Zealand.§ §Who we’re looking for:§ §We’re now on the lookout for an experienced Product Designer to join our team on a fixed term contract til the end of June 2021. § §Our Product Designers work collaboratively with cross-functional teams to improve existing functionality and build exciting new features. § §You’ll work through design problems from beginning to end, translating Flux's business and customer requirements into concepts, and then design the detailed workflows and interactions required to make them a reality,§ §If you’re passionate about the craft and process of building great software that’s focussed on the people using it, you’ll fit right in. § §What you’ll bring: § § §Experience designing digital products and systems, not just websites. We specialise in high speed, high quality manufacturing and design work throughout Australasia.  The company was founded 20 years ago and is fully NZ owned and operated employing 56 staff.§We design anything! Including many promotional designs for agencies and clients directly as well as interior fit outs for stores and offices. Retail fit outs and bespoke designs are a speciality.§At Three Sixty we do things a little bit differently, instead of our clients having day to day interactions with a separate Account Manager who then passes all information on to a Designer, our Designers are also our Account Managers.§This means, that all conversations we have with our clients are not only with someone who understands the brief, but it is someone who can also have on the spot discussions on how a job may be realistically designed and built.§We understand this is a unique role for anyone's experience.  A high level of self-organisation and time prioritisation are a must. You will have good attention to detail with the capacity to process a high volume of information at a fast pace. jobText: TXT/50961259.txt	§Unit Head Urban Development§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Unit Head Urban Development§§Advertiser: §Decipher Group Limited§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§16 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Contract/Temp§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Urban Design & Planning§§§§§§§§§  §    §Unit Head Urban Development §    §    §      §        §An experienced leader of urban development projects §        §Deep programme and project management capability §        §Contribute to the continued enhancement of Christchurch §      §      §        §About the organisation§ChristchurchNZ is the city’s sustainable economic development and city profile agency; the purpose of which is to stimulate sustainable economic growth for a more prosperous Christchurch. ChristchurchNZ works to a mission of igniting bold ambition for our city.§        §As part of delivering in this mission, ChristchurchNZ is working with Christchurch City Council and Development Christchurch Limited through funding and service level agreements to deliver priority urban development projects and functions through to 30 June 2021 as Development Christchurch Limited transitions from being an operational entity. In order to do this, ChristchurchNZ needs a talented and experienced Urban Development Leader to take on this pivotal role until 30 June 2021. Interested?§        §About the opportunity§With a direct reporting line to the Chief Executive of ChristchurchNZ; the Unit Head takes overall accountability for leading the delivery of the urban development activities agreed. In doing this, the Unit Head will:§        §          §Effectively lead the team of Urban Development professionals to achieve objectives.§          §Deliver services through the Urban Development Team specified in the Service Level Agreement between ChristchurchNZ and Development Christchurch including and amongst other things: §              §Delivering the New Brighton Implementation Plan – which includes facilitating investment and development into the commercial core of New Brighton.§              §Providing Development Management Services in accordance with pre-approved development management plans of four parcels of land owned by Development Christchurch.§              §Overseeing Property Management Services for Development Christchurch owned properties.§            §          §          §Contribute to the Christchurch City Council Long-Term Planning process in respect of Urban Development.§        §        §This is a key role in leading the urban development work set already in motion and requires a proactive and motivated leader who can truly hit the ground running.§        §About you§To be successful in this role, you will have extensive experience in Urban Development, ideally within both a public and private sector environment. An experienced programme and project manager in this urban development context, you will bring a strong commercial perspective to your development projects coupled with exceptional stakeholder management capability. Although a strong leader, you will be innately collaborative and will enjoy contributing to the development and execution of broader organisation-wide strategies alongside your colleagues; lending a hand and providing support as needed. Sound like you?§        §How to apply§To apply and for a copy of the position description, visit the Decipher Group website - § click here§. §        §Discover more about ChristchurchNZ, visit https://www.christchurchnz.com/ §        §For a confidential discussion about the role; contact Leanne Crozier by email to §leanne@deciphergroup.co.nz§        §Applications close: Wednesday 2 December 2020.§      §      §      §    §    §  §§§About the organisation§ChristchurchNZ is the city’s sustainable economic development and city profile agency; the purpose of which is to stimulate sustainable economic growth for a more prosperous Christchurch. ChristchurchNZ works to a mission of igniting bold ambition for our city.§  §As part of delivering in this mission, ChristchurchNZ is working with Christchurch City Council and Development Christchurch Limited through funding and service level agreements to deliver priority urban development projects and functions through to 30 June 2021 as Development Christchurch Limited transitions from being an operational entity. In order to do this, ChristchurchNZ needs a talented and experienced Urban Development Leader to take on this pivotal role until 30 June 2021. Interested?§  §About the opportunity§With a direct reporting line to the Chief Executive of ChristchurchNZ; the Unit Head takes overall accountability for leading the delivery of the urban development activities agreed. Although a strong leader, you will be innately collaborative and will enjoy contributing to the development and execution of broader organisation-wide strategies alongside your colleagues; lending a hand and providing support as needed. jobText: TXT/50974848.txt	§Senior Design Lead§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Senior Design Lead§§Advertiser: §People Passion§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Nov 2020§§Location§§Auckland§, §Auckland Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Architecture§§§§§§Are you a creative looking for a new challenge? Does your portfolio aspire to look something like this? https://www.box.co.nz/architect-home-design-2/ Then we want to hear from you!§ §Box is a company with a mission to unify design and build skill sets, to bring back the concept of true 'Master Builder'. We started Box to fuse the businesses of architecture and construction - to get architects to start to think like builders and vice versa. You will be working as part of a diverse team of designers, builders QS's and project managers on some amazing residential projects with even more amazing clients.§ §Box delivered its first home in 2009 and has designed and built hundreds of homes all around New Zealand since. With lots of exciting projects in the pipeline, and continued growth projected, Box are on the hunt for a Senior Design Lead to work out of their modern Kingsland office.§ §We need a confident self-starter who is also a great collaborator, as well as ticking the following box(es):§ §You are:§ § §Passionate about design and architecture§ §A natural relationship builder§ §Flexible and adaptable§ §A collaborative worker, who enjoys bouncing ideas around§ §Highly organised with the ability to manage and meet deadlines§ §Focused on quality with an eye for detail§ §Driven and highly motivated to exceed expectations§ §You will:§ § §Have 10+ years’ experience in a similar role, working with residential builds§ §Inspire confidence in your clients from concept to completion, and everything in between§ §Know the ins and outs of Resource and Building Consent§ §Have an NZI registration (preferred not essential)§ §What’s in it for you?§ § §Work for an award-winning company with an outstanding reputation§ §Enjoy a fun, innovative and energetic work environment§ §Be inspired by a rewarding role where you will be constantly challenged and learning more!§ §Are you as excited as we are? If you are keen to join a business that is a game changer in the architect world, then let’s have a chat! Call our Recruitment Partner on 0800 HR FORU to find out more or apply online now with your CV and your portfolio.§§§§

jobText: TXT/50975254.txt	§20/496 UX Designer§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§20/496 UX Designer§§Advertiser: §Department of Internal Affairs§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§18 Nov 2020§§Location§§Wellington§, §Wellington Central§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Web & Interaction Design§§§§§§§§§  §    §      §20/496 UX Designer §      §      §      §        §          §            §Type:§ Fixed Term (12 Months)§Hours:§ Full time§Location:§ Wellington §Business Group§: AoG Services Delivery §Branch:§ Digital Public Service §Salary:§ $66,434 - $89,881§          §          §            §Digital Public Service Branch§            §Our public service is being called upon to deliver a unified, seamless and effective digital experience so that New Zealanders have the best possible experience of government. We are seeking experienced, strategic leaders to work with vision and influence to help enable and drive a strong, successful and connected digital public sector.  §            §A digital public service §            §            §This work is critical to creating the platform for government to respond to people’s expectations for faster, more agile, accessible and integrated digital services. §            §The branch achieves this by working across the public service to connect, influence and support the system to transform and better respond to the ever-changing digital landscape. It also supports the Government Chief Digital Officer (GCDO), whose work supports a modern adaptive public service to have the skills, technology and data to operate at pace and to meet changing needs. §            §This new role is a result of the All of Government Services Delivery (AoG SD) group redesign. §            §UX Designer§            §            §You'll have responsibility for bringing a human-centred approach to the design and development of our digital products including Govt.nz, Digital.govt.nz, and Data.govt.nz to ensure they meet the needs of New Zealanders. §            §You'll be working in a multi-disciplinary team environment to design and deliver digital design solutions that are underpinned by best practice techniques and New Zealand Government Web Standards.§            §To be successful in this role you will have experience:§            §              §designing for the web with a strong focus on user needs §              §the ability to present design ideas and to receive feedback with open-mindedness §              §designing and delivering best practice digital design solutions that meet New Zealand Government Web Standards §              §in UX principles and processes, user research, interaction and visual design, prototyping and usability testing §              §in digital design tools, for example Sketch, Figma, Invision, Adobe Suite §              §understanding HTML & CSS §              §collaborating with developers on implementation and development §              §working in an Agile framework§            §            § §You'll also have:§            §              §excellent interpersonal skills §              §a strong team-focus §              §creativity, empathy, passion and problem-solving skills. §            § democracy across central and local government§            §          §          §            §Applications close:§ 5pm, Sunday 29 November 2020 §For more information please contact:§ AoG SD Change jobText: TXT/50916597.txt	§Graphic Designer & Digital Coordinator, Fixed Term Maternity Relief§§More jobs from this company§§§§§§§§Job Description§§Job Header§§Graphic Designer & Digital Coordinator, Fixed Term Maternity Relief§§Advertiser: §Rangi Ruru Girls' School§§More jobs from this company§§§§Job Information§§Job Listing Date§§10 Nov 2020§§Location§§Canterbury§, §Christchurch§§Work Type§§Full Time§§Classification§§Design & Architecture§, §Graphic Design§§§§§§Rangi Ruru Girls’ School is one of New Zealand’s leading independent schools. Based in Merivale, Christchurch, we are a Year 7 – 13 school with around 650 students, including boarding for 130 onsite.§ §We are on the lookout for a graphic design and digital superstar to join our high performing Community Relations team. Reporting to the Communications Manager, you will be involved in all aspects of the creative process, responsible for producing visually stunning and engaging design across a range of mediums from print to digital. You will work closely with a team of skilled and professional marketing staff delivering campaigns and be an integral part of major projects in 2021. Together with the Communications Manager you will also be responsible for social media, EDM newsletters, digital asset management and SEO. You will be given the opportunity to take the lead, be included in a diverse range of projects and initiatives and be supported by a team focussed on leading the way and having fun whilst doing it.§ §With a design degree, you will know the Adobe Creative Cloud (especially Photoshop, InDesign & Illustrator) like the back of your hand and have a strong understanding of graphic design principles and typography. Your digital experience will include website CMS, social media and email marketing. Experience in Google Analytics, website projects, and photography/videography will be advantageous.§ §The role will be 9.00am – 4.00pm, Monday to Friday (32.5 hours per week), however this is flexible for the right candidate.§ §Visit rangiruru.school.nz/about-us/vacancies/ for the position description and school application form. Applications close at 4.00pm on Monday, 30 November 2020.§ §If you feel you possess the vision, energy and initiative required, please submit your cover letter of no more than 150 words, school application form, CV and portfolio and email Sue Smith Email:§s.smith@rangiruru.school.nz§ § §§§§The application form will include these questions:§§Which of the following statements best describes your right to work in New Zealand?§§§
